Title: 5 Best Rated Grill Smoker Combo To Buy On The Market 2018
Content:
The grill smoker combo might sound like a facade to many but we tell you, this baby is a beast and blessing all in one. It is a super effective and multifunctional equipment totally wiping out the stress of smoking and grilling separately on two pieces of equipment, as these combos are meant to serve these purposes all in one device. Most of these devices allow you to do more roasting and baking. For this reason, we urge you to chill out on your pockets because these combos are budget saving and do amazing jobs. In this review we look at 5 different brands of the best grill smokers combos, having chosen them as the bests of the bests basing their functionality on their construction & durability, food making size, quality of food results, temperature control, pricing, availability, and warranty offerings. Like many other products, there are quite a number of productions on sale. However, the question is, what is the best grill smoker combo for you that is long-lasting, efficient, and will save you a lot of money and stress. See this guide that teaches how to make the best of your grill smoker combo. These combos are one of the newest technologies to hit mother earth. So to aid you to make the best choice, here we have a list of the best combination grill smokers.
 [supsystic-tables id='1']

Reviews of The Best Grill Smoker Combo

1. Traeger Texas Elite 34 Grill & Smoker

The most rated grill smoker combo on the high side of the budget. However, we love the design of this machine which is sleek to give your grilling space that great look. Traeger offers the widest cooking surface area from our list. It is definitely a good choice for big parties. It was designed to be easy to use even by a grilling/smoking beginner. As this grill is powered by electricity supported by wood pellets, lighting the combo for use is effortless. It has a maximum temperature of 450°F giving just enough room to avoid high temperatures which is very important for anyone that isn’t familiar with how temperatures work. It is also well built with porcelain and powdered coated cold rolled steel which secures its durability for long lasting usage. The Traeger Company offers up to 3 years warranty when purchasing this combo.

Pros

  • Easily cleaned
  • Wide cooking surface area
  • Includes 4 wheels for easy mobility
  • Great for an entry-level user

Cons

  • Heavy for quick mobility
Check Price on Amazon

2. Pit Barrel Classic Cooker

With over 500 positive reviews on Amazon, this barrel is the most rated smoker grill. It is an 8-racked charcoal cooking unit with hanging hooks. Each grate serves a 240 square inch cooking surface area and cooks over 13 lbs. of the whole brisket in good timing. This is a great choice for big numbers and has a good stainless steel build which guarantees no rust - durability is secured! This home smoker grill is a 30-gallon drum coated with porcelain for resisting wear from weather changes and is designed to cook under good temperatures, spanning around 300°F. This top-rated smoker grill barrel guarantees an even cook and due to the science behind its design. An advantage to this combo is the product support offered by the Pit Barrel company offering up to a year’s warranty which is a great offer for its high quality and affordable cost.

Pros

  • Very easy to use
  • Simple but solid design
  • Affordable
  • Makes food for big numbers

Cons

  • Can only use a specific brand of charcoal
Check Price on Amazon

3. Woodwind Camp Chef Smoker Grill with Sear Box

Looking for something on the higher side of the budget? This device serves that purpose is large enough for big sized parties with its wood pellet fueling feature. This is worth the price! It comes with a sear box and a wide range of temperature options, ranging from 160°F to 500°F including a 900°F on the sear box. Most wood pellet grills are known to have bad grilling results but this one stays competitive as it is designed to solve this problem. Its built with a well thought out design that makes cleaning one of the easiest processes compared to many other high-end pellet grills. The grates are solidly made keeping you wow-ing at the beautiful marks on your food when done. For those not interested in staying by the fire while cooking, it is specifically built with automatic temperature controls that leave you to do other things while cooking. As a new invention with shortfalls in previous makes, this version is one of the great standards taking a lot of grilling needs into factor.

Pros

  • Easily lighted
  • Automatic temperature control
  • Wide cooking area size
  • 6 - tier functionality (smoke, bake, sear, BBQ, grill, and roast)

Cons

  • High temperatures could lead to burns
Check Price on Amazon

4. Pit Boss 71220 Kamado Smoker Grill

Kamado smoker grills are known to be very good heat insulators due to their ceramic build and this version of it is no exception. This ceramic grill smoker, which is the smaller size of the two kinds in production, serves as one of the best smoker grills for the money. Considering its make, you can be sure of stable temperature consistencies when smoking, grilling, searing or baking pizzas. The ceramic build holds and retains heat well, making food turn out nicely done and juicy. It is beautiful to look upon sitting in a 2 layer, stainless steel grill grate for adjusting food while cooking. Also an exterior thermometer and cast iron made damper - to make your control of temperatures seamless, a strong lid hinge, 304 square inches stainless steel cooking grid, and a free ash removal tool to clean up ash. We love this Egg which is of good pricing, easily available and has over 10 years warranty to it.

Pros

  • Stainless steel build
  • Added bamboo shelves for handling and storage
  • Added wheels for mobility and stability
  • Easy to read thermometer

Cons

  • Fragile due to ceramic make
Check Price on Amazon

5. Char-Broil TRU Smoker Grill

This combo is a 3-tier functional device; smoking, grilling and roasting. It seems fancy at first glance but is a super power cooker for evenly cooked meals without charcoal or oil. This wood smoker sits in 3 layers of grate which can cook up to 25 lbs. of food by infrared which keeps food properly seared on the outside and done on the inside but juicy as you will imagine. It has a modern look with an internal smoker box to fill in wood chips that are used to support its infrared or grill form of cooking. The strongest advantage of this device is its design which avoids flare ups when cooking which makes it safe to use and avoids food burns. It is a very affordable grill smoker with an average pricing under $500 and it is the perfect home smoker grill for individual use or for a small family. One other cool feature is that it is easily assembled.

Pros

  • Infrared and grilling options for cooking
  • Sizable for easy mobility
  • Very affordable for the good job it does

Cons

  • Weak in build and easily rusted
Check Price on Amazon

Our Top Rated Combo

Having done this review, what is the best smoker grill to buy? We will go for the Traegar Texas Elite 34 Grill & Smoker!! This is the best grill smoker combo because it serves the purpose of all the other 5 combos perfectly with the widest cooking surface area, its electricity usage for safety, its durability and long-term warranty. This budget device is sure to last for a long time and will serve you for when you have a larger family size. It is perfect for making food for big parties. It’s temperature control makes safety a key factor for its operation and for this reason, even a beginner is rest assured while using this device. To read even further and find out more about this subject, take another look at The Best Gas Charcoal Grill Combos to complete all your research correctly!

Why buy a grill smoker combo?

Introduction

Before we dive in deeper, you might be wondering what these machines do for the newbies to grilling/ smoking. These types of equipment are nothing more than a smoker and a griller combined into one to better serve the purpose of a smoker, a griller, a roaster and more in some cases.

Trend

Grilling, smoking, roasting are key cooking methods for making sumptuous foods these days, hence, why having one of these pieces of equipment is as good as having a stove. You might find yourself wanting to learn new recipes of which many will need the use of this device. It’s just the destination the world is headed to. Get with the times and join the modern world of smoking and grilling!

Budget Friendly

They are well designed and are made in a variety of affordable options if you are concerned about cashing out on another piece of equipment. In the long term, you will only realize that having bought this combination has saved you a lot more money than coping with single-purpose devices.

Space Essence

The days of stocking your backyard with single functional equipment are over. These multifunctional modern technologies are cost effective and space saving. For this reason, your worries about where to keep such equipment is over as this is an all-in-one and will beautify your backyard.

Learning Benefit

If you are entirely new to smoking or grilling, consider getting one of these babies. We suggest this because these devices are designed to keep you safe when using them. Why not explore them since they give you the flare to cook your meals in a safe, healthy and delicious way.

The Party Plus

You may say you are an introvert and this does not apply to you. Trust us, the party day is drawing very close. Outdoor parties without an option of smoking and grilling could render your party unentertaining. So to avoid disappointments, invest in one of these.

What should you look out for when buying a grill smoker combo?

Is it versatile in function?

This is what this device is all about, the ability to smoke, grill and do more possibly. Anything less than this is not a smoker grill combo.

Can you make more food at a go?

Determine the number of people you are likely to feed and purchase a device that serves this need. With all the functions this device serves you will be able to not only feed more people but also cook more food than you would ever need.

Is it reasonably priced?

Aim for an option that works with your budget and satisfies your needs as well. Not necessarily cheap as you will get cheap and stressful results, and not costly which is inspired by brand names.

Are temperatures easily controlled with it?

The device should clearly have a thermometer inward or outward to help you control temperatures with ease. There should be enough vents/dampers to aid this process as well. Anything not in this category, ignore it, otherwise, your hands might be the item for grilling.

Are it and its parts easy to find?

Amazon is a great way to check for this. Some brands restrict the availability of their products to some dealerships which could be time-consuming when looking for a grill smoker combo. This means if you need to change some parts of the combo after a while, you are sure to face the same difficulty finding them. Choose combos that are readily available in an open market backed by a virtual community for your easy finds. Check for warranties of at least 1 year. Companies that offer no warranties cannot be relied on. You might have a manufacturing fault after your purchase and the warranty will come in handy.

Title: 5 Best Budget & Inexpensive Gas Grills Under $200 in 2018
Content:
Grilled food is delicious. And if you’re reading this, it’s probably because you think so too. Besides, grilling can be a fun activity that friends and family can take part in. However, what you might not be aware of is that gas grills can be quite cost-effective too. In fact, you can get quite a few high functioning and well-made models of this equipment for under $200. The competitive price point of gas grills is what makes them excel over charcoal smokers to a considerable extent. Now, you must be thinking about which grill you should purchase. To make it easier for you to choose one, we’ve put together a list of the Best Gas Grills under $200 that are out there. [supsystic-tables id=3]

Reviews of the Best Gas Grills under $200

1. Char-Griller 3001 Grillin' Pro Gas Grill

The 3001 Grillin’ Pro is made by Char-Griller, a Georgia-based charcoal, and griller that produces Japanese style stoves and kettles as well. This grill is very well built. The look and feel on it is kind of a barrel made grill, but it is very nice. You would think it is a rather more expensive grill. But the price point is just below $200. It is a very capable grill, with a rather large cooking surface area and it also includes a warming rack with a side burner, so you can grill and cook a side dish at the same time. This is surely a grill you can do a lot on. It also has a side shelf that can be used as a handy workspace. Utensil hooks on the shelf will leave you all the free space that you need to prepare your food before cooking it. This grill is for the more heavy-duty grillers out there. As we said, the build quality on it is very nice, with porcelain coated, cast iron cooking grates and a body made of steel which is powder coated for longtime outdoor use. This grill is built to last. It will withstand the test of weather and time, even when left out in the snow with no cover on. This grill can deliver the power to heat up quite quickly and get you grilling in no time with its three big burners to cover all the grill space. The handle on the cover stays cool so you can easily check on how the grilling is going at any time. But you will need to have plenty of room because this grill is not small. It is also on the heavy side at almost 90 pounds, so you probably won’t be moving it around that often.

Pros

  • Perfect for outdoor use
  • Quality cooking grates
  • Lots of space

Cons

  • Tricky Temperature control
  • Inconvenient gas access
  • Complicated Assembly
Check Price on Amazon

2. Char-Broil Classic 360 3-Burner Liquid Propane Gas Grill

Now, this one is really durable for such a low cost. The Classic 360 degree 3-Burner grill comes from Char-Broil which has been making grills and burners that use charcoal, gas, and electricity since 1948, so they have a lot of experience and definitely know what they’re doing. We think this is a great 3-burner gas grill under $200. It is a stylish, very solid build in stainless steel and features porcelain-coated grates and burners, which makes it resistant to rust and is a lot less work to clean. The main surface provides ample cooking surface area. It also has a swing-away rack that can be used for keeping food warm or as a secondary cooking area. The two metallic side shelves give you plenty of space for preparation while also holding your cooking utensils. This inexpensive gas grill is a great one for the value. You could also get it with a side burner for cooking something at the same time as you’re grilling. The version with the side burner is listed at the same price, so it’s really a matter of which one you prefer. Although it is not designed as portable equipment, this one is light enough to be loaded up into the back of your truck if you’re going camping. It’s also good as a starter grill, in case you’re not sure if you will really use this equipment that often and want to try one before investing in a more expensive one.

Pros

  • Stylish design and quality build
  • Good flame control
  • Easy to assemble

Cons

  • No cover included
  • No thermometer included
  • Side shelves do not fold
Check Price on Amazon

3. Master Cook Classic Smart Space Living 3 Burner LP Gas Grill

Let’s take a look at another interesting one. The grill from MasterCook is also an excellent outdoor gas grill under $200. This model has a few things in common with the Char-Broil Classic 360 in terms of features and design. But, as you will see, there are also some important differences between the two. It has a cooking surface area over which you can accommodate large meals. And affordable gas grill doesn’t have to mean cheaply constructed. This grill features wire cooking grates that have been coated with porcelain, a stainless steel handle, two foldable side shelves that can be used for prep space, a rack to keep food warm and two heavy duty 6-inch wheel casters for portability. The lid and the firebox are built in stainless steel coated in porcelain and is made to stand up to tough weather. This product has been designed with an outdoor state of mind. It also has the capacity to heat up pretty quickly. With all that being said, setting up this one can be a little tricky. Also, a few users are of the opinion that the starter unit often disappoints in terms of its promised functional ability.

Pros

  • Easy to read Thermometer
  • Space efficient

Cons

  • Hard to assemble
  • Starter unit errors
Check Price on Amazon

4. Char-Broil Portable 240 Liquid Propane Gas Grill

Now for one that can be used for on-the-go grilling. This Liquid Propane Grill also comes from Char-Broil, so you know you’re getting a product built with all the knowledge and experience that this company has. This is one of the best portable grills under $200 and is ideal for tailgating, camping or grilling at the beach. You just need a 1-pound propane gas tank to power up the single burner. It only weighs 22 pounds and it has a carrying handle, which makes it easy to transport. It has a cooking surface area which is large enough to fit about 6 to 8 burger patties. The body is built with painted porcelain and has sturdy legs allowing for it to be used on a table, on the ground or even at the beach.

Pros

  • Easy flame control
  • Easy to read Temperature gauge
  • Cool to touch grill

Cons

  • Large carrying handle
  • No secure lid
Check Price on Amazon

5. Cuisinart CGG-180TB Petit Gourmet Portable Tabletop Gas Grill

This is a fully portable, small-sized grill intended to deliver great performance, so you won’t miss grilling on a full-sized one. It is made by Cuisinart, a company that has been manufacturing all sorts of kitchen appliances for about 45 years and has become a universally recognized name. This is a grill that is solid and meant to be durable. Because of its small size, it is perfect for situations where space is limited, such as when using on small decks, RVs or boats. The small size also helps keep the heat near the cooking surface area which makes it more energy and fuel efficient than large grills. It heats up pretty quickly and will also cool off quickly. Weighing only 12 pounds and with carrying handle included, this grill is so easily moved around that it’s great for taking it whenever and wherever you need to. The foldable legs allow for easy storage when the unit is not in use. This is a great grill for you if you regularly take camping trips, go fishing, hiking or if you enjoy grilling on the beach, or even if you usually grill out in your front lawn. It is compact, but sturdy enough to cook whatever is thrown at it with no problem. It’s also easily cleaned, with a removable grate that can be put in the dishwasher.

Pros

  • Light and portable
  • Locking secure lid
  • Easy assembly
  • Color changeable

Cons

  • Small drip pan
  • No thermometer included
Check Price on Amazon

To wrap it up

There you have it. We’ve reviewed the top rated Gas Grills under $200 that you can buy in 2018. We’ve covered some of the most heavy-duty grills as well as some of the lightest and most portable. What all of these grills have in common is that they’re all affordable and provide a nice set of features for their price point. You don’t have to break the bank if you want to get a good gas grill. But, what is the best gas grill under $200 that you can buy? Well, it really depends on you. We can tell you that as far as reasonably priced outdoor grills go, we really liked Char-Griller 3001 Grillin' Pro. It has all the essential features and is well constructed. But that is the most expensive grill on in our list, so if you want the best product for your tight budget, you might want to try something smaller that can also get the job done. The Cuisinart CGG-180 Petit Gourmet, which is small, lightweight, easy to carry around and even costs less than $100. So, if you’re into grilling but don’t want to mess with charcoal, you should think about getting a gas grill soon.

Factors to Consider While Choosing a Gas Grill under $200

Choosing this equipment requires you to consider a few aspects. Generally speaking, while the price range of the products can vary widely, spending about $150 to $200 on a grill seems more than reasonable for all the features that you want.

Find out if it runs on natural gas or propane

When comparing prices check the fuel type your grill facilitates. Natural gas grills require a gas line at the grill location. Many of these are available in either configuration but running a propane grill on a natural gas and vice versa are not allowed. You should consider getting a natural gas conversion kit priced between $50 to $100. Natural gas is hassle-free and less expensive than its counterpart.

Check the material

The ones under $200 are usually made of stainless steel, which is the preferred material for any professional cooking equipment. However, make sure that not only the body of the grill but also the frame are made of stainless steel and not materials such as cast aluminium.

Size should be determined by your grilling objectives

A decent sized grill with considerable cooking space is available under $200. Choose the size depending on how many people you are planning to cook for and in what quantity. The deciding factor should be based on convenience with a cooking surface area for grilling.

Gas Grills are safe, easy and convenient

Grills offer some benefits over charcoal grills. Gas grilling is extremely convenient. You have the ability to control the flame and temperature, at the turn of a knob. Gas grilling is also clean and quick. There is no messing around with briquettes, no handling of smelly starter fluid and no waiting around for the coals to get hot. In addition, once you’re done grilling, there are no ashes left behind to clean up. You simply turn it off and run a metal brush through it or stick the grates in the dishwasher and you’re done. If it is convenience and cost-effectiveness that you’re after, then this kind of product is the right choice.
_yoast_wpseo_title: 5 Best Gas Grills Under $200: Cheap & Inexpensive (%%currentmonth%% %%currentyear%%)

Title: Top Rated 5 Gas Grills Under 500 Dollars In 2018
Content:
Are you in the market for a grill that won’t break the bank? Maybe you want to start hosting events and parties at your house and want to accommodate your guests with the best food you are able to put forth. Or maybe you just want the option to grill your foods in the privacy of your own home. This article will help you to find the best purchasing options for the best gas grill under $500. If you love to grill and are looking to purchase one, then you have come to the right place! Buying a grill can seem quite daunting. Especially if you don’t know what you are looking for or have a good idea of what grill will best fit your needs. There are many different options available to you and each grill is designed to fit a different function. For a beginner, the best option to choose will be a gas grill. The reason being is the convenience and easy to follow the functions they provide. Gas grills are also cheaper to maintain than most other grills. A single propane tank could last you all summer if you are only grilling 2-3 times per week. The cleaning and upkeep will be minimal at best as well. We know there are many different models out there. So here is a list of the Best Gas Grills under $500 in 2018. [supsystic-tables id=7]  

Reviews of the Best Gas Grills under $500 for 2018

1. Char-Broil Signature TRU-Infrared 325 2-Burner Cabinet Liquid Propane Gas Grill

Let’s begin with a great budget grill produced by Char-Broil. This grill is a much smaller sized grill but is still a great option to fulfill your grilling needs. Char-Broil is a company that has been creating grills and burners of all types for over 70 years, so it’s sure to be a well-designed quality product. This elegant and sturdy built grill provides a large main cooking surface area. It also features two stainless steel tube burners with porcelain-coated cast iron grates, which makes them resistant to rust and very easy to clean. It also includes a swing-away rack where you can keep food warm or use as a secondary cooking area. The equipped thermometer goes only up to 650 F, but there really is not any food you will be cooking that will exceed a temperature of 500 degrees. It has two metallic side shelves that give you plenty of space for preparing your food or for keeping your cooking utensils. These shelves can be folded down so that it’s easier to move your grill around or for when you need to store it. One of the selling points of this grill is the Char-Broil TRU-Infrared cooking system, which allows for better temperature control and distributes heat evenly across the cooking surface area. This will ensure your food to not only cook faster and more evenly but also use less gas. You can also convert this grill from propane to the best natural gas grill under $500 with a conversion kit, which is sold separately. Considering all its features, this is definitely the best gas grill for the money.

Pros

  • Great build quality
  • Infrared technology cooks food faster
  • Can be converted to natural gas

Cons

  • The included thermometer only goes up to 650 F
Check Price on Amazon

2. Fuego Element F21C Carbon Steel Gas Grill

This cheap grill is sure to turn some heads. The Fuego Element model has a very interesting design. If you saw it at the store you would probably think to yourself, “What on Earth is that?” It looks more like something ready to be launched into space rather than something you would use for cooking. Although it looks very compact from the outside, it retains enormous space on the inside. Even with its small footprint, it has a large cooking surface area with a porcelain enameled cast iron cooking grate. With its powerful burners, this grill can reach very high temperatures in a short amount of time. The actual design is not just about how it looks but also about providing balanced heat when cooking. With the usage of two circular burners and a semi-spherical cover, heat is allowed to flow evenly inside the grill. Not only is it compact but it’s also very light allowing it to be moved around easily using the included wheels, which also lock when you need to provide stability. This absolutely is one of the best gas grills under $400. If you live in an apartment or have limited patio space available then this is the grill for you. Its small size makes it the perfect grill if you are a little bit space-constrained.

Pros

  • Unique, stylish design
  • It does not take up much space
  • Easy assembly

Cons

  • Does not include a cover
  • The lid handle gets very hot
  • Not fit to stay outside all the time
Check Price on Amazon

3. Weber 46100001 Spirit S210 Liquid Propane Gas Grill

This grill does not come cheap but does get you more bang for your buck. The best propane grill for under $500 features a stylish and durable stainless steel design. You’re sure to be enjoying this grill for many years to come. Weber has been making grills for over 50 years, so they know a little bit about it, and it shows. The grill has two powerful burners also made of stainless steel, which can be controlled individually with knobs that rotate 270 degrees providing a much better heat control. The burners are sufficiently spaced to cover the entire cooking surface area. The burners provide evenly-distributed heat across porcelain enameled cast iron cooking grates which can be used in any sort of weather and are easy to clean. It has plenty of grilling space to make use of its beefy burners. The grill includes a warming rack as well as two foldable side panels with hooks for extra preparation space. Having said that, the hanging hooks are not too conveniently designed but can be utilized in an array of fashions. The superior-quality materials this grill is created from require little to no maintenance making it perfect for outdoor use all year round. This grill is made to resist the outdoor elements ensuring that it lasts a long time. The perfect combination of style and performance. A fuel gauge is also included, so you always know precisely how much you have available. With all that is has to offer, this sure is one of the best propane grills under $500.

Pros

  • Durable & weather resistant construction
  • Enough space for grilling
  • Fuel gauge

Cons

  • One igniter for the two burners
  • It’s a little difficult to get the gas tank in
  • Inconvenient design of the hanging hooks
Check Price on Amazon

4. Char-Broil Classic 4-Burner Gas Grill with Side Burner

This beautiful grill is manufactured by Char-Broil. A very long time standing company that knows what they are doing when it comes to grills and smokers. This is one of the more classic styled, powerful, mid-priced grills coming in right under $500. The four burners deliver a lot of heating power across the spacious main cooking surface area. And we mean a lot of power. In terms of BTU, this is the most powerful grill on the market. It also has the largest cooking surface area, so it does need all that power. This grill has it all in terms of features! In fact, it has some features that you may not even find in the more expensive grills. The all metal grill with a stainless steel lid features a handle and panel for durability with a stylish look. The spacious primary cooking surface area is made of porcelain coated cast iron grates. And in case its large size is not enough, it also has a swing-away secondary cooking surface also coated in porcelain. In addition, it comes equipped with a side burner so you can cook your favorite side dishes and sauces while you’re grilling. If you need more preparation space, the side burner has a lid so it can double as a side panel. Since the grill is very large and heavy it comes equipped with wheels in case you ever need to move it around.

Pros

  • Durable, sturdy metal build
  • A large cooking area with enough power
  • Easy to set up

Cons

  • Large size takes a lot of space
  • It’s heavy, so it’s not easy to move around
  • Side panels do not fold down
  • Difficult access to the propane gas.
Check Price on Amazon

5. Master Cook Outdoor BBQ 4-Burner Cabinet Propane Gas Grill with Side Burner

This grill features a four-burner system for those looking to grill with the maximum amount of power. It is manufactured by Master Cook and is very similar in style and features to the one we just discussed. The price point is also very similar. This is not only a high-performance grill but also contains high durability. The lid, UFC, and fascia are all constructed in stainless steel so it’s tough enough to face any weather. The four tube burners provide evenly-distributed heat across all the main cooking surface areas equipped with heavy duty cast iron grates. There is also a secondary porcelain coated cooking rack for warming up or cooking foods that don’t require direct heat. There are two side panels which include a side burner that can be covered, doubling as use for extra working space. Hooks are provided to hang your cooking utensils as well. But no two grills are exactly the same. Naturally, there are some differences. This grill is large, but not too heavy, so moving around shouldn’t be too much of a chore. It includes four wheels for this purpose. It also provides a large storage cabinet with doors, which means you don’t have to go around your grill to reach what’s inside.

Pros

  • Precise temperature controls for easy adjustment
  • Produces a bluer flame, which cooks better
  • Storage cabinet accessible from the front

Cons

  • Side panels are not foldable
  • Large size not suitable for small decks or patios
Check Price on Amazon

So, what's the best gas grill under $500?

So we have covered the best Gas Grills under $500 that are available for purchase in 2018. We’ve gone from the grills that strongly favor style to grills that are more about performance. All of these grills are budget-friendly, so you don’t have to break the bank to acquire a nice model fit to suit your grilling needs. Determining the best grill under $500 for 2018 is really up to you. Make sure you make a list of the features you are wanting to best suit your needs before making a positive decision on a new grill. We can tell you that the Char-Broil four-burner is a great grill for its value and contains lots of cooking space where you can grill for the whole family or at any gathering. But of course, there other considerations to be taken into account such as space availability and mobility. The Char-Broil is not the best choice if you require a grill with these characteristics. In that case, you’d be better off with something like the Fuego Element grill. We want to make sure you have all your ducks in a row and have been educated on all the details and functions before you make a decision on which grill to purchase. Whether it’s your first grill or if you are wanting to replace an older model, spend the time to research before you pull the trigger on the best gas grill under $500.

What Can You Expect from Gas Grills under $500?

Of course, you could always go with the classic charcoal grill. But there is so much more work that goes into charcoal grilling. You have to buy charcoal briquets and lighter fluid for everytime you grill. Plus in order to start the grill, you will have to wait about twenty minutes. There will also be a lot of cleanups involved such as disposal of the grease and charcoal ash pans. With a gas grill, certain functions automatically trump the charcoal grill for convenience and time. One button to start with no waiting. One tank to be purchased for hours of grilling. And lastly, no cleanup. Now don’t think that if you buy a cheaper grill you won’t have all the bells and whistles that come with an expensive grill. A grill with a reasonable price point can still feature a stylish design and withstand tough weather. Some of these grill options can also be space efficient and light. Spending money on a bbq grill under 500 dollars will get you some of the most advanced gas grill models currently available. So, what are some of the things to consider when purchasing one? Let’s take a quick look:

The Special Features

Most grills come equipped with the most basic needs. And there are some that can come with an array of special features. Your best bet is to choose a grill that comes with special features that fit your cooking style. If you want to cook all types of meat at once, go for one with infinite control valve adjustability. Some grills come equipped with a hot box connected to the side of the grill which uses indirect heat allowing you to smoke meats like Pork shoulder and beef brisket. Other grills have stovetops connected to them which allows you to cook with a skillet or pot while grilling at the same time.

The Cooking Surface Area

The cooking area is one of the most important aspects of a gas grill. The number of people you plan on cooking for will give you a good idea. Obtaining a grill with enough cooking surface space will help you to fulfill your home party and BBQ needs.

The Size

The actual size of a grill can range from compact and portable to very large which can become difficult to maneuver. Choosing the correct grill size also directly correlates with the grill’s cooking surface area. So, keeping all these factors in mind, let’s check out the best value gas grills above. Good luck to you and happy grilling!

Title: 5 Best Portable Gas Grills 2018: For Tailgating, RVs & Camping
Content:
Grilling is more fun when you do it outdoors and cook up some delicious snacks even in remote places. So, here is a list of the best portable gas grills reviewed for you to be the expert grill master outside home too. Grilling is always fun and grilled food is delicious. But why limit yourself to grilling only at your house or at your apartment. It’s also nice to enjoy juicy grilled food on camping and fishing trips, or at the beach, right? Well, not to worry. We have a list of the best portable gas grills for 2018 here. These are well-made, durable and nice gas grills that are made with the adventurous griller in mind, so you can take it with you and enjoy your favorite food in every outing. So, here goes the list. [supsystic-tables id=8] [su_expand more_text="View more" less_text="View less" height="420" hide_less="no" text_color="#3a3a3a" link_color="#cdcdcd" link_style="default" link_align="center" more_icon="chevron-down" less_icon="chevron-up" class="customz"]

Why Should You Buy a Portable Gas Grill?

Like we said, grilling is fun. If you’re here, you know that. But if you own a large, outdoor grill, you also know that those things are not the easiest to move around. You can probably move it around in your house, take from the patio to your garage if you want to put it away, but if you ever want to go camping or hiking, then you know you will not be hauling that thing behind. And it probably won’t even fit in your car unless you have a large truck. For those times when you’re out and about with your family or friends, but you still want to have delicious stakes, burgers and grilled vegetables, a portable grill is ideal.

Easy Fitting

Portable gas grills are easy to carry around, will fit almost anywhere and you can get a decent one even if you’re on a budget.

Extremely Versatile

Plus, they’re also versatile. Most of them can use either small, disposable propane tanks or the larger ones. That means they’re not just good for when you want to carry them around, but also for when you’re constrained for space. You can use one of this on a boat, on your apartment balcony or your RV. [/su_expand] [su_expand more_text="View more" less_text="View less" height="420" hide_less="no" text_color="#3a3a3a" link_color="#cdcdcd" link_style="default" link_align="center" more_icon="chevron-down" less_icon="chevron-up" class="customz"]

What Features to Look for in Your Portable Gas Grill?

Portable gas grills come with an array of features. You need to decide on which features are must in your unit and what you can probably do away with. Now, your choice of a portable griller should be determined by factors like how frequent will you be using it, usually for how many people and so on. Accordingly, some of the features are:

Temperature Control

To maintain portability, the units usually have one temperature control. This is fine as long as you are choosing a single burner one. For those with 2 burners, two separate temperature controls are necessary to adjust accordingly.

Number of Burners

Well, portable grills with one burner can satisfactorily fulfill your grilling needs in a picnic and so on. However, if you wish to cook meat and vegetables together, it is wiser to go for the ones with 2 burners so that you can adjust the temperature for the desired result.

Grates Quality

The more quality made the grates are, the better will they be able to keep the heat in the cooking area. You have the option of choosing grates made of nickel, chrome, cast iron or stainless steel.

Cooking Area

Portable grills come with a range of cooking surface area with the standard being around 220-250 or less for some really portable ones. Go for one with a larger cooking surface if you are planning to use the unit often for picnic, tailgating and more of such outdoor uses. [/su_expand]

Reviews of the Best Portable Gas Grills for 2018

1. Char-Broil Grill2Go X200 Portable TRU-Infrared Liquid Propane Gas Grill 

One company that has been making that has been making grills and burners for seventy years is Char-Broil. All those years of experience means that they know grills and they have sure put out some great ones, like this particular Char-Broil model. This is a grill meant for the adventurous grillers. It has a sturdy, rugged built, which makes it appropriate and great for camping, the beach, or to take on any kind of excursion. The firebox and the lid are made from cast aluminum and stainless steel grilling grate and lid latches, and it has heat-resistant carrying handles on both sides. It has a simple and lightweight table top design, so you can just relax or do other things while your food is grilling. The top handle is designed to let you open the hinged lid easily. The grill also includes the Char-Broil TRU-Infrared cooking system, which uses radiant heat instead of convective heat to cook your food, which cooks food faster and without drying it. You can cook a steak in 5 minutes and it will come out with all its juices and flavors. This Char-Broil grill can also be converted for use with a 20 lb. gas tank, in case you want to use it in a limited space environment, but won’t necessarily be moving it around a lot.

Pros

  • Rugged construction
  • Infrared technology cooks food faster
  • Can be converted to use a 20lb gas tank

Cons

  • Gets really hot on the outside
  • Cooking temparature can be tricky to control

2. Napoleon TQ285X-BL Portable Propane Grill with Cart 

The unit looks great and works even better. The manufacturer has been making grills for over thirty years, so they should know a thing or two about them by now. This one is a looker. It has a stylish blue color design and it even comes with a cart, so you have support and mobility right there. The cart’s legs are foldable, so this makes this one the best portable gas grill for apartment balcony. After you use it, you can easily put it away. But don’t think you won’t be taking this one out. The wheels are all terrain, so you can just as well take this grill with when you’re picnicking or tailgating. It also has two side shelves, giving you room to prepare your food or to hang your utensils. This is a powerful little grill, too. It has two stainless steel burners to deliver enough heat for you to cook lots of food at once. Its heavy weight can be bit of a problem when it comes to its portability though.

Cons

3. Solaire Anywhere Portable Infrared Propane Gas Grill

This unit from Solitaire is definitely not cheap. As grill prices go, this will cost you more than some larger gas grills. But there is a reason for that. This is the most powerful grill in our list, and no doubt the first you’ll think when you see it is “Quality”. The grill has a straightforward design. It has a commercial grade stainless steel construction that is all welded, so it’s very robust and there are no little hinge pieces that could come off. It features V-shaped stainless steel grids, with infrared technology. This combination reduces flare-ups and keeps food flavor when it’s cooked. The grill provides lots of evenly-distributed heat, all the while remaining compact. This certainly is a top-rated portable gas grill, with a burner design that is the same as the one used in restaurants. So, you’ll have professional quality, juicy food anywhere.

The unit is a super portable grill with a sturdy, ergonomic design and the performance that users of Weber grills have somewhat come to expect. It has large grip and side handles and sturdy front and rear cradles, porcelain enameled cast iron cooking grates that heat up quickly and cook evenly. The body and lid are made of durable, light-weight cast aluminum. The grates are split, so you can remove one and, with the right griddle, you can have a grate/griddle cooking combination. However, the absence of a thermometer for temperature control can be a bit difficult especially, for the beginners. The weight and size of this grill are definitely meant for portability. But even though it is designed to be moved around, like the other portable grills featured in this list, it can be adapted to be used with larger gas tank. This little grill is also the perfect portable grill for RV.

5. Cuisinart CGG-180TB Petit Gourmet Portable Tabletop Gas Grill

The model from Cuisinart is the best small portable grill and it’s meant to deliver great performance. Cuisinart is a company that has made a name for itself in manufacturing all sorts of kitchen appliances for almost five decades. Because of its small size, this grill is perfect for situations where space is limited, as well as situations where you need to grill on the go, while you’re camping or at the beach. It weighs less than 12 pounds and includes a carrying handle. This grill is so easily moved around and it’s great for taking it with you whenever and wherever you need to. The foldable legs allow for easy storage when you’re not using it. This is a great grill for all your fishing and hiking trips, or if you just like grilling out in your front lawn. It is compact, but sturdy enough and will cook whatever is thrown at it with no problems. It’s also easily cleaned, with a removable grate that you can throw in the dishwasher.

To sum up

These are what we think the Best Portable Gas grills for 2018. We’ve gone from the ones that strongly favor style, to the ones that are more about performance. So, which one is the best or the most recommended? We think the Napoleon is pretty cool. It has a sleek design that doesn’t compromise durability, and it includes a cart with wheels, so that you can move it around and you don’t have to worry about finding a place to put it on. But it can also feel heavy at times. If it’s portability you’re after above everything else, then the Cuisinart is for you. It’s super light and is also resistant, so it can be taken anywhere. You have the last word, but we want you to have all the info on what portable propane grill you can purchase for all those times when you’re out somewhere and just want to have a burger made by yourself. Title: How To Use A Smoker Grill In 8 Steps With Pictures
Content:
Having read about what a smoker grill is all about, how about some knowledge on how to use it? Smoking or grilling meat are two of the best ways for cooking meat; smoking takes a slow and longer cooking approach in doing this but retains smoky flavors in the food through indirect heat. Grilling, on the hand, locks in flavoring spices in the meat and cooks it faster through direct heat. Explore further to know how to use a smoker grill.

1. Get a smoker grill

First things first, you will need a smoker grill to start off with. Our review shares a guide on what to look out for when getting one. You can choose from the list of smoker grills shared too or any other that suits your needs.

2. Prepare your smoker grill

Fill the firebox with charcoal pieces and light them. Soak wood chippings (without chemicals) in water for 30 minutes and then add the soaked wood unto the lighted coals to smoke up the grill. Preheat the equipment to a temperature of 400 °F and then reduce it to 225 °F to 250 °F when ready to start cooking. This allows the grill to be uncontaminated and ready to use.

3. Create moisture and extra flavoring for your meat.

Pour water into a hard foil bowl, and add a few herbs and spices to it. Place this bowl under the grill grate, directly under the meat (which will be on the grill grate). This process will create moist for the meat and will also aid in sitting in the smoky and spice flavors from the wood chippings. It is a rare trick for getting juicy flavored meat.

4. Get the meat on.

Place your marinated meat on the grill grate over the spiced water, ensure temperatures are between 225 °F to 250 °F depending on the level of doneness you are expecting to achieve, and the size of the meat.

5. Close the lid

Afterwards, close the grill and leave the meat to cook. Leave food to cook for 1 to 1 ½ hours per pound. Keep the lid closed during this period to maintain a consistent temperature. Opening the lid while cooking will cause heat loss which could affect the doneness of the food.

6. Control temperatures

Regulate airflow while cooking to control temperatures using the dampers at the top and bottom of the grill. Opening the upper damper will release air from the grill and will reduce the temperature while opening the lower damper will allow more air to the fire and increase the heat. You can also adjust airflow by how wide or narrow you open each damper.

Upper damper

Bottom damper

 

7. Check food and fuel

Open the lid and check food every once an hour. Use a meat thermometer to check the doneness of the food ensuring that the internal temperatures of the food are right. This is also a good time to refill the water basin under the food if necessary, and also, add some more fuel into the smoker box if the food is not done yet.

8. Clean and serve

Once the meat is ready, remove it and place it aside to cool. Clean the grill grate while still warm with a steel brush. Both options help with an easier clean. Serve the food when cooled slightly and enjoy!  

*Source

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZKSg33lX-HM

Tips and tricks for getting the best of your smoker grill

Your smoke grill can last you a long time with food always turning out at the right level of doneness and flavors. You, however, will need to know a few things to make these happen:

Always prepare your grill before usage

- Preheat your grill always before cooking. - After, adjust the heat to your desired temperature for cooking.

Choose the best form of fuel for the perfect result

- Always use brand new charcoal pieces when making your fire. Previously used charcoal will burn down too quickly which will affect the temperatures when cooking. - Use the right kind of wood - you can ask the butcher for the best options to use, they know better. - Enhance the aroma of your food with flavored woods. You can find them in various flavors, eg; cherry, apple cider, maple, oak amongst others. Choose the best flavor that sits well with you.

Little trick on managing temperatures

- Start cooking with low fire to high fire to build up the right temperatures needed. - Always have a bottle of water near you to quench wide spreading fires in your firebox.

Getting the best of your food

- Leave all the fat on the meat when grilling, they will melt and drip into the fire which will create good smoke to improve the flavor of the meat. - When searing meat, allow the grill grate to sear the meat on one side fully, then flip the meat and repeat. This will create a beautiful look on the meat.

Save the grates and grill from rust

- Inasmuch you may want to retain some flavors in your smoker grill, debris and grease may gather at the bottom. Clean it once every few times to avoid it. - Oil the bottom and outer parts of your grill with vegetable oil after cleaning it to avoid rust.

Title: 5 Best Small Gas Grills In 2018: For Camping, Balconies & Apartments
Content:
No matter how much you love your patio grill, one thing is for sure: there are times when you’re away from your home and wish you could have it right there with you. Well, with these best small gas grills, you can. These grills are small and light enough for you to take them with you anywhere. Camping, tailgating, anything. Take it with you on your fishing trip and you can cook your catch right there. Whether you already own a large grill, or just want to purchase your first grill, a small grill might be something to look into. Let’s take a look at the complete reviews of some of these. [supsystic-tables id=9]

Is a Small Gas Grill as Smart Investment?

A full-sized grill can be an oasis of features. If you’re a serious griller, you might feel that you can only get a good grilling out of one of those full-sized grills. But that might not be true. Small propane grills have become so rich in features that they can almost replace larger grills. And there’s even a plus. Something you can do with a tiny grill that you can’t do with a large one: take it with you anywhere.

Light Weight and Portability

Full-sized grills are usually heavy, so you wouldn’t think of loading one up in your car and take it on a camping trip. Maybe it wouldn’t even fit your car, unless you drive a large pick-up truck. And even then, carrying all that weight might be cumbersome, at the very least. Also, you might have just a small backyard with your studio apartment and not too much of space to set up an elaborate barbecue. That’s where mini gas grills come in. They’re large enough for use in your backyard, but small enough that you can actually carry them around.

Standard Features and Build Quality

Unlike the common misconception that being smaller in size implies less potential, compact gas grills can actually be as powerful as the larger ones. And they don’t really compromise in features or build quality.

Cost-Effective

Besides, small bbq grills are never as costly as larger grills, they're much cheaper. So, they’re perfect if you’re just curious about grilling and are not sure if it’s really the thing for you, or if you just don’t want to spend too much money.

Reviews of the Best Small Gas Grills for 2018

1. Char-Broil Classic 280 2-Burner Liquid Propane Gas Grill

This one comes from the reputed brand Char-Broil, a company that has been making grills and burners for seventy years. They do make good grills and this one is light enough to be easily portable. We think this is a great mid-size gas grill. It is stylish and very solidly built and has two stainless steel in-line burners, which provide great cooking performance. The lid and grates are made of steel and are porcelain coated, which makes them durable and easy to clean and also prevents food from sticking. The main surface provides ample cooking space. It also has two metallic side shelves that give you plenty of space for preparation or for keeping your cooking utensils. Two out of its four feet have 6-inch wheels for easy transportation, and the other two are fixed, for stability. This is a fine grill at a very reasonable price, with the added benefit of portability. The only problem while transporting the unit is that the side shelves do not fold. Overall, it’s great as a starter grill, in case you’re not sure if you will really use a gas grill that often or perhaps want to try one before investing in a more expensive model.

Pros

  • Good build quality
  • Uncomplicated flame control
  • Very easy to assemble

Cons

  • It does not come with a cover
  • A thermometer is not included
  • The side shelves do not fold
Check Price on Amazon

2. Coleman Road Trip Propane Portable Grill LXE

When you think of something small, you think of something that’s light and portable and that is exactly what this Coleman unit is. A one is tiny enough to become top-rated small camping grill that you will take on your camping trips or when you go picnicking and the name is pretty much suggestive of its USP too. But you can also use this grill right in your backyard or in your apartment balcony. So, really, we’re looking at quite a versatile little grill out there. You’ll almost feel like you’re grilling in a full-sized grill when you use the Coleman. The cooking surface is large enough for ten burger patties, so you can cook dinner for up to six people at a time. Not bad. The cooking grids are made of porcelain coated cast iron, and they heat up really fast. They can be swapped for griddle or stove grates, giving you the possibility to cook different kinds of food at once. It even has two side shelves for putting your cooking utensils or to use as cutting boards. The grill gets its cooking power from the two independent burners and being independent, they give you the chance to easily control the temperature. The foldable design of the unit is super convenient. It’s great for when you’re taking it camping or for when you want to store it away, ensuring it won’t be in your way if you’re a little constrained for space. Since the grids are coated with porcelain, cleaning them is fairly easy. In fact, since the grill is so small, cleaning the whole thing should not take too much time.

Pros

  • Stand with wheels included
  • Can be folded for transport or storage
  • Plenty of space for cooking and preparation

Cons

  • It tends to rattle when being transported
  • It is a little on the heavy side
Check Price on Amazon

3. Char-Broil Portable 240 Liquid Propane Gas Grill

Another great grill for grillers on the go. This one again comes from Char-Broil, so you know you’re getting a quality product built with materials of top quality, and with all the knowledge and experience that this company has in manufacturing these units. This grill features a design that favors function rather than style. And that is fine, because it is strong and feels well-built and sturdy and will surely have no trouble to take some roughness out on these trips with you. The lid is built in painted porcelain, and it has sturdy steel legs which provide a lot of stability. These legs cannot be folded or removed, however, so whenever you’re transporting it, the legs will be sticking out, which also means it takes more storage space. The cooking surface, with a porcelain coated wire grate, is large enough for eight burgers, or two to three steaks. You and your family will not go hungry in those camping trips and you’ll be able to monitor the temperature at all times with the included thermometer. Because of its size, the Char-Broil can only feature one single burner, but the lid has some depth, meaning that the heat will flow inside and you should have no problem cooking your food. All in all, this grill has good quality, is easy to use and campers and hikers will appreciate its rugged design too.

Pros

  • The flame is controlled by an easy-to-use knob
  • It has a temperature gauge mounted on the lid
  • The temperatures do not get exceedingly high

Cons

  • The carrying handle is on the larger side
  • The lid lacks latches to secure it while it’s being transported
  • Non-foldable design consuming more space
Check Price on Amazon

4. Fuego Element F21C Carbon Steel Gas Grill

Okay, this might not be a grill to take in all those camping trips. But it has such a small and interesting design, that we wanted to include it here. The Fuego Element model will definitely stand out during all those BBQs with friends and family, and it will look great in your backyard or deck. The grill looks and is very compact, but don’t let it fool you. Even with its small footprint, it has a large cooking surface with a porcelain enameled cast iron cooking grate. With its powerful burners, this grill can reach high temperatures in no time. And its design is not just about how it looks, it’s also about providing balanced heat when cooking through the use of two circular burner and semi-spherical cover, which allows the heat to flow evenly inside. Since it’s very compact, it’s also very light, and it can be moved around easily using the included wheels, which also lock when you need to provide stability. Its small size also makes it the perfect grill if you are a little bit space-constrained: if you have a small patio or for use on a small balcony. The lack of cover is, however, a real problem that might make it a little vulnerable when being carried outdoors.

Pros

  • Unique, stylish design
  • It does not take up much space
  • Easy assembly

Cons

  • Does not include a cover
  • The lid handle gets very hot
Check Price on Amazon

5. Smoke Hollow 205 Stainless Steel Table Top Propane Gas Grill

This is an impressive, small propane grill, definitely built for grillers on the go. It’s ultra-light, ultra-portable and can be used in any situation. It’s perfect for tailgating, picnics, boating, camping and hiking trips. It’s build in stainless steel, so it’s meant to be used outdoor and to stand a little bit of rough treatment. It features a single burner, which is also made of stainless steel, but the way it’s designed allows for the heat to be spread in a way that it works as if there were two burners. This grill is a great choice if you’re looking for a grill with a solid built that will have no problems working well anywhere you take it. We must say that the overall quality of this grill is far better that what you see in grills of this price range. So, you’ll be spending your dollars well here. It even features a warming tray, which is definitely not something you see every day in grills of this size. So, if you’re someone who likes to, or would like to grill, during all those outings, this grill is something you might want to give a try.

Pros

  • Includes a lid lock, for easy transportation
  • Durable, sturdy construction
  • Thermometer included

Cons

  • No temperature zone regulation
  • Surface temperature can get high2
Check Price on Amazon

Final thoughts

Now that we’ve seen the best rated small gas grills for 2018, it’s time to make a choice. Ours is the Char-Broil Classic. We think it’s just great. It perfectly blends portability and the ability to be used as a backyard grill and incorporates some of the features and design language of larger grills, such as the side shelves and independent burners. This is a great grill that can really be used anywhere, from your backyard to camping trips, to the beach. Overall, your choice should be based on your specific requirements from the grill so that you lay your hands upon one that fulfills your criteria in all sense. If you haven't felt satisfied with these options? Don't worry, we have a list of best gas grills for you, check it out and grab one!

Title: Smoked Brisket Recipes To Get Your Teeth Itching For More
Content:
Smoked briskets are probably one of the first food ideas you make when planning a barbecue. You might, however, have been left to the same old family BBQ recipe that you’ve known and this is turning your party joy down. Well, this shouldn’t be a problem anymore with this collection of delicious and good looking recipes made with smoked briskets. Get into the flow with this and make these simple recipes. You will testify of the happiness turn around at your parties henceforth. Using the right smoker with suitable features also helps your dishes taste better, so be careful reading this article before buying any smoker

1. Empanadas on High

Okay, it looks like we are having a great time exploring Recipe one’s leftovers. Say you have some excess meat after making the stuffed peppers, this recipe is another great option to make as appetizers for the holidays. Hence, we made extra numbers for this one.

Recipe from Vindulge

2. Beef Cheese Indulgence

So to make things more exciting, let’s make some queso out of the previous version of a smoked brisket. You can add this queso fusion to the same menu list as the smoked brisket and your guests will love the offer even better.

Recipe from The Urban Cowgirl

3. Upgraded Chili

Sometimes, a chili goes a long way to getting you enough food for a few days at home. You will just need to top it up with a side dish of your choice. Try this recipe with an already smoked brisket recipe from our selection of recipes.

Recipe from Vindulge

4. Spice Blend Craze

This is a real deal guys. Heavy on spices, this version of a smoked brisket is one that you need to have those long lasting memories of a barbecue. Make it and devour it!

Recipe from Kevin is Cooking

5. Unusual & Tasty Blend

This is very ideal to add to the kids’ menu. It is healthy, attractive and tasty. It is an excellent item to add for even picky kids. [su_row class="ingredients-directions"] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Ingredients" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  • 2 cups Smoked Leftover Brisket
  • 1 ½ cups Beef Broth
  • 1 cup Onions, sliced
  • 3 tbsp Butter
  • 3 tbsp Flour
  • 1 lb Fresh Button Mushrooms
  • Salt and Pepper to taste
  • 12 oz Sour Cream
  • 1 tsp Horseradish
  • 1 tbsp Parsley, chopped
  • ½ cup Red Wine
  • ¼ cup Tomato Paste
  • 1 ½ cups Cooked Spiral Noodles
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Directions" open="no" style="defaul" icon="chevron-circle"]
  1. Place a skillet over medium heat, add oil and onions and saute for 2 minutes.
  2. Add mushrooms and melt butter in the same skillet.
  3. Add flour, make a paste and stir in beef broth.
  4. Add tomato paste and bring it to a soft boil.
  5. Now, add red wine, sour cream, horseradish, parsley and salt and pepper to taste. Boil slowly for 1 minute.
  6. Add the brisket until warmed through. Turn off heat.
  7. Serve with noodles,  garnished with parsley. Enjoy!
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [/su_row]

Recipe from Extraordinary BBQ

6. An Amazing Twist

Well, biscuits and gravy are no longer the standards. Get with the trend, brisket and gravy are the new loves.

Recipe from Jess Pryles

After doing these recipes, storing the foods is obviously a key part of the process. And Vacuum sealers are a common machine found in commercial kitchens to help store the hundreds of pounds (or even more) of food that flows through a popular restaurant on a weekly basis By the way, I asked recipe owners for permission to feature their work on this post. If you want your recipe to be featured, please contact me
