Title: 10 Best Rated Charcoal Smokers For The Money In 2018
Content:
Are you one to stick to your guns when smoking with charcoal because of the char-broil aromas only a charcoal smoker can give? With this type of smoker, the key thing that resonates is flavoring. Making it very unique and setting it apart from every other kind out there. As a result, we share with you the best charcoal smokers there are based on their cooking surface area, fueling design, pricing and durability. If you are considering getting one of these or a second buy, delve deeper as we help you locate the best charcoal grill smoker there is on the market to fit your needs well. [supsystic-tables id='23']  

Reviews of The Best Charcoal Smoker

1. Pit Barrel 18” Cooker Package

This smoker has a simpler approach making it seamlessly easy to use. Instead of having only grill grates like many other smokers, it is comes with hooks that allows you hang your meat when smoking. The idea of camping and cooking at night will resonate with you. For its simple design, it could be argued to be an expensive option, but its strong build with hooks and standard grates cover its cost making it a versatile device. If you have a big budget and want something different, this will be a pampering buy for you. It has good heat distribution due to its cylindrical design that holds high temperatures giving you a very even cook on your food. One amazing thing about this smoker is its method of exuding flavors. When cooking meat hung over the charcoal fire, the juices of the meat drip onto the fire which then return to the meat as smoky flavoring making the aromas from your backyard unresistable. Finally, this device is a “set it and forget it device”. Once the fueling and damper settings are set correctly, with the help of the operating guide (for beginners), the device is able to keep temperatures at the standard you wish to cook with for over 3 hours without any interruptions in temperatures.

Pros

  • Great construction quality
  • Easy clean up
  • Versatility
  • Simple to use

Cons

  • Expensive
  • Not enough grill grates
Check Price on Amazon

2. Dyna-Glo DGN576DNC-D Premium Charcoal Grill

This smoker is made to handle heavy duty smoking. It is a dual smoker for smoking and grilling without any extra adjustments to perform its duties well. This Dyna Glo version comes with over 800 square inches of cooking surface area making it one of the best charcoal wood smokers for the money. It will double up to feed many individuals giving you space to make at least 30 hamburgers in one go. Heat adjustment is made easy with a charcoal basket adjustment system giving you total control over the heat level you may want at any point in time. The fueling approach to this smoker is a front door loading type making fueling very safe for the user while cooking. It has a built in thermometer and a stainless steel smoke stack with an adjustable flu that allows you to not only adjust heat from within but also the flavors. The cooking grates are made with heavy duty cast iron and coated with porcelain enamel. Therefore you are sure to have beautiful grill marks on your food when you are done. This makes it one of the best charcoal grill smokers there is to find on the market. For more durability, this smoker sits in a heavy duty cast iron build meaning this baby will weigh a ton. To help you move it around easily, 2 wheels made from heavy duty resin are attached with 2 other wheels with lockable casters for stability. Attached are 2 side shelves and a basket shelf beneath for keeping utensils or extra food while you cook. The side shelves are ideal for cooling, slicing and serving your food.

Pros

  • Great pricing for its quality
  • Slidable cooking grates
  • Front door fuel loading

Cons

  • Lid doesn’t close tightly
  • Needs a little modification
Check Price on Amazon

3. Masterbuilt 20060416 Charcoal Bullet Smoker

This is the cheapest smoker thus far and comes with some great features that we love. For under $200, it seems unbelievable for the quantity of food it makes. It is very portable and lightweight making it one of the best small charcoal smokers for tailgating parties. It contains 2 porcelain coated racks, a porcelain coated water pan and charcoal pan. Do not contest its quality for its price as it proves to be long lasting. It is a front door fuel loading unit which considers the safety of the user when using it. This is a great feature to have since most other charcoal and wood smokers lack this modern fueling invention. It comes with a easy to read, built-in thermometer saving you even more for its price. What else can you ask for if you are on a tight budget? Its cooking size is also a blessing for the amount of food it can make.

Pros

  • Amazing food turnout
  • Great pricing
  • Good for a beginner user
  • Portable

Cons

  • Cannot hold high temperatures
  • Poor airflow provision
Check Price on Amazon

4. Primo 778 Extra-Large Oval Charcoal Smoker

Before you scream out loud on the price tag of this smoker, let’s consider a few things that are worth the investment. This ceramic smoker is one of the few ceramic smokers available on the market today making it a luxurious option to own for its magical food turnout. It offers a wide cooking space with its patent and ceramic oval shape being is one of the best designs proven to hold heat for a more even cook. With this device, you have the best of five worlds in your bosom; smoking, grilling, baking, roasting and searing. For its petite size, it offers a wide cooking surface area of 400 square inches which can be increased to about 680 square inches with grate extensions. You are therefore guaranteed enough food to feed a large party with this smoker. Constructed with one of the most fantastic ceramic makes on the inside and out finished with a lead free, scratch resistance shine. At the same, luxury does not mean carelessness, so this oval will need to be handled with care to avoid breakages for its ceramic make. If you are one that is driven by quality to boost your ego, get one of these and you will be all smiles anytime you’re in the backyard.

Pros

  • Very long lasting
  • Lifetime warranty
  • A versatile machine

Cons

  • Expensive
Check Price on Amazon

5. Dyna-Glo DGX780BDC-D 36" Vertical Charcoal Smoker

This Dyna Glo cooker is one of the best vertical charcoal smokers to get for a large family or to host big parties because of its wide cooking surface area. At a cooking surface area of 784 square inches, there’s so much that you can do from smoking turkeys, sausages or pork chops. It is definitely one that should be considered for its good pricing. The stainless steel build makes it very durable for the outdoors even with inconsistent weather changes. However, it is better to purchase a cover for it so you can keep it in good shape for even longer. It is a dual door unit with an upper compartment for cooking and the lower compartment for heating. This sets it apart from many other charcoal smokers on the market as it takes into consideration the ability to load fuel while cooking without having to lose heat during the cooking process. It is very easy to assemble, however, do ensure to follow the manufacturer’s guide to avoid any damages. This device holds heat well while cooking and comes with a temperature gauge that is easily readable for heat adjustments when necessary.

Pros

  • Roomy for more food quantities
  • Handles are heat resistance
  • Lightweight

Cons

  • Smoke leaks out easily
  • Handles come off easily
Check Price on Amazon

6. Weber 16401001 Original Kettle Premium Charcoal Grill, 26-Inch, Black

Although this smoker has a high price tag, it is a great value for the money considering its set up. It is constructed with pressed steel and coated porcelain enamel giving you longer usage without any major repairs. This dual purposed device gives you the option to grill and smoke with just a few changes here and there. Search for extensive guides on the internet to aide you with this set up. It has a decent cooking surface area with the ability to make food for 22 servings in one round making it the best choice for bigger families. The cooking grates are heavy gauge stainless steel which contribute to its durability. This however does not affect its mobility since it is easily movable with a 2-wheel attachment. It is also so easy to assemble that even a teenager would have no problem putting it together.

Pros

  • Good cooking area
  • Inexpensive
  • Easy assemble
  • Durable

Cons

  • Thermometer reads wrongly
  • Weak legs
Check Price on Amazon

7. Char-Griller Akorn Kamado Charcoal Barbecue

At a high price, this Kamado style smoker is an excellent contender to beat its competitors for the amazing work it does. The recent models have seen some improvements in its weight originating from a heavy duty ceramic build to a lighter make with a 22 gauge, double insulated wall. This makes it more durable and less expensive as compared to other kamado style smokers. Also, this insulated design contributes to fuel efficiency as it holds heat for longer periods of time which then reduces the amount of charcoal that is needed. It comes with two foldable black metal shelves for extra working space, a locking lid that secures smoke and heat while cooking, a temperature gauge that is easy to read and an easy-to-remove ash tray. This Akorn Kamado allows you to smoke at least 14 pounds of food on its extremely sturdy cast iron cooking grates equipped with a solid warming grate making it an ideal one for a very large sized party. Mobility is no longer an issue with this smoker. The new lightweight steel build coupled with a two wheel attachment makes it easy to pull it around anytime you want. This product will last a long time due to its powder coated steel outside and porcelain coats on the inside. You are likely to use this device for more than 6 years if you invest in a cover.

Pros

  • Good value for money
  • Lightweight
  • Quality cooking grates

Cons

  • Untight lid that leaks smoke
Check Price on Amazon

8. Weber 721001 Smokey Mountain Cooker

This Weber has a strong build with a well thought out approach for a long lasting use. It is built with a pressed sheet of steel and then coated with porcelain enamel. This smoker for under $200 with its compressed steel build is lightweight and easily moved around with two wheels attached to its legs. This Weber kettle is a portable smoking and grilling device which allows the user to switch between the two cooking options with just a little configuration. The charcoal is closer to the food when cooking unlike many other smokers which speeds up the cooking process to about 15 to 25 minutes of cooking depending on the quantity of food being cooked. Fueling is easier and more efficient. All you need to do is lift up the grill grates and add charcoal. Also because of its circular design, fire is directed at the centre of the smoking area which contributes to the direct heat reducing the use of excess charcoal unlike with rectangular grills. Finally, cleaning up is made easy with this Weber grill. The grill grates are petite and fit well in a sink making washing them a very easy thing to do. The ashtray also easily fits in a trash bag for easy offloading and with the help of a stain remover spray. For the amateur user, this is a highly recommended option for an easy and quick result.

Pros

  • Affordable for its quality
  • Rust free build
  • Space saving
  • Well sealed and air tight

Cons

  • Inner paint could peel faster
  • Weak handles
Check Price on Amazon

9. Char-Broil CB940X 08301390-26 Charcoal Grill

This smoker is constructed of heavy gauge steel, cast iron cooking grates with a porcelain coating. With construction materials like this, you are sure to not have to deal with rusting. The cooking surface area comes in a little disappointing. Although looks may be deceiving, the cooking surface area is on the smaller side making it ideal for very small families. The temperature control is special for its adjustable fire pan which gives you total control when managing heat. It also comes with an easy to read and effective thermometer for good food results saving you some money from buying an extra device. You will be guaranteed safety when loading charcoal with its front door fuel loading feature. This is one of the safest fuel loading designs that you can have preventing you from burns while adding fire to the hot smoker. It comes with 2 side shelves for extra working space. Simply place your smoked meat on one shelf, leave it to cool, slice it and serve all from one position. Lastly, cleaning is made easy with its ash removal system. Once the smoker cools, all you need to do is to remove the ashtray and empty the content in the trash.

Pros

  • Attached wheels for mobility
  • Easy clean
  • Adjustable fire grate

Cons

  • Removed tool rack
Check Price on Amazon

10. Cuisinart COS-118 Vertical 18" Charcoal Smoker, Black

One of the cheapest choices on this list comes this smoker with a space saving design. You practically can keep this on your balcony and smoke from there. The exterior of this device is made with a strong steel structure, a strong securing lid, cool to touch handles and a vertically hinged door which is durable for a good while but will need to be covered if left outside. The smoker comes with a porcelain enameled coated water bowl, a latched base, a built-in thermometer, a water and charcoal pan, and a steel charcoal grate. This is great value for its cost. It produces a good amount of food, however, for its weight it is not suggested to cook heavier items of food on it. Some hamburgers, sausages and 5 pound meat should keep it stable for a longer period. With this smoker you might have to start cooking in advance to have enough food to go round. Otherwise, this unit is one of the easiest to assemble devices on the market with tips and recipes included. It would be an ideal gift for a newly wedded couple.

Pros

  • Decent cooking area
  • Budget friendly
  • Great features
  • Space saving

Cons

  • Unavailable parts
  • Poor thermometer read
Check Price on Amazon

Our Most Loved Option

With this amazing collection of charcoal smokers, choosing just one almost seems the hardest. However, there is always that one that shines above every other and here we have the Pit Barrel 18” Cooker Package as our best charcoal smoker in this series. This unit meets all the prerequisites we chose for this review and tops it off with its flavoring system. Now, remember that the charcoal smoker is distinguished by its ability to provide the best flavors, hence why we believe that the Pit Barrel Cooker tops the rest on this. We also like it for its “set it and forget it”, making it super user friendly. We are sure you don’t want to be standing by a smoker all day to make a decent meal. Finally, it is a space saver and can sit well on a balcony.

Do you need some more convincing to get one?

Let’s stress on flavoring some more

There are many types of equipment like this with various fueling options but nothing beats the authentic blend of fiery charcoal, flavored wood and the marinated spicing in your meat. Most fueling smokers come with the option to add wood chip flavors to your food but nature cannot be cheated. For this reason, the natural blend of these two types of fuel create substantial grilling flavors on your food which should be an unbeatable reason for choosing this device.

Cheap Fueling

Electricity can be expensive if you find yourself in a locality with a lashing bill to cover costs for electricity. Which is why charcoal comes in handy to help out. Considering outdoor barbecues like a tailgating party, there might not be a convenient electricity source nearby to help you light up your device and smoke at ease. However, with charcoal, all you need to do is carry some briquettes with you and your party will boom. Charcoal is one of the cheapest materials to find and can be found in every store nearby. You can buy as much as you want and preserve them for future use. Of course, other types of fuel has its own advantages and disadvantages, you can read more here to know more about other kinds of smokers using different types of fuel.

Heat Control

This is one of the most important reasons why we love charcoal fueling. The ability to hold a good amount of heat that is evenly distributed across the grill. Charcoal may take a bit longer to light but with good airflow in your smoker, you should be up and running in no time. Once your fire is lit, all you need to do is arrange your coals in a manner that fits your grilling needs and you will be good to retain a standard level of heat that cooks thoroughly. Read our how-to-guide to aid you in managing this process.

Convinced now? How then should you make your best buy?

Consider the build of the device

Fiery coals can damage your smoker if it is made with a poor quality material. Do not compromise in this field just to save a buck. For an evenly regulated amount of heat in your smoker, this can only be achieved with a great build and strong materials. Smokers made with cheaper materials tend to get too hot and may become a safety hazard when cooking and/or may deform the shape of the smoker over time. Again, do not compromise on this as it is better to invest in great quality.

Consider your serving size

It is always better to add 5 additional people to your serving size to keep you safe from shortages when serving. If you are cooking for two and you think that this is too large of a number, consider preserving the leftovers for the coming days. This will save you a lot of energy from having to restart your unit to cook over and over again. For the party lover who must have an event at home every weekend, make a purchase that will serve big numbers. Very soon the good word from your house will reach the streets and your guests will not resist a moment to try your delicious meals. This does not require you to be like everyone else if you are a young professional living all by yourself. Scan through our options below to find something that will serve your needs well.

Be safety conscious

When choosing a smoker, highly consider the style of fueling that it comes with. There might be the need to fuel your unit a number of times as it cooks. You do not want to hurt yourself from the heat coming from the device in this process. Find a fueling style that allows you load charcoal and wood in the simplest way possible and/or will allow you adjust your coals without stress. We care about your health and we advise you to take this option seriously when making your purchase.

Be wise on spending

Spending comes with many different earning levels. From our list of recommended products, we share varying prices for the different products and we urge you to go for a quality option. Let the thought of money be the last thing on your mind when considering making an investment like this. Scan through all the other needs and once you are certain of what you want, weigh that against your budget and make a purchase that will serve you well. Don’t get too cheap when making a decision. At the end of it all, the quality the smoker is what matters most.

Title: 8 Best Offset Smokers For The Money In 2018
Content:
Most offset smokers are intended to be used at large family functions, large events or even tailgating. These smokers are designed to have very large cooking surface areas allowing you to cook large quantities of food at once. Choosing an offset smoker can be difficult since there are many different styles and designs. This review will help shed some light on the areas you may not be so sure about when choosing an offset smoker. We have selected 8 of the best offset smokers on the market and we have reviewed them based on their capacity, construction, pricing and multifunctionality. Here, you can also read about how to use an offset smoker for anyone that is new to using offset smokers. Let’s dig in now: [supsystic-tables id=24]  

Reviews of The Best Offset Smoker

1. Dyna-Glo DGO1176BDC-D Offset Smoker

This highly durable smoker is built with heavy duty steel and has an excellent powder coat on the exterior making it resistant to high temperatures. A great smoker built to last! The cooking space of this smoker has your best interests at heart. Offering a 784 square inch cooking surface area in a vertical design. The amount of food you are able to cook if manage your cooking space well is ridiculous. The Dyna Glo offers a 15,000 BTU cast iron burner which is sure to provide substantial amounts of heat. We the love the fact that this propane version comes with a wood tray made with heavy duty porcelain coated steel allowing you to add different types of flavors depending on the wood you choose. . It comes with an exterior thermometer, however, there have been complaints of it not being easily readable but we think this complaint will be relative. For the amount of food this machine makes with its strong build, we deem it to be one of the best offset smokers for the money.

Pros

  • Adjustable grates and ash tray
  • Good for entry level use
  • Great on size

Cons

  • Leaks smoke
Check Price on Amazon

2. Pit Barrel Cooker

The pit barrel smoker may not seem like a typical offset smoker but for the fact that it heats the food away from the cooking area will qualify it as an offset smoker. This unique design is a refinement of the ugly drum smoker (UDS) with better quality than the UDS offers. It is a spacious vertical smoker with a hang ‘n’ cook approach. Using the 8 stainless steel hooks allow you to hang your food while cooking instead of using the common grate approach. This then gives you more space to cook with. For a vertical barrel, this product is brilliantly constructed of 18-gauge stainless steel and porcelain enamel which has proven to be super durable by many users. This smoker goes a step further allowing fat juices to drip off onto the lighted fire as it cooks, enhancing the smoky flavors that cook the food. While it may be pricey and the company is still very young, this is the best offset smoker under $1000. Plus, the Pit Barrel Cooker has one of the easiest assembling methods that your teenager could put it together for you.

Pros

  • 100% good food turnout
  • Holds steady temperatures
  • Set it and go equipment

Cons

  • Might be pricey
Check Price on Amazon

3. Char-Griller 1224 Smokin Offset Smoker

With an average cooking surface area, we will first suggest this as one best reverse flow smokers for a family of 4. Beautifully constructed with a powder coated steel drum build and cast iron grate to ensure long-lasting use. Aside from its durable build and lightweight structure, it is designed to make cleaning a beautiful task to look forward to. Both charcoal and ashtrays are easily removable with the double base for longer durability. At 146 lb, you have two added wheels to aid you with easy transport. A secret of ours we should let you know, we love smokers that come with wheels. This smoker is not one for heavy-duty cooking, it is not designed for that. Rather, this model is perfect if you are on a tight budget and need to make moderately sized foods.

Pros

  • Adjustable charcoal grates
  • Inexpensive
  • Easy to assemble
  • Enough grilling space

Cons

  • Bad thermometer attachment
  • Not high heat resistant
Check Price on Amazon

4. Oklahoma Joe’s Longhorn Reverse Flow Offset Smoker

The OJ Longhorn boasts as one of the widest cooking surface areas there is to find. Built with sturdy, heavy gauge stainless steel and coated with porcelain enamel puts it at the top of the list. This model is particularly used for very large events due to its large cooking surface area. You practically can make 30 hamburgers in one turn. The stainless steel grill grates create amazing grill marks on your food that calls for attraction. The OJ unit sits at the bottom of the barrel with 4 baffles to help guide heat to the food for an even cook. Also equipped with 4 adjustable grill grates for accurate food positioning. It features multiple dampers to be adjusted for heat and smoke control. Although smoke flavors are good for your food, a little bit can go a long way. This damper set up makes this process easier. Its build follows a good standard by using stainless steel coated with porcelain, which provides rust-free equipment.

Pros

  • Easy clean
  • Upgraded heat control
  • Wheel attachment for easy mobility
  • Quick assemble

Cons

  • Might be pricey
  • Paint peels off
Check Price on Amazon

5. Oklahoma Joe’s Highland Offset Smoker

Purchase this smoker for 3 important things; a decent cooking area, an easier fueling system, and a good heat control design. Offering a 619 square inch cooking surface area allowing you to cook a blend of 2 (5 lb) turkeys, some sausages, and vegetables in one turn. Adding more wood chips while cooking is made easier and safer with a convenient access door to help you load your wood without any burns. It is also very convenient for stirring your fire. It has multiple dampers to provide the best of heat when cooking. Adjust the dampers as you desire and you should be good to go. As for extra space, there are shelves provided for storing utensils while you cook relieving you of extra trips to the kitchen.

Pros

  • Wide cooking area
  • Cool touch handles
  • Extra storage space
  • Good sealing doors

Cons

  • Tough assembling
  • Drips juices when cooking
Check Price on Amazon

6. Smoke Hollow Outdoor Leisure SH36208 40-Inch Barrel

This is a great smoker for any entry level. A plus to this model is you won’t have to worry about any rust or corroding. The grill grates are made of heavy duty steel coated with porcelain enamel, the ideal materials for a great build. Place your cooking tools on the extended mesh front table or on the bottom shelf to give you some extra space when cooking. The cooking surface area is very large allowing you to cook for large groups of friends and family. We give this smoker an overall score of 8.5 out of 10.

Pros

  • Cool to touch
  • Sturdy build
  • Decent food turnout

Cons

  • Leaks smoke
Check Price on Amazon

7. Smoke Hollow 4-in-1 LP Gas Charcoal Smoker

A quadruple functional smoker makes versatility the most loved quality of this smoker. You may not be up for traditional grilling all the time, so the gas fueling option allows you to cook equally great food as the charcoal grill. This unit comes highly recommended for it’s weathering abilities giving you the opportunity to use your smoker year round without any interruptions. Use charcoal for warm weathers or use gas for cold weathers. Another bonus is its infrared searing option on the firebox burner giving you a fourth cooking method option. Controlling temperatures is easy with its adjustable charcoal pan for great heat. You may also manage heat from the infrared side firebox, adding some dry wood chips for amazing flavors. All in all, this smoker does it all - charcoal grilling, gas grilling, offset smoking and infrared smoking. As a pitmaster, you couldn’t ask for more.

Pros

  • 4 in 1 cooking unit
  • Durable
  • Holds good temperatures

Cons

  • Pricey
  • Longer assemble
Check Price on Amazon

8. Char-Broil American Gourmet Offset Smoker, Deluxe

This 3-in-1 smoker under $500 is worth every penny with it’s options of an offset smoker, a BBQ, and a charcoal grill. With that being said, you have the liberty to cook in variously different ways. This massive cooker offers a total of 670 square inches of the cooking surface area which means you could smoke an entire pig if you wanted to. It is great on fuel efficiency using charcoal and wood chips for optimum flavors. It also comes with adjustable fuel trays allowing you to cruise at the best heat levels. For the money, the is the best offset smoker which comes with an extra storage rack for storing your utensils while you cook and a charcoal case to store extra fuel. There are multiple adjustable dampers allowing you to have total control over heat. Featured with chrome plated cool touch handles that keeps you safe from burns when holding it.

Pros

  • No smoke leakages
  • Good pricing
  • Sturdy build
  • Good food turnout

Cons

  • Inner paint peels quickly
  • Burns more wood
Check Price on Amazon

The choice that tops all

Our best offset smoker from this list will be the Dyna-Glo DGO1176BDC-D Offset Smoker mostly because of the high rate of multifunctionality that it offers. This makes it an affordable smoker as it provides the function of 4 different cooking methods which is cheaper than the cost of all 4 appliances combined. According to space or quantity, you can make as much food as you desire and the sturdy build will last longer through the years. Its beautiful design will keep your backyard looking gorgeous all year round and with a quick assemble, you should be all good to impress everyone. Get your kids to cook with you using this product to build memories and bonding experiences.

Why should you choose an offset smoker?

Consider its purpose

In our previous reviews, we have talked about the importance of adding smoky flavors to your food. This smoker is specifically built and designed for that purpose. An offset smoker consists of two separate chambers connected together. One chamber is called the firebox which is where the coals or firewood is burned and a second chamber which holds the food. The smoke creates in the firebox and then passes through to the other chamber and then through the flew. The smoke is cooled down while it transfers over to the meat chamber creating an offset smoker. Such an amazing technique!

Designed for more food

Typically these smokers are designed to be on a much larger scale of size. These smokers are very common in BBQ competitions and restaurants due to the amount of food they are able to produce. Don’t let that scare you out of buying one though because offset smokers are for anyone. Just because you have the room to cook all that food, doesn’t mean that you have to, it's just nice to have the option. On average, these smokers have the capability to produce a minimum of 20 burgers in one turn this so there is plenty of food to go around.

Do you need an all in one kind of a cooker?

An offset smoker is also equipped with multiple cooking methods; grilling, smoking, searing and roasting are all viable cooking options making this type of smoker an all-in-one offset grill. This smoker is bound to replace several different appliances such as the oven, grill, stovetop, and smoker. So the question is why wouldn’t you need one?

Are you particular about durability?

Offset smokers are made from quality metals welded together to stand sturdy to the ground. Considering the fact that these devices are for external use only they are designed to withstand the test of climate changes for a longer life. This smoker is sure to withstand the test of time. Most of the offset smokers are built to be mobile as well. Some so big they are usually attached to a trailer to allow easy transfer of the smoker from site to site. While others have well built in casters available.

Important qualities you should look out for when purchasing

Is it long lasting?

These smokers are more often than not built out of galvanized steel or double thick iron making them incredibly durable and long lasting. There are cheaper models on the market made from thinner steel that is not weatherproof as well. So make sure and research the brand you want to purchase and check to be sure that the materials used are of high quality. You will want to shoot for a minimum lifespan of 4 years to keep you in a safe zone.

Consider your serving size

If the particular smoker does not provide more than 250 square inches of cooking surface area then ditch it for something else. It will be totally wrong to not have enough food to go around. That would defeat the whole purpose of purchasing an offset smoker.

Consider its price

First of all, these smokers are not small smokers, meaning they do not come cheap. However, this does not mean that the deal is a rip-off, it only means best possible value offset smoker. Investing in a quality smoker means you will have to pay more but the smoker will definitely live its name up to the price tag. Investments are meant to serve a lengthier purpose and so should be your best smoker. This product review balances quality products with good pricing opting for the best choice. There is also information available online to keep you well informed on what the best has to offer.

Are they multifunctional

Offset smokers are built to not only cook large amounts of food at a time but also provide alternative cooking methods should you choose to do so. They have the option of direct heat and indirect heat to smoke foods creating a whole other form of smoking which is called “cold smoking”. This method is great to use on fish and cured meats. They also have the ability to bake pastas, pizzas, and casseroles. Or just about anything you put in an oven, you can do the same in one of these smokers. As long as it is not a vertical smoker with an offset firebox, then you also have an option to grill foods. Here are some of the types we have chosen which have many of these features. After reading this review you will be able to make an educated guess on which offset smoker to purchase!
_yoast_wpseo_title: 8 Best Offset Smokers For The Money - %%currentmonth%% %%currentyear%%

Title: 8 Best Indoor Electric Grills: Top Rated Reviews In 2018
Content:
While outdoor grilling is a great pastime, not everyone has enough space available for an outdoor charcoal or gas grill. And when winter comes you still get cravings for the flavor of grilled food, but don’t want to put on a coat and boots and glove, just so you can go outside to grill and this is where the best indoor grills come to play. Fortunately, there are many options available for making grilled food right in your kitchen. While it’s not quite the same thing as grilling over charcoal, you can still get food with grill marks, get a good sear, and juicy food with great flavor without going outdoors. There are electric grills that suit every need and every budget. There’s just no excuse not to grill anymore. The drawback of using indoor grills is that it can be a little messy because the juices and fat from the food will be splattering all over the counter top or table. For this reason, a few indoor grills include a cover, but this can have the effect of steaming the food a little as it cooks, which is fine for some foods but not so good for others. Here are some of the best ones for 2018: [supsystic-tables id=28]  

Factors to Consider in Choosing an Indoor Grill

Choosing a comprehensive indoor grill will always depend on what you want to achieve with it, how many people you’ll be cooking for and what you will be cooking. The one that better fits your needs will always be the best unit for you. Some important aspects to consider while choosing are:

Size Matters

When it comes to the indoor grills, sizes can vary widely. You’ll have to think about how many people you’ll be usually cooking for. If you have a large family, if you like to have people over or if you’ll be cooking mostly for two or three people will be the deciding factor.

Style of the Unit

You should also think about what type of grilling you want to achieve. If you want your food to be crispy grilled dishes, or if you prefer it to be juicy. For instance, the crispy grilling process needs an open grill, if you want juicier food, you will need a grill that can be closed or covered. You must also consider if you want just an indoor electric grill or something that’s more of multi-purpose kitchen appliance.

Power & Potential

Wattage is the measurement of the grill’s power. This affects how high a temperature the grill can reach and how fast it reaches the desired temperature. Higher wattage can also mean faster cooking, but not all foods require extremely high temperatures or they don’t need to be cooked really quickly.

Reviews of the Best Indoor Grills for 2018

1. Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler

We’ll start with a great indoor grill for steaks that is not only that, but it’s like five cooking devices in one. The power of the unit can be guessed from its very name and the brand, who have been offering affordable and easy-to-use kitchen appliances ever since. This one is an all-inclusive unit that emphasizes on convenience above everything else. This is an appliance that can be easily operated and does not require too much maintenance. And there are lots of accessories to choose from if you go to the brand’s website. From utensils to cleaning tools, there’s everything you need to become a better griller. The model is not that expensive, so you won’t be breaking the bank if you buy some accessories for it. While larger grills certainly do an excellent job cooking food, they may require a lot of maintenance and might take a lot of time to set up. Plus, cleaning up after using them is a chore. With this bbq grill, on the other hand, you can cook delicious food in a matter of minutes. Whatever your favorite food is, you can almost certainly cook it with this indoor grill so whether you are craving for chicken breasts or burgers, you’ll get bistro quality ones right in your house. Since it’s so small and light, you can use it anywhere, too, from the top of the counter to the dining table. The model has cast iron grilling plates, with porcelain enamel. Unlike the traditional cast iron, these do not require seasoning and, since the surface is non-stick, they are very easy to clean plus the enamel is thick enough to handle high temperatures. There are disadvantages to using porcelain-enameled cast iron, however. The first one is that it takes a little long to heat up. It may take up to twenty minutes for the grill to reach the desired temperature. But once it gets there, it maintains the heat quite well. The enamel can get chipped if you use sharp cooking utensils, such as those made of steel. For this reason, we recommend that you use silicone or wooden utensils. The unit has three knobs for selecting the temperature. The first one is for the griddle and the temperature ranges from 200 to 425 °F. The second knob is a selector with which you can switch the temperature between griddle and grill. And the third knob has five heating cores that go from warm to sear. The five ways in which you can use this unit allow you to cook a wide assortment of foods without compromising on flavor. To change between the different options, all you need to do is unlatch the locks located in each side of the grill, turn the plates over and slide them back in. This grill is definitely not just for grilling: you can use it as a contact grill, which is great for chicken breast, hamburgers or steaks, as a wide open grill, to double the amount of grilling space, as a panini press, an extra large griddler and as half griddle and half grill. With all the versatility you can get from this grill, it’s no wonder that this is a top rated indoor grill.

Pros

  • Durable and offers several cooking options
  • Easy to set up and easy to clean
  • Removable, dishwasher safe cooking plates

Cons

  • Takes a long time to heat up
Check Price on Amazon

2. Hamilton Beach 25331 Super Sear 100-Square-Inch Nonstick Indoor Searing Grill

Another versatile grill, this one lets you cook several kinds of food and does it pretty quickly. You can cook, shrimp, steaks, salmon and even Paninis with everything turning out great. The unit is small and well-designed. Assembling it takes almost no time, and cleaning it is very easy, too. In fact, one of the best aspects of this grill is how easy the cleaning process is and how fast you can get it over with. The grill plates are removable and can be put in the dishwasher, and the drip tray, too. As we said, it can be used for cooking different foods and performs really well thanks to its clamshell design that helps it do its job really quickly by providing heat from above and below.Burgers are ready in about three minutes, and the grill is also good for vegetables and other types of meats. This is a great smokeless indoor grill that lets you get a good sear without setting off any smoke alarms. It can reach temperatures of up to 500 °F. Although you will not be cooking extremely large meals on the unit, its cooking surface can accommodate up to six burger patties, so it should be enough to cook dinner for the whole family. However, the only problem with the unit is that the grease spatter flies far, which leads to inconvenience.

Pros

  • Well built and well designed
  • Reaches high temperatures without smoking
  • Easy to assemble and easy to clean

Cons

  • Grease spatter tends to fly far
Check Price on Amazon

3. George Foreman GRP4EMB Multi-Plate Evolve Grill

This indoor grill aims to take care not only of your grilling needs, but you can also use it to deep-dish bake, or even cook muffins. It’s affordable, versatile and easy to use. For everything you can do with it, it has the best price too. The unit has an attractive design and the materials feel of high quality. The cooking plates are solid but not too heavy, and they attach easily, so that you won’t have to waste any time setting it up. It’s built in a combination of metal and plastic, but it does feel like this grill is made to last. One obvious benefit of the unit, aside from the high quality construction, is that you’ll be able to use it not just for grilling. With the interchangeable plates, you’ll be able to cook different kinds of foods. The standard grill plate is just as good as you would expect, and it’s slanted so that the fat drips onto the dripping tray. The result of this design is that food is cooked with far less fat. It’s perfect if you’re on a low fat diet. You can perfectly cook a steak with little fat and while retaining all of its moisture. With the deep dish tray, you can cook bread, pizza, vegetables, or just about anything you want to put in there. The cupcake and muffin tray looks just like a regular tray of its kind, but it’s been designed to fit the grill and the attachment is great for making muffins in small batches. The grilling process is simple. There isn’t a lot of mess thanks to the dripping tray and it’s very easy to clean up. The removable cooking plates can be put in the dishwasher, which is something you probably won’t have to do every time, since you can just use paper towels to clean this up. The model will reach full temperature in about five minutes, and it will maintain whatever temperature you select. There is also a timer included, so you can ensure perfect cooking times. Baking cupcakes and muffins is just as easy and the results you’ll get are just as good as those you’d get in a conventional oven. You do have to be careful with the amount you pour into the deep dish tray, though. If you put too much in there, it might overflow and create a bit of a mess. The overall construction of the tray is high quality. Although relatively affordable, it is of a high standard. The cooking trays and release handles feel sturdy, which is important because the whole idea is that you’ll be switching those out very often. Even in case of any problems, the tray accessories can be purchased separately, and you can get additional ones.

Pros

  • High quality sturdy construction
  • Interchangeable plates
  • Timer included

Cons

  • Oiling is sometimes needed on the plates
  • Clean up can be messy if it overflows
Check Price on Amazon

4. T-fal GC702 OptiGrill Indoor Electric Grill

The unit is designed to help you cook food to perfection with its six preset programs and its precision grilling technology, with sensors that calculate the thickness of the food and adapt the grilling cycles accordingly. Although, for this to work well, the pieces of food to be cooked have to be of a more or less even thickness. You simply choose a program based on what kind of food you’re cooking: burger, poultry, sandwich, red meat or fish, and the grill will tell you when it’s done. Isn’t that just the best way to grill indoors? Another neat feature of this grill is its frozen food mode, which lets you take a steak out of the freezer and put it on the grill without having to wait for it to thaw. This makes it a great indoor grill for steaks too. But you don’t always have to let the unit take over for you. It also has a manual setting that lets you select the temperature and the cooking time. This is useful when you’re grilling vegetables or for specific recipes that require settings other than the ones programmed in the grill. It has non-stick die-cast aluminum grill plates, which are easy to remove, easy to clean and are also dishwasher safe. They are slightly angled to help make the grease flow down to the drip tray, which is large and can also be thrown in the dishwasher.

Pros

  • Convenient cooking presets
  • Longer than average power cord
  • Can cook meat right out of the freezer
  • Large dip tray and easy to clean

Cons

  • Too many plastic parts
  • Sometimes the grill will be stuck in manual mode
Check Price on Amazon

5. George Foreman GGR50B Indoor/Outdoor Electric Grill

<ahref="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00004W499?tag=brobbq-grill-20" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">The grill blends convenience and function. Set up is fairly easy, and the built is very sturdy. In the box you will find the grill itself, a removable grilling plate, a grease tray, the domed lid with an adjustable vent, a power cord which includes the temperature control and a stand. The stand is made out of plastic and aluminum, and the stabilizing legs all clip together, so you won’t need any tools when putting it together. Since the stand is removable, you’ll be able to take this grill from the backyard to the countertop in no time, making it a great indoor and outdoor grill. The grill plate has a non-stick coating to make it durable; easy to clean and to let you cook without using butter or oil. With the five individual heat settings of the brand, you can cook using slow heat or you can set it to searing temperatures. The temperature control will be a familiar experience if you’ve used a gas grill in the past, and a new experience that you’re likely to welcome if you’ve only used charcoal grills. Whatever you want to cook, you’ll be able to easily adjust the temperature for it. Thanks to the electronic controls, heat is perfectly maintained, and the grill has the ability to self-regulate by turning the heating element on or off. There is no need for you to intervene, you just set the temperature and let it do what it has to do. You’ll also get the versatility of outdoor and indoor grilling. You can use it outside with the included stand or put on you counter, a picnic table or another heat-resistant surface. It won’t be a problem, since the body of grill itself has feet at the bottom. And it’s lightweight enough for you to take tailgating or on any excursions although being too light brings in the risk of the unit toppling when placed on a stand. The construction of the grill is also done with two materials, just like the stand. The quality of the materials seems appropriate for the price range, but that is not to say that they are of bad or cheap quality. Aluminum is used for the cooking surface and the lid. The cooking surface is coated in high quality Teflon, which is scratch resistant when used with wooden or plastic utensils.

Pros

  • Easy to assemble and clean
  • Sturdy construction
  • Great for indoor and outdoor use

Cons

  • Power cord could be a few feet longer
  • Too lightweight and can topple
Check Price on Amazon

6. Delonghi BG24 Perfecto Indoor Grill

This is a great BBQ grill that is sure to satisfy all your cravings. It features a wide cooking surface that lets you cook many food items at the same time. Chicken and hamburgers will come out juicy and delicious. You can cook a variety of foods with little mess thanks to its non-stick surface. Although grilling times are a little longer than on other grills, the surface can be easily cleaned. All you have to do it is give it a wipe. The drip tray is removable and can also be cleaned pretty easily. The grill has a tempered glass lid, which helps keep the heat in while cooking, making for juicier and more tender meat. It also helps keep the food warm until it’s time to serve it. It comes with a detachable thermostat, which is great because it lets you easily choose the desired cooking temperature. The temperatures are not always consistent across the entire cooking surface, however. Despite this, it can still cook food thoroughly. The die-cast aluminum grilling grate is large enough to cook for several people at once, but the cooking surface is smaller than other grills. This allows the grill to be light and portable, though, and the carrying handles do not get hot, so it can be easily picked up and transported.

Pros

  • Minimal grease spatter
  • Wide cooking surface can accommodate many items
  • Includes a detachable thermostat

Cons

  • Inconsistent temperature across the entire cooking surface
Check Price on Amazon

7. Zojirushi EB-CC15 Indoor Electric Grill

This Indoor Electric Grill is a fantastic electric powered barbecue grill, which is great for fish, seafood, fresh vegetables as well as any type of steaks. This grill is good for so many things and it does them so well. It’s easy to clean, durable, relatively light weight, extremely convenient and comes in one elegant design. There are plenty of meat dishes that can be grilled on this, and also vegetables or seafood. It’s also a great indoor grill for Korean BBQ. The large surface of the cast iron grilling area can take some heavy cooking and there is an adjustable temperature management system, which lets you easily adjust how high you want it to be. The material that the grilling area is made of naturally holds heat very well, for optimum performance. No matter how hot the unit might get, the cool touch carrying handles let you transport the grill without danger of getting burned. All the extra fat and oils in the food you cook go straight into the large, removable drip tray, which is dishwasher safe.

Pros

  • Disassembles for easy cleaning
  • Heats up quickly
  • It is very safe

Cons

  • Not so easy to store due to its size
Check Price on Amazon

8. Elite Gourmet EMG-980B Maxi-Matic 14-Inch Electric Indoor Grill

This one is a great choice if you really want to keep costs down. This round grill can handle your burgers, chops, steaks, and vegetables easily. There’s only one cooking surface, so this is definitely not a contact grill. The glass lid is helpful for times when you want to speed up cooking, do some steaming, or keep foods warm for serving. The power cord is removable, so the whole grill can be taken to the table for serving, and the grill plate is removable for easy cleaning. It has five different heat settings for cooking different foods. The downside of this grill is that the plastic knob on the lid can be a little fragile and the grill itself is not as sturdy as more expensive grills, although the build quality is perfectly fine for its price point.

Pros

  • Perfect if you’re on a tight budget
  • Different temperature settings for different types of food
  • The cover minimizes grease spatter

Cons

  • Small cooking surface
  • A bit fragile
Check Price on Amazon

To Sum Up

So, what is the Best Indoor Grill for 2018? We think the Cuisinart GR-4N 5-in-1 Griddler is the best choice. For all the versatility and all the cooking options that it offers. It’s not just a grill; it’s a complete multi-functional cooking appliance that is sure to become a great addition to your kitchen. And the price point is low enough that you can consider buying accessories for it, so you can have an even more versatile and complete cooking and grilling device.

Title: 7 Best Charcoal Grills On The Market 2018: Cheap & Budget
Content:
People often don’t know how to find the ideal solution for a great BBQ experience. Sometimes it’s hard to get the right combination of features, ease of use and maintenance simplicity and therefore, to make your choice easier, we review the best charcoal grills. Charcoal grills combine taste and convenience in the most desirable way and are therefore, great for BBQs. Most experienced grillers usually prefer charcoal grills over the gas ones. So, here are some of the best ones for 2018: [supsystic-tables id=29]

Is a Charcoal Grill What You Precisely Need?

Many people get lost in the dilemma of charcoal and gas and have trouble deciding which type of grill to get. Let’s go about it the simple way: If you value taste over convenience, then there is no doubt that you should go for charcoal. There are advantages to using gas, but there is nothing like the smoky taste briquettes or natural wood charcoal can provide. If you value convenience over anything else, I think you should read about the best gas charcoal combo grills So, now that you know charcoal is the way to go for the best taste, there remains the question of which charcoal grill to buy? And even after you’ve bought one, you might still wonder about the best way to use it. That is not always so easy, and there are some things to consider like the following:

Lump Charcoal or Briquettes

Lump charcoal and briquettes are really two different things. Lumps are made from burning wood without oxygen; the charcoal is what remains after that. It will light easier and burn hotter. Briquettes are made from wood by-products mixed with additives to help them burn longer and maintain a consistent temperature. Lumps are natural, but they tend to be more expensive and burn out more quickly. Briquettes are anything but natural, but they are usually cheaper and the fact they can burn for longer times makes them a more popular choice.

How Much Charcoal to Use?

The amount of charcoal to use is something that often goes overlooked. Generally, it depends on the size of the grill you’re using. Larger grills will obviously require more charcoal. The more charcoal you use, the hotter the fire will be and you should bear in mind different types of food need different amounts of heat. As a guide, your grill should be about two thirds covered.

How to Light a Charcoal Grill?

One of the most popular ways to light a charcoal grill is with a little lighter fluid. This will generally work but it is recommended to leave enough time for the fuel and chemicals to completely burn off, or the food will end up having “lighter fluid taste”. To light it up, the charcoal can be piled up in a heap. Once all of the charcoal is lit up and the fire is burning evenly, the charcoal can be spread out. Some people prefer to use a chimney charcoal starter. It’s easy to light up charcoal in one of these because all of it is confined in a small space. After being lit up, the charcoal can be transferred to the grill. And, then, of course, there are some grills that include an electrical or gas ignition system, making the job even easier. If you need a charcoal grill that light-weight enough to bring it everywhere you want, then I think you might want to see this article about best portable charcoal grills

Reviews of the Best Charcoal Grills for 2018

1. Weber 741001 Original Kettle 22-Inch Charcoal Grill

We begin with a classic from one of the oldest and most respected manufacturers of grills and grill-related accessories. This one is a great grill under $100, which is definitely a competitive price point. The design has changed over the years; they still follow the principle of combining features, ease of use and simplicity. It strikes a blend of tradition and innovation at the same time, offering a great grilling experience. The features of this grill make it stand out from other grills and that is why this is a top rated Weber charcoal grill. It has plenty of space, a large cooking surface for you to do those really big and great BBQs. Cleaning is easy and simple, with an aluminized steel ash catcher which does not let all the ash float around the place. Cleaning is also equally easier after cooking. The grill’s body is completely resistant to rust. This is very important because it means the grill will last you for a long time. This tabletop charcoal grill includes an aluminum damper and two high-quality nylon handles which are glass-reinforced, and even have hooks for your cooking utensils. All in all, this is one of the most enjoyable models, and a quite inexpensive charcoal grill.

Pros

  • Durable, rust-resistant construction
  • Easy to clean up
  • Large grilling surface

Cons

  • Three-leg design gives it not-so-great balance
  • The included thermometer is a bit off
Check Price on Amazon

2. Dyna-Glo DGN576SNC-D Dual Zone Premium Charcoal Grill

This one is a heavy-duty charcoal grill that is meant to last. It is made for those grillers who specialize in cooking for really large gatherings. Extra-large, premium quality, as the name states, and striking. This is a lot of grill for the money. This brand makes grills that are at the high end, and this is no exception. So, you know you’ll be getting good quality equipment here. The cooking area has two different charcoal trays, which is a plus. With this feature, it’s almost as if you have two separate cooking areas, and each tray is removable, so they can be easily cleaned. There is a steel divider that lets you separate the firebox in two parts. This means you’ll get two cooking areas where the heat can be adjusted separately. Each tray can be independently lowered or raised to get a different temperature on each side. Of course, having two separate areas means that you can grill with a lot more flexibility. You can grill different types of food, for example or use one side to cook and the other side to finish off and keep the food warm, while you put the next batch on the first side. And if you’re cooking for a smaller group of people, you don’t have to use charcoal on the whole grilling area. The firebox has two cast iron and steel doors, one for each side. There are also independent air vents for each of the two sides, so you get even more heat control. The cooking grates are made of cast iron, which is great for heat retention. They are coated with porcelain enamel, which helps to transfer the heat to the food. They are easy to handle and clean, since they are split. You won’t have to deal with one large grate. The lid is stainless-steel, which gives it an attractive look and also helps protect the interior of the grill. It has a galvanized steel double wall, which keeps the heat in and prevents it from getting too hot to touch from the outside. Even though this is a very large grill, it is still portable, as grills of this size go. It has heavy-duty resin wheels, so it shouldn’t be too hard to take it from one place to another. However, assembling it from the scratch can be quite a task just like controlling the temperature is a bit tricky too.

Pros

  • Strong, heavy-duty construction
  • Dual charcoal chamber system
  • Stainless steel lid with double lined walls
  • Good portability in spite of the large size

Cons

  • Full assembly required
  • Controlling the temperature can be tricky
Check Price on Amazon

3. The Original PK Grill & Smoker

This unit, also known as the Portable Kitchen Grill, is built with a design that goes back to the 1950s, and just like grills of those days, it’s made from hand-poured cast aluminum. This rust-proof charcoal grill has a flat bottom making it easy to push the coals to one side for smoking and indirect cooking. The lid has adjustable dampers for temperature control. The quite large grilling grate is hinged, convenient for easily adding charcoal.The unit has a side shelf, where you can place the food to be cooked and a bottom shelf, for storing charcoal bags and other things. Designed to be tough and durable, the model is designed with the very first aluminum grills in mind. There are very few moving parts and, so the idea is that this grill will be in service for a long time, just like the grills of old times, many of which are still used today. The unit can be used with charcoal briquettes or hardwood lump charcoal, and it performs well with both, whether you’re doing fast grilling or slow barbecuing. Temperature control is fairly simple on this grill. Thick cast aluminum and four-way venting make for a very efficient cooking chamber. It can also hold steady temperatures for a long time and it lets you use the same charcoal for multiple cooks. The cooking unit can also be detached from the stand and turned into a fully portable charcoal grill ideal for camping, tailgating and other types of excursions, adding to its versatility.

Pros

  • Durable cast aluminum construction
  • Can be used with different charcoal types
  • Detachable, turns into a fully portable grill

Cons

  • Price point is a bit high
Check Price on Amazon

4. Char-Broil TRU-Infrared Kettleman Charcoal Grill

This is another grill of good size that is also made by one of the top grill manufacturers with over seventy years of experience. You’ll have plenty of room for lots of food, you can put up to fifteen hamburgers in at the same time, so if your family is large or if you’re having lots of people over, you’ll have no problem cooking for all of them with this budget charcoal grill. The cooking grate is coated with porcelain, which helps distribute the heat and reduces the risk of flare-ups by allowing the flavor of the charcoal to pass through to the food while keeping the flames away from it. The body of the firebox has air vents to allow the air to flow in all around. That way, the air increases the fire from all sides and that keeps it evenly spread heating up the whole cooking surface. The large air vents on top of the lid help control the temperature. Opening these vents makes the inside of the gill a little cooler, and closing it increases the temperature inside. The included thermometer lets you know if your food needs more or less heat, and the lid itself is hinged for simple opening and closing when you want to check how done your food is. Everything in the unit’s design points towards efficient burning. Plus, the grill has Char-Broil’s own Tru-Infrared cooking system, which further helps with better heat distribution and temperature control, and it lets the grill cook food more evenly while using less charcoal. And don’t worry about cleaning up any ashy messes. The removable ash tray at the bottom of the grill collects all the ash so it can be easily disposed of while also being large enough.

Pros

  • Robust construction and large
  • Easy to assemble and hinged lid
  • Tru-Infrared technology to cook more food

Cons

  • Temperature control can be difficult
Check Price on Amazon

5. Weber 15501001 Performer Deluxe Charcoal Grill

This one is the deluxe version of the Weber Original Kettle, and it shares some similarities with it, but it takes grilling to a whole new level. That means this is not a cheap charcoal grill so, let’s see if it’s worth spending a little more. The enamel on the bowl and lid is super tough, and the grilling surface is the same size as the Original Kettle. The grilling plate is hinged, so it’s easy to get to the charcoal should you need to stroke it or add more. This grill comes with Weber’s Touch-n-Go gas ignition system. You don’t need matches or lighter fluid to get the charcoal burning. This system does that for you. You can get the fire going with just one touch, hence the name. That does not mean this is a gas grill. It just uses gas to light up the charcoal. There are two charcoal baskets, and they can be placed at the edge of the drum or in the middle of it. This helps control the amount of smoke that gets to the food, and gives you the option to use direct or indirect cooking. The lid has a thermometer built into it, so it’s easy to check the temperature inside the grill. A digital timer is also included. The handle on the lid does not get hot while the grill is in use, so you can remove it and put it back in place without worrying about getting burned. Also on the lid, there are rust-resistant dampers to control the temperature, and the lid itself can be held to act like a windshield by means of a lid holder. You’ll also notice the steel cart frame, which is a great addition, since it provides an area where you can put the food you’ve grilled, or the food you’re about to grill. It also has hooks for hanging your cooking tools. The bottom part of the cart can also be used to store your charcoal when the grill is not in use although removing the ash tray can be bit of a tough task.

Pros

  • Touch-n-Go easy ignition system
  • Tough, well made body
  • Large table area
  • Charcoal storage area

Cons

  • Full assembly required
  • Ash tray can be difficult to remove
Check Price on Amazon

6. Dyna-Glo DGN576DNC-D Premium Charcoal Grill

As is usually the case with the grills of this particular brand, this one too is meant for serious grilling enthusiasts. Its size and price point are, however, a little beyond what is usually found in regular home grills. This is for when you’re holding a large outdoor party. This is a heavy-duty grill that is well designed and meant to last. It’s not a small investment, so let’s see how much you’ll get for what you’ll be paying if you go for this grill. There are more expensive grill models, but this one is still considered one of the finest ones. The unit offers heat control, which is necessary to get perfectly grilled food, with a crank handle that lets you raise and lower the charcoal basket. The access door to the basket is made of cast iron, which is great for keeping the heat inside. The cooking grates can be slid from side to side, so they can go after the heat. More heat control comes from the stainless steel smoke stack and side dampers, which allow you to control the air flow and therefore the temperature. These parts of the grill are also meant to help you control the flavor of your food by regulating how much smoke you want on it. The cooking surface is made of cast iron with a porcelain enamel. The cast iron maximizes heat transfer and the porcelain enamel makes it easy to clean. It is quite a large grilling surface, enough to fit up to thirty hamburgers at once. Two side shelves offer more space, and there is a basket underneath the unit that is good for storage. In there you can keep cooking utensils, plates, or even the food that you’re going to cook. There is even a little extra touch: a bottle opener fixed on the side, so you and your guests can enjoy cold drinks while waiting for the food.

Pros

  • Sturdy, well-built design
  • Large cooking area with sliding cooking grates
  • Movable (up and down) cooking basket

Cons

  • The lid does not close completely
  • Full assembly required
Check Price on Amazon

7. Char-Griller 2-2424 Table Top Charcoal Grill

This one is a great table top charcoal grill for those times where you just want to cook food fast, but for its size and weight it also works great as a camping charcoal grill, or for picnicking with your family, or for anywhere you want to take it. It has a durable construction that is sure to resist all the elements and is sure to last for a long time. It can also be used as a side fire box, when attached to a compatible barrel grill of the same brand. It’s made of heavy steel which is a durable material, so you won’t have to worry about it when you’re carrying it around. Take it anywhere as it is a great small charcoal grill that is well built and comes at an affordable price. The size of the unit means it won’t take up too much space. This makes it perfect if you’re a little bit constrained for space and also makes it easier to find a place to store it. This grill is ideal for grilling at tailgate parties, at the beach or when camping and also for when you’re grilling for just a few people. It comes fully assembled, so you don’t even have to think about putting it together. Cleaning it is not a problem, either. It has a removable ash tray that can be detached to get rid of all the unwanted coal residue and ash. The entire body of the grill is coated in porcelain, so you can give it a clean look just by wiping off the dirt and dust. The grilling grates are made of cast iron and they are larger than what most grills of this size and price have to offer. It has adjustable dampers to control the heat. This is another feature that is usually only found in more expensive grills. You really get a lot of value in this little grill, which is also a charcoal grill under $200. With this model, you get the versatility of using it by itself or as a firebox attached to another Char-Griller grill. You should note, however, that once attached to a larger grill, it can no longer be used as a table top grill so the design does have its limitations.

Pros

  • Dual use as a table top grill and as side firebox
  • Ample cooking surface
  • Cast-iron grates & heavy-steel construction
  • Lightweight and small

Cons

  • Could use more dampers
  • Dual use has limitations
Check Price on Amazon

In conclusion

To sum up… what is the best charcoal grill on the market for 2018? After having looked at the grills on this list, it is not an easy thing to decide. If we must make a choice, we’d go for Weber 741001 Original Kettle 22-Inch Charcoal Grill. It’s a higher end grill, so it’s affordable and robustly and beautifully built. It has an ample cooking surface and storage area and it can and is overall a good, high-quality appliance.
