Title: 10 Best Rated Gas Grills On The Market In 2018
Content:
We all love grilled food but grilling, as we know, is quite a task. However, if you love grilling and yet don’t want to deal with all the additional effort required to work with charcoal grills, here are the best gas grills reviewed for you. Gas grills offer heightened convenience and can be handled by those who feel uncomfortable cooking with the charcoal grills. Several advantages come with the best built-in gas grill models, which you just need to check out for in the reviews. There are a lot of models out there and you might not be sure which one you should get. We want to help you decide, so here are the best ones: [supsystic-tables id=30]  

Is Using a Gas Grill a Good Choice?

Gas grills offer some benefits over charcoal grills like the following:

Very Convenient

Gas grilling is extremely convenient as you have the ability to control the flame, and therefore the temperature, at the turn of a knob. Gas grills use propane gas, which comes in refillable tanks, as their fuel source.

More Authentic

Gas grills are often considered more authentic because the flavor of the grilled food is better with these than the charcoal ones.

Cleaner and Quicker

Gas grilling is also clean and quick. There is no messing around with of briquettes, no handling of smelly starter fluid and no waiting around for the coal to get to the desired burning point and all these are particularly relevant for the best natural gas grills. In addition, once you’re done grilling, there are no ashes left behind to clean up. You simply turn it off, run a metal brush through it or stick the grates in the dish washer and you’re done. Since gas burns clean, gas grills can also be used in areas where there is a burn ban and charcoal cannot be used. So, if it is overall convenience you’re after, then a gas grill is definitely the right choice.

Factors to Consider in Choosing Gas Grills

There are three main things that you should look for in a gas grill:

Even Heat Distribution

No griller likes hot-spots. A grill that has some really hot areas and some cooler areas makes cooking very difficult. Even heat distribution throughout the whole grill surface allows food to cook evenly. It also gives you the ability to use your grill like an oven and roast or bake food, which you automatically learn when you know how to use a gas grill. Gas grills achieve even heat distribution by using high-quality tube burners, a well-insulated hood that locks in heat and efficiently circulates air, and heavy-duty cooking grates that transfer heat well.

Durability

A gas grill is definitely an investment. A quality gas grill should last for very many years, not just a few months. That means they should be built from heavy-gauge and corrosion-resistant materials like stainless steel and thick porcelain enameled steel. Well-built grills also retain heat better, which allows them to maintain an even cooking temperature, even in cold weather.

Safe Operation

You should be able to use your grill without having to worry about gas leaks or flare-ups. This means all the fittings and parts must be secure while drippings and juices from your food must be directed away from the direct flames. And, of course, when choosing a grill, you should also consider how and where you’ll be using it. If you want it for backyard grilling or if you undertake many excursions and therefore, prefer one of the best portable gas grills.

Reviews of the Best Gas Grills for 2018

1. Weber 46510001 Spirit E310 Liquid Propane Gas Grill

It comes with all the features that any griller would want to have, and it is reasonably priced. It comes from a manufacturer known for paying attention to all details, so you can be sure you’re getting a quality product that is sure to last. This grill provides an ample main cooking surface, plus a warming rack and two stainless steel side tables for extra space where you can place your spices or prepare your food. No more running to the table and back, you can conveniently have it all in one place. The side tables can be folded down when the grill is not in use. It also comes with Weber’s own porcelain enameled flavorizer bars. This is a system that was introduced to allow for cooking juices, such as grease and butter to sizzle and evaporate when they fall, adding flavor to your food. The grill requires a twenty-pound propane gas tank, which can be conveniently kept inside the cabinet. There is a gauge that lets you know how much fuel you have left at all times. As for the cooking grates, they are made of cast iron and are also enameled in porcelain. The cast iron provides better heat retention, and no seasoning is necessary. Cleaning the grates is super easy, too. The cook box is made of aluminum and it’s efficient and durable. The model can withstand high temperatures, so you can cook any kind of meat. When the lid is down, that helps with heat circulation and the food retains all its aroma and flavors. This is a good grill with many features and a relatively low price.

Pros

  • High-quality materials
  • Easy to clean and maintain
  • Plenty of cooking and prepping surface

Cons

  • The fuel gauge can be a bit off sometimes
Check Price on Amazon

2. Char-Broil Performance 475 4-Burner Cart Liquid Propane Gas Grill

This is a great home gas grill from a top-rated grill manufacturer. It is one of the most powerful gas grills on the market. The four burners deliver a lot of heating power across the cooking surface. It’s a large cooking surface, so it can definitely use all that power. You won’t be missing any features here. In fact, there are some features that you may not even find in more expensive grills. The build quality is excellent. It’s all metal, with a stainless steel lid, handle and front panel, which promises a stylish look and durability. The grilling grate of the primary cooking surface is made of porcelain coated cast iron, great for heat retention and easy to clean and maintain. In case its large size of the primary surface is not enough, it also has a swing-away secondary cooking surface, which is also coated in porcelain. In addition, it includes a side burner, so you can cook your favorite side dishes and sauces while you’re grilling. The side burner has a lid, so it can also double as a side panel if you need more prep space instead. Although the unit is large and leans towards the heavy side, it does come with wheels, to make it easier to move around, should you ever wish to. You’ll get style; durability and function in an excellent grill under 300 dollars. However, it’s too large a size and increased space consumption is a matter of inconvenience for many.

Pros

  • Durable, sturdy metal construction
  • Large cooking area with enough power
  • Easy to set up

Cons

  • Large size takes a lot of space
  • Access to the propane gas is not possible from the front
Check Price on Amazon

3. Napoleon TQ285X-BL PortablePropane Grill with Cart

This one looks great and works great too. The manufacturer has been making grills for over thirty years, so they should know a thing or two about them by now. The looks on this grill are striking. It has a stylish blue color design and it even comes with a cart, so you have all the support and mobility needed right there, you don’t need to go around looking for places where to put it. Plus, it stands on its own. There is nothing flimsy about it. The legs of the cart are foldable, so the grill is easy to move around and also easy to store. After you use it, you can easily put it away. But don’t think you won’t be taking this one out. The wheels are all terrain, so you can just as well take this grill with you when you’re picnicking or tailgating. It also has two side shelves, giving you room to prepare your food or to hang your utensils. This is a powerful little grill, too. It has two stainless steel burners to deliver enough heat for you to cook lots of food at once.

Pros

  • It has a lid locking mechanism
  • The burners are controlled individually
  • It can be used with a full-sized gas tank
  • Easy to assemble

Cons

  • It does not have an adjustable vent
  • It’s a bit on the heavier side
Check Price on Amazon

4. Broil King 986884 Signet 90 Liquid Propane Gas Grill

What can we say about this one? It is a grill that really goes all out. Lots of style, lots of features, lots of power, lots of quality. This is an outstanding grill under 1000 dollars. Everything that anyone can hope to find in a modern grill will be found on this one. Even if you’ve never grilled before, just looking at it will probably make you want to have it. And once you use it, you’ll want to use it over and over again. This unit comes under the category of the best 2 burner gas grills, in fact, it has an extra stainless steel made burner. They provide a huge amount of power, and since they are dual tube, they can provide twice the heat of normal burners, even at low temperatures This means faster grilling, and is a feature that has been patented by the particular brand. The cooking grates are made of heavy-duty cast iron, coated with porcelain, which makes them resistant to rust and prevents food from sticking. These are reversible, so you can use one side to cook a delicious steak or flip the grates to the grooved side if you want to grill beef patties. The unit also includes a side burner and this is a grill with rotisserie kit included. It is located in the lid and can cook up to two whole chickens at the same time although the rotisserie add-on can be removed if you want. There are also two spacious side panels (one of them doubles as the side burner), which give you space to prep, hang your utensils or put your spices and food. Cleaning the grill might be just about the only thing that isn’t so great about it. It does take a lot of time, but that is not surprising given the size of the grill and all the parts it has.

Pros

  • High-quality solid construction
  • Ample grilling surface
  • Lots of cooking options

Cons

  • Cleaning the grill can be a bit of chore
  • Grease drip tray is a little bit small
Check Price on Amazon

5. Char-Broil Performance 550 5-Burner Cabinet Liquid Propane Gas Grill

For big families or serious backyard grilling, the unit offers many features and plenty of size, all for under 400 dollars. It is certainly a best value gas grill that you can definitely consider with a tight budget. This 5 burner gas grill has a lot of cooking space in the main grilling surface, plus a side burner perfect for sauces and side dishes and side panels that offer more working space. The five stainless steel top-ported burners are durable and deliver strong cooking performance. The porcelain coated cast iron grates are resistant to dust, designed to retain heat and they prevent food from sticking, so that they’re easy to clean. The electronic ignition system guarantees quick start-ups. It also has a convenient double door cabinet, with lots of space for tools and accessories, and also to keep the gas tank out of sight.

Pros

  • Lots of cooking space and power
  • Includes side burner
  • Good price

Cons

  • Assembly takes a long time
Check Price on Amazon

6. CuisinartCGG-180TB Petit Gourmet Portable Tabletop Gas Grill

This unit is a good tabletop gas grill and it’s meant to deliver great performance. It comes from a company that has made a name for itself manufacturing all sorts of kitchen appliances for almost five decades. You won’t be missing any features here. In fact, there are some features that you may not even find in some of the best gas grills under $200. Because of its small size, this grill is perfect for situations where space is limited, as well as situations where you need to grill on the go, while you’re camping or at the beach. It weighs less than 12 pounds and includes a carrying handle. This grill is so easily moved around and it’s great for taking it with you when you wherever you need to. The foldable legs allow for easy storage when you’re not using it. This is a great grill for all your fishing and hiking trips, or if you just like grilling out in your front lawn. It is compact, but sturdy enough and will cook whatever is thrown at it with no problems. It’s also easily cleaned, with a removable grate that you can throw in the dishwasher. The absence of a thermometer creates a bit of hassle for the beginner grillers in particular.

Pros

  • Portable, light design
  • It comes with lock to keep the lid secure
  • Easy to set up and put away

Cons

  • The drippings catcher fills up quickly
  • No thermometer for temperature control
Check Price on Amazon

7. Master Cook Outdoor BBQ 4-Burner Cabinet Propane Gas Grill

A four-burner gas BBQ grill for those looking for a grill with the plenty of power. This one is very stylish and comes with lots of features. This is a high-performance, high durability grill. The lid, UFC and fascia are all constructed in stainless steel, so it’s tough enough to face any weather, making an excellent outdoor gas grill. The four tube burners provide enough, evenly-distributed heat across all the main cooking area, which is made of heavy duty cast iron grates. There is also a secondary porcelain coated cooking rack for warming up food or foods that don’t require direct heat. It has two side panels, and one of them can be converted into a side burner that can be covered for use as a working area. You can also hang your hooked cooking utensils. This grill is large, but is not too heavy, so moving around shouldn’t be too much of a problem. It includes four wheels for this purpose and is also one of the best gas grills under $500 out there. It also provides a large storage cabinet with front doors, which means you don’t have to go around your grill to reach what’s inside.

Pros

  • Precise temperature controls for easy adjustment
  • The burners are designed to produce a bluer flame
  • Storage cabinet accessible from the front

Cons

  • Side panels are not foldable
  • Large size not suitable for small decks or patios
Check Price on Amazon

8. Lion Premium Grills L75623 32" Natural Gas Grill

This unit is rightfully called premium because it has features that you probably wouldn’t expect to find in such a compact gas grill. It is a rather heavy grill, but that’s in part due because it is made of all stainless steel, and that means absolutely no rust. It is not a cheap grill, but it’s worth it and it is truly is a beauty to look at. The basic parts of the grill include stainless steel burners, a double layer smoker head, solid stainless steel cooking grates and temperature gauge. This is not just an ordinary grill. It’s like a complete cooking station in which you can cook many types of food, from frying eggs to toast some vegetables to cook smoked meant and this grill does it all. The main grilling area is rather large. You can fit more than fifteen burgers on it. The burners have been placed strategically so that they provide maximum heat in every corner of the grill. The burners also have a feature called “Flame tamer” which is supposed to help lower the heat further when you feel that even the low flame is a bit too high. Some of the premium features of this grill include a smoker box, a rotisserie that can hold up to forty pounds of poultry and a griddle. All of these are not part of the grill itself, but are offered as add-ons.

Pros

  • High-quality stainless steel construction
  • Large cooking surface
  • Rotisserie accessory

Cons

  • Not for people who are on a budget
Check Price on Amazon

9. Royal Gourmet SG6002 Classic 6-Burner Gas Grill

A great thing about this grill is that no other grill is likely to have the same features at such a reasonable price. For starters, there are those six burners. If that’s not enough, it also has porcelain enameled cast iron cooking grates, solid steel prep tables, one of which is also a side burner, a stainless steel lid with handle, a temperature gauge, a grease drip tray and four casters. The cooking grates are designed to retain heat, be easy to clean and reduce flare-ups. The porcelain enamel ensures the food doesn’t stick to them and that no seasoning is required. No more scrubbing the surface of the grates. All you need is water, a cloth and a mild brush to wipe out any food residue. The grill has a warming rack that is also coated in porcelain, so it also preserves the heat quite well, and since its right above the main cooking area, food is kept warm there for a long time. A double lid is found on the model. This not only prevents the heat from escaping, but also helps preserve the food’s flavor. There is a thermometer on the lid, so you know exactly at what temperature your food is being cooked. The grill itself is made of stainless steel, and that includes the lid, the knobs, the cabinet doors and the burners. The burners are shaped like a “U”, and, of course, there is no chance of them rusting because of the material they’re made of, which is always a plus. The bottom part of the grill has cabinet with two doors at the front. In there you can keep the gas tank as well as grilling tools. It’s really convenient, since you can have them all in one place and you don’t have to go looking around for them every time you’re going to use your grill. All said and done, its too heavy weight can create much of a problem.

Pros

  • Excellent stainless steel construction
  • Spacious cabinet with front access

Cons

  • It’s rather heavy
Check Price on Amazon

10. Char-Broil Portable 240 Liquid Propane Gas Grill

Another great grill for grillers on the go. This grill features a design that favors function rather than style. And that is fine, because it is strong and feels well-built and sturdy and will surely have no trouble to take some roughness out on the trips with you. The lid is built in painted porcelain, and it has sturdy steel legs which provide a lot of stability. These legs cannot be folded or removed, however, so whenever you’re transporting it, the legs will be sticking out. That also means it takes more storage space, but it works great as an RV propane grill. The cooking surface, with a porcelain coated wire grate, is large enough for eight burgers, or two to three steaks. You and your family will not go hungry on those camping trips. And you’ll be able to monitor the temperature at all times with the included thermometer. Because of its size, the unit can only feature one single burner, but the lid has some depth, meaning that heat will flow inside and you should have no problem cooking your food. All in all, this is grill has good quality, is easy to use and campers and hikers will appreciate its rugged design. It sure is a nice propane camping grill and it’s one of the best small gas grills also though there are some functional difficulties like the size of the carrying handle or the non-foldable design.

Pros

  • The flame is controlled by an easy-to-use knob
  • It has a temperature gauge mounted on the lid
  • The temperature do not get exceedingly high

Cons

  • The carrying handle is on the large side
  • Non-foldable design takes up more space
Check Price on Amazon

Final thoughts

Now it’s time for us to say which one is the Best Gas Grill for 2018. And the verdict is the Weber 46510001 Spirit E310 Liquid Propane Gas Grill. We think this is the best propane grill. It has lots of features, lots of space, it looks cool. There is very little that you will not be able to do with this grill, and it won’t cost you thousands of dollars. So, we definitely recommend it!
_yoast_wpseo_title: Best Gas Grills (%%currentmonth%%. %%currentyear%%) - Best Value Choice In The Market

Title: Smoked Chicken Wings Recipes To Try At Home
Content:
What other food can be best served as an appetizer, than nicely cooked chicken wings. Whether its festive Bbq night at home or special outdoor dinner, chicken wings are a delight for every meal. We love them to the core for their classy and juicy flavour inside and that crispy texture from the outside. But besides Bbq or buffalo chicken wings, what other recipes have we tried to smoke these super scrumptious treats? Not much, right? No worries, because if you are in dire need to cook something new for you and your family, then these Smoked Chicken Wings recipes will definitely make you popular among all. Wings are at their best, tastes amazing when infused with strong and deep smokey flavour. Besides good blend of spices, this would need marination and just the right amount of grilling using special wood chips. Unlike stovetop recipes, these chicken wings come with the convenience of not spending several hours in the kitchen. All it needs is you to marinate them with spices and let your smoker do the rest. For more inviting and rich taste, prepare special sauces to baste these wings while grilling. These sauces are not only good for the flavour but give a tempting and irresistible aroma to each.

1. Garlic Wings

A unique flavour is sparked into these chicken wings by mixing garlic sauce with Sriracha sauce. Both together with barbeque sauce, are absorbed deep into the meat and leaves a pleasing taste. Simply smoke them and toss with the mixture of sauce and Voila, a nice festive meal.

Recipe from Let The Baking Begin

2. White Smoked Wings

These white smoked wings are best known for the earthy garlic and soy sauce taste. Instead of using other tangy spices, here the wings are flavoured with nothing but mustard and sugar which them a distinctive mild flavour. [su_row class="ingredients-directions"] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Ingredients" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  • 3 lbs. chicken wings
  • 1⁄2 cup margarine or 1⁄2 cup butter
  • 1 cup soy sauce
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 3⁄4 cup water
  • 1⁄2 teaspoon dry mustard
  • 3⁄4 teaspoon garlic powder
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Directions" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  1. Heat margarine in a saucepan over medium heat.
  2. Stir in water, mustard, sugar, soy sauce and garlic powder. Cook until sugar dissolves.
  3. Pour the sauce over the wings and toss them to coat well.
  4. Marinate the chicken for 2 hours.
  5. Preheat the smoking grill to 275F.
  6. Arrange the wings on the smoking grill and cook for half an hour then flip to cook for another half an hour.
  7. Serve warm.
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [/su_row]

Recipe from Genius Kitchen

3. Dr Pepper Smoked Wings

This recipe is one good way to flavour the chicken wings with delicious Dr Pepper and our favourite hot sauce. If you are not a spice lover, adjust the seasoning as per the desired taste. Serve the wings with some creamy dip to balance out the spice. [su_row class="ingredients-directions"] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Ingredients" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  • 1 lb. of chicken wings (about 12-15)
  • Cooking spray
  • Salt & pepper
  • 1 can (12 oz.) Dr Pepper
  • ¼ cup hot sauce, such as Franks Red Hot
  • 2 Tablespoons brown sugar
  • 1 teaspoon cornstarch
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Directions" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  1. Preheat the smoker to 275F.
  2. Season the wings with salt and pepper generously.
  3. Arrange the wings in the centre of the grill, cover the lid and cook for 15 minutes.
  4. Flip them and continue smoking for 10 minutes.
  5. Meanwhile, mix dr. pepper with hot sauce and sugar in a saucepan.
  6. Bring the mixture to a boil then reduce the heat to low.
  7. Whisk in cornstarch and stir cook for 2 minutes.
  8. Once smoked, arrange the wings in a greased baking dish.
  9. Pour the sauce over the chicken wings.
  10. Broil the wings for 5 minutes in a preheated broiler.
  11. Serve immediately.
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [/su_row]

Recipe from Foodie Misadventures

4. Mahogany Smoked Wings

Prepare a nicely coloured, smoked wings are seasoned with a perfect blend of honey with molasses, soy sauce and chilli sauce. These sauces penetrate deep into the wings and make it extremely delicious. When smoked, the aroma speaks about the taste itself. [su_row class="ingredients-directions"] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Ingredients" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  • 3 pounds chicken wings split and tips discarded
  • 1/2 cup soy sauce
  • 1/2 cup honey
  • 1/4 cup molasses
  • 2 tablespoons chilli sauce
  • 1 teaspoon ground ginger
  • 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Directions" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  1. Preheat the smoking grill over medium heat.
  2. Mix all the ingredients in a large bowl along with chicken wings.
  3. Marinate the chicken for 1 hour in the refrigerator.
  4. Add the wings to an aluminium baking pan.
  5. Place the pan on the grill and cover the lid.
  6. Smoke the chicken for 60 minutes.
  7. Serve hot.
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [/su_row]

Recipe from Tasty Cookery

By the way, I asked recipe owners for permission to feature their work on this post. If you want your recipe to be featured, please contact me. Plus, I did this post about Smoked chicken thigh recipes that you also want to do for this summer. Enjoy it!
_yoast_wpseo_title: %%title%%

Title: 5 Best Outdoor Electric Grills 2018 : For Patio & Small Place
Content:
A lot people who love the flavor of grilled food just don’t have the space for a large unit or the time to grill with charcoal. In that case, you might be considering buying some of the best outdoor electric grills. Electric models are a handy alternative to traditional grilling. They are also ideal for people who love cooking outdoors but don't want to deal with the hassle of propane or charcoal. If you’re interested in finding a safe and more convenient way to grill on weekends and holidays, then you should take a look at the several electric unit options that are available on the market. The technology has advanced a lot in recent times, so it’s not like you’ll be missing out on a lot by getting one of these. So, we want to help you get the best grill and therefore, review some of the best units available out there for 2018. [supsystic-tables id=31]

Why an Outdoor Electric Grill is a Right Choice for You?

An electric grill stands out from the other available options in many respects, some of which includes the following:

Small in Size & Portable

Traditional gas and charcoal grills come in a wide variety of styles and designs: there are large multi-burner gas units with built-in islands and there are barrel-style charcoal grills. But they might just be too large or too inconvenient for some people as opposed to electric grills that promise enhanced portability.

No Need of Propane

Gas-based models are certainly handy, but some people find it too dangerous to cook with propane. Charcoal units might feel safer in that respect, but they do take considerable time to light and prepare, and cleaning up afterward can be messy. Besides, some apartments and condos ban the use of propane or charcoal altogether.

Hassle-Free & Easy to Use

Electric grills get rid of all of these concerns. They have instant-on controls, easy-to-clean designs, and no smelly gas or messy charcoal to get in the way of your cooking. Plus, there will be no smoke and you don’t have to worry about ever running out of fuel, since all you need to do is plug them in to a standard outlet.

Perfect for Outdoor Usage

Cooking on a deck or balcony in your apartment is also much easier with an electric grill. Cooking in winter is also easier if you’re in a covered area. So, you could grill during the autumn and winter when most people just don’t want to go through the effort of priming their charcoal or firing up a gas burner in the middle of the cold weather.

Reviews of the Best Outdoor Electric Grills for 2018

1. Kenyon B70082 Floridian All Seasons Portable Stainless Steel Electric Grill

This is a rather interesting item and it has gotten great reviews. This is a grill that you’ll probably try if you have a couple of extra dollars lying around, though. Let’s see if its set of features is worth paying a high price for. This small electric BBQ grill runs on a regular 120 volt outlet. It comes with a built-in GFS circuit breaker for extra safety. The grill has been called the Kenyon electric boat grill, as it apparently has become pretty popular with boat lovers. People also have found it convenient for use in their RVs. The grate of any grill is a very important part of it. That is, of course, the surface where the food is cooked, and it can make a difference between deliciously tasting food and something that comes out of the grill tasting “just okay”. The grill grate of the model is covered with a high quality non stick material. The heating element is located right under. The performance of the heating element is exceptional and it provides a very even heat distribution. The grilling surface is 155 square inches and that should give you enough room to grill for several people while remaining small enough for portability and easy storage. With 1300 watts of power, the unit has no problems when it comes to providing all the necessary heat needed. It can go to 600 °F in only ten minutes. This lets you not only cook faster, but is good for saving electricity, which is particular useful when you’re using the electric power on a boat or RV. One of the features that has probably made the unit popular among boat lovers is the fact that it its build quality allows it to be water proof. Since it’s made of stainless steel of higher quality, it can withstand being exposed to salty environments without rusting or looking beat up after just a few weeks. Security has also been taken into consideration. Since it’s electric, there may be a concern about electric shocks while using it and therefore, the grill comes with a GFCI to get rid of such a risk. Cleaning the grill is a breeze. All you need to do is wipe it using a paper towel and you’re done. This is best done right after the gill has cooled down, though, otherwise, you might need to scrub a little harder. The cooking grate is dishwasher safe, so cleaning that is also really easy. Considering all of this, the only really negative thing to say about it is that it’s really expensive. It is more expensive than most electric grills, and in fact it’s even more expensive than full sized gas and charcoal grills. But if you live in a condo or like to enjoy grilled goods on your boat or RV, and you can spare a few bucks, then this grill is worth a try. It’s a high investment, but it’s sure to last for a long time.

Pros

  • Easy to clean and robust construction
  • Quick to heat up
  • Smokeless and water-proof

Cons

  • Really high price
Check Price on Amazon

2. Cuisinart CEG-980 Outdoor Electric Grill with Versa Stand

The unit actually comes in two variants. One with the stand and one without. You do have to pay a little bit extra for the stand, but not too much. It’s really a matter of personal choice if you want to use this grill on as an electric patio grill or as a tabletop electric grill. This is a portable electric grill with a grilling surface of 145 square inches, which is enough to cook eight hamburgers or chicken breast or about four pounds of fish. Naturally, it’s also good for steak; you can fit about eight of them. The grill has a powerful 1,500 watts, 5,120 BTU burner to cook juicy steaks, burgers, and fish just. Thanks to this burner, heat is spread quickly and evenly through the grill grate, which is enameled with porcelain, so food doesn’t stick to it and is easy to clean. The compact design creates a greater watt-to-square-inch ratio, which means higher temperatures on the grate and better, more uniformly cooked food. The grill also has a stainless-steel heat reflector in the lid. The extra layer acts as an insulator that traps heat inside the grill, and reflects rising heat inside the grill back onto the top surfaces of your food, reducing cooking times and saving electricity. It’s also great for when you’re on the move, as the grill is super easy to transport, set up, and store. It has an easy-to-use, easy-to-set-up grill stand that keeps the grill at a comfortable cooking height. The stand easily collapses for when you need to store it. There is also includes a secure front lid lock, which keeps the lid safely closed when the grill is being moved around, and the handle lets you carry the grill just like a briefcase. However, the surface heating up way too much can cause inconvenience especially when cooking outdoors.

Pros

  • Easily portable
  • Different options depending on intended use
  • The lid comes with a lock for safe transportation

Cons

  • The surface can get too hot sometimes
Check Price on Amazon

3. Weber 52020001 Q1400 Electric Grill

This grill is a great alternative if you’re looking for an authentic grilling experience without any of the hassles of a larger grill. It’s suitable for every home, and it’s so easy to use and clean that it could even be used for daily meals. The cooking surface is 189 square inches, which is a decent size. If you’re cooking for a family or if you’re having a small gathering at your home, this grill will give you more than enough space to work with. One thing to consider about the size is you’re not going to be cooking a full-sized chicken or turkey on this grill. A smaller whole chicken will fit inside the grill, but you will get better results cooking smaller, individual pieces. Full size racks and roast cuts of meat will also not be suitable for this grill. This is another compromise that needs to be made with a smaller grill. As long as you are working with smaller cuts you won’t have difficulties, and for the average family this will not be a problem. When you take the model out of the box, you will immediately notice how simple this grill is. There is just a single temperature control probe, which plugs into the side of the grill. It’s easy to adjust and it also feels to be solid and of high quality. The cooking surface is good enough to perfectly cook all of your favorites like vegetables, steak, sausages and hot dogs, burgers, and chicken pieces. You have a good amount of control over the temperature, so you will be able to get it just right for whateveryou’re cooking. There are no individual temperature zones on this grill, so different types of food will have to be cooked separately, or constantly check to make sure that some food is not getting burned while another is still cooking. This grill cooks better with the lid down. One drawback is that the power cord is just six feet long. This is fine for times when you’re using it as a countertop electric grill, but you will probably need an extension cord when you use this grill outside.

Pros

  • Excellent construction materials
  • Compact size makes it perfect for dual usage
  • Fast heat up time

Cons

  • The power cord could be a little bit longer
  • No built-in thermometer and small capacity
Check Price on Amazon

4. George Foreman GGR50B Indoor/Outdoor Electric Grill

This particular grill blends convenience and function. Set up is fairly easy, and the built is very sturdy. In the box you will find the grill itself, a removable grilling plate, a grease tray, the domed lid with an adjustable vent, a power cord which includes the temperature control and a stand. The stand is made out of plastic and aluminum, and the stabilizing legs all clip together, so you won’t need any tools when putting it together. Since the stand is removable, you’ll be able to take this grill from the backyard to the countertop in no time, making it a great indoor and outdoor grill. The grill plate has a non-stick coating to make it durable; easy to clean and to let you cook without using butter or oil. With the five individual heat settings of this grill, you can cook using slow heat or you can set it to searing temperatures. The temperature control will be a familiar experience if you’ve used a gas grill in the past, and a new experience that you’re likely to welcome if you’ve only used charcoal grills. Whatever you want to cook, you’ll be able to easily adjust the temperature for it. Thanks to the electronic controls, heat is perfectly maintained, and the grill has the ability to self-regulate by turning the heating element on or off. There is no need for you to intervene, you just set the temperature and let it do what it has to do. You’ll also get the versatility of outdoor and indoor grilling. You can use it outside with the included stand or put on you counter, a picnic table or another heat-resistant surface. It won’t be a problem, since the body of grill itself has feet at the bottom. And it’s lightweight enough for you to take tailgating or on any excursions. The construction of the grill is also done with two materials, just like the stand. The quality of the materials seems appropriate for the price range, but that is not to say that they are of bad or cheap quality. Aluminum is used for the cooking surface and the lid. The cooking surface is coated in high quality Teflon, which is scratch resistant when used with wooden or plastic utensils. All in all, the build is rather good with the major concern being its lightweightness that causes risks of toppling.

Pros

  • Easy to assemble and robust construction
  • Great for indoor and outdoor use
  • Easy to clean up

Cons

  • Power cord could be a few feet longer
  • A little bit lightweight
Check Price on Amazon

5. Easy Street Electric Cart Grill

This one certainly is an interesting looking grill. There isn’t anything that quite looks like it in the world of electric grills. If you didn’t know it’s an electric grill, you’d probably assume it was a charcoal grill. Not only does it look good, it works well, too. It feels like a real grill, as it should. Assembly is quick and easy. You should be able to get it up and running in less than an hour. The model comes with two foldable wooden side tables where you can put your condiments and utensils, so you don’t have to be running to the table and back. That’s a nice touch that not many compact grills include. There is a little window on the lid, so you don’t have to be constantly opening it to check on your food, which can cause the temperature to drop considerably. The heating element of the unit is another interesting thing. It can be used to create an even heat zone for traditional grilling, a versatile cooking zone with different temperatures and can be converted to fully vertical position for rotisserie. And there is another nice touch of this grill: the included rotisserie attachment. You just load the chicken into the grill and let it cook. It’s super simple. In addition to all that, the rolling cart makes transport of this grill extremely convenient.

Pros

  • Easy to assemble and great design
  • Rotisserie attachment
  • See-through window

Cons

  • Reports of it being delivered with missing parts
Check Price on Amazon

In Conclusion

Time to say which one we think is the Best Outdoor Electric Grill for 2018. And the honor goes to the Kenyon B70082 Floridian All Seasons Portable Stainless Steel Electric Grill. This grill is certainly something. Its design and all the features that it offers certainly set it apart. If you want an electric, portable grill that won’t make you miss what you would have with a larger grill, then we recommend you go for this one. It certainly makes up for all the price you pay for it with its sheer brilliance and functionality.
_yoast_wpseo_title: 5 Best Outdoor Electric Grills: for Patio & Small Place - %%currentmonth%% %%currentyear%%

Title: 7 Best Value Pellet Smoker Grills For The Money In 2018
Content:
Pellet smokers are not only incredibly easy to use but also incredibly powerful. Some say that a pellet smoker is better than any other type of smoker out there. The type of fuel used in these smokers are a specific type of wood pellets. You may be wanting to use other types of wood, but we suggest you stick to using only the pellets sold in stores. In this article, we review the best pellet smokers/grills to help you find yourself a top rated pellet grill. You will not be disappointed by the amazing results of these fabulous machines. [supsystic-tables id=33]  

Reviews of the best pellet smokers/grills

1. Green Mountain Davy Crockett Pellet Grill – WIFI enabled

This excellent pellet smoker under $500 with a unique design has found its way into our list and we love it! Starting with its warranty, we think this is a great offer from the manufacturers for the cost and size of this smoker. It comes with a thermal sensor which constantly monitors the temperature of the grill while cooking. This makes it a good choice to consider when managing temperatures lowering stress while maintaining the right temperatures. Consider this machine as an ultimate choice for a tailgating party because of its lightweight and its easily movable features. It has two foldable legs that allow you to stand it on any flat surface. You can also fold the handles as well. However, you may need to deal with a lot of bending downs as the legs of this machine may be too short for a standard one. This high-end pellet smoker is WIFI enabled which allows you to control temperatures easily while away from the smoker. This is one of the only smokers on the market to offer this option. It also comes with a meat probe connected to the temperature controller that allows you to check on the doneness of the food just by fixing the probe through an access hole to the meat. This is a really cool recommendation for a group of 4 to 6 people and very cost effective on fuel because of the type of pellet it uses. If you are into solar power, this smoker has a 12 Volt jumper cable on a 110 Volt converter. Starting up your device is made easier with this option. With its versatility, you can grill a pork shoulder, bake a pie, BBQ a chicken, and sear whatever meat you like.

Pros

  • Very portable
  • Versatile cooking abilities
  • Good quality build

Cons

  • Legs may be too short
  • It is heavy for its small size
Check Price on Amazon

2. Camp Chef Woodwind Pellet Grill with Sear Box

If you don’t have the time to be babysitting a smoker, this type is the kind to go for. It is designed with smart smoke technology which feeds the firebox pellets necessary for the right temperature. Food is managed by a digital temperature control and automatic auger. For a smoker under $1000, its offerings are worth the purchase. It offers a wide cooking surface area which will serve over 12 people at ease. In addition to its great grill, it comes with a 900 oF side sear box making it the best pellet grill for searing on this list. This provides you with an extra option to sear your food or gives you more space to cook if you need to transfer some food from the main grilling area. It is easily lighted with an added 16,000 BTU stainless steel burner for easy ignition with a temperature range of 160 oF to 500 oF for good control of heat while cooking and an added meat probe to help you check the food’s doneness. Its durable grill grates are enamel coated and made with cast iron adding a pretty finish on food. It comes with an ash cleanout system that simplifies the cleaning process during and after cooking. Just pull out the cleaning lever and you are good to go.

Pros

  • Even and perfect cook
  • Simple and convenient cooking
  • Smokes out amazing flavors

Cons

  • Noisy when cooking
  • Material build could be improved
Check Price on Amazon

3. Traeger TFB65LZBC Texas Elite 34 Wood Pellet Grill and Smoker

Priced as an under $1000 smoker, let’s see what this beauty has to offer. It is one of the most quality builds on the market made of stainless steel and then coated with a durable powder coat finish. This baby will last you for numerous days. Although, you may need to purchase some extra screws to ensure that your smoker is well assembled together. This great build extends itself to its porcelain coated grates allowing it to be used for years with no signs of rust and also allows for an easy clean by the user. You can expect to have excellent results on your food with beautiful grill marks. Temperature control is made easy with its digital elite controller which makes you able to manage temperatures with ease. Its ignition is quick to start meaning there is no stress to be felt when lighting up your device. Also, the pellet type for this smoker is just right to ensure that you are not burning out too much fuel just to cook a good meal. This also makes it the best Traeger pellet smoker available. This smoker has one of the largest cooking surface areas on our list and is highly recommended for a group of 10 to 14 people. You can smoke, grill, bake, roast, braise and BBQ all that you like. If you are thinking of moving the smoker around, you need not worry as it comes with wheels to fulfill this purpose as well as 2 caster lockers to keep it secured to the ground when ready to cook.

Pros

  • 6 in 1 versatility
  • Huge capacity hopper
  • Large cooking size
  • Easy grease managing system

Cons

  • Provides up to 450 oF only
  • No screws provided for mounting
Check Price on Amazon

4. Camp Chef PG24DLX Deluxe Pellet Grill and Smoker

This barrel-shaped device is a portable pellet grill and averagely priced for a mid-level earner. With a good stainless steel build, this is one smoker that you should consider. It's easy to assemble and easy to use making a qualifier for our list. It is an electrical pellet smoker which allows you to light up your pellets with an electronic auto start ignition. This feature of a smoker is definitely one to be excited about as you no longer will need to have special skills to make your fire. The smoker is built with an excellent stainless steel probe which aids in measuring internal temperatures. It also includes a dual LED temperature display for easy checks of temperatures. Clean up is amazing with its exclusive ash cleanout system making it the highest ranked system on the market currently. This allows you to pull out a lever and your ash will find its way out. The temperature range is between 160oF to 500oF which is more than enough range for the variety of items you will be preparing.

Pros

  • Amazing cleaning system
  • Good cooking area
  • Good durability
  • Easy light up

Cons

  • Short warranty period
  • Needs electricity to start up
Check Price on Amazon

5. Pit Boss 71700FB Pellet Grill with Flame Broiler

The first great thing about this grill is its use of 100% natural wood pellets. You will not have to worry whether the pellets were treated with incorrect chemicals. Your health concerns can be at rest with this unique feature. Its grill grates are well built to give you long-lasting usage and beautiful results on your food. They are porcelain coated, cast iron made which is one of the best options to have on the market currently. For a smoker under $500, this baby comes with an innovative flame broiler giving you an added option to broil your food. The burning system is digitally controlled so managing temperatures is made easy. It has one of the largest cooking surface areas there is to find offering an additional cooking rack for when you need extra room to contain your food. It has an electric ignition for quick light up, two durable wheels for easy mobility and a hopper clean out drawer.

Pros

  • Very spacious cooking area
  • Good in size
  • Affordable
  • Easy to clean

Cons

  • Ordinary smoke flavors
Check Price on Amazon

6. Camp Chef Smokepro STX Pellet Grill

This is a decent and cheap smoker with good features. Starting off with its stainless steel build is finished with the silver vein. No further details said that this device will stand against rust over a long period of time. It comes with a digital temperature control, an adjustable chimney top to control the smoke flavors, and a stainless steel meat probe to help check for food’s doneness with ease. Clean out is made easy with its ash cleanout system. You can tuck your brush and dustpan in the shelves, they will not be needed. It also has a grease management system to control the level of grease produced per cook. It has a decent cooking surface area to make food for 8 to 10 people in one round. It also has a utility rack to keep your utensils and tools while cooking and an additional warming rack with a front shelf. This is one of the best smokers under $500 that offers many different types of spaces for usage all in one grill.

Pros

  • Large hopper capacity
  • Even heat and smoke distribution
  • Easy to assemble

Cons

  • Pellets are more expensive
Check Price on Amazon

7. Traeger TFB42LZBC Lil Tex Elite 22 Wood Pellet Grill and Smoker

This pellet smoker does not come cheap, but it has some goodies that are worth the add. It has an electronic auto-start ignition is a really nice feature to have on a smoker so you are not stressing over firing up your pellets. The pellets used for this machine are made of 100% pure hardwood giving you a long lasting burn on your pellets. In the long run, this will be cost-effective to the user. The grill grates are made of porcelain which as we said earlier is one of the best materials to have in the construction of your smoker. It does not wear and tear easily with its stainless steel build and powder coated finishing. The temperature controls are also digital versus manual making this easy to set the exact temperatures desired. Finally, move your smoker around as much as you want and have the ability to stabilize it wherever thanks to the locking casters attached to the wheel.

Pros

  • 6 in 1 versatile cooking
  • Easy temperature setting
  • Easy to clean
  • Easy to use

Cons

  • Needs electrical powering up
Check Price on Amazon

What is the best pellet smoker/ grill for us?

On this round of smokers, we are drawn towards technology being one of the things to have on a pellet smoker. The question is, what is the best pellet smoker? Our best choice will be the Green Mountain Davy Crockett Pellet Grill. It has the most amazing features on this list and is easily affordable. Its wifi temperature control enablement! Who doesn’t need this in a world that is so tech driven? You literally do not have to pamper your smoker to work, just leave it and control it from wherever with its app. It is also portable which means a student could have this in his apartment and make food for his friends. Its weight may be relative but we think it is still fine to move around without killing yourself. It is great for everyone!

Features to look out for when purchasing the best pellet smoker/grill

They are heavily flavor driven

Pellet smokers are a unique type of smoker which generates quality smoky flavors rather than the acrid smoke produced from smoking or grilling on straight fire. This is why you should purchase the best value smoker to highlight the flavors of your food.

Easy and convenient use

Pellet smokers are known not only for their versatility but also for their quick and easy to use instructions. They are easy to assemble, easy to light up, easy to control temperature with and easy to clean. You will realize that soon enough, grilling at home will be a lovely tradition that the whole family will love to partake in because of the simplicity of its use.

Go for good pricing

You don’t have to break the bank when purchasing one of these high-end smokers. There are plenty of options on the market that offer you the best value for your budget. Taking your needs into consideration, you will be able to cross check from the list below and make a great purchase for the money. For what it is worth, please take the time to do the research when looking for the best wood pellet smoker. Don’t let time get the best of you and rush you into making a silly decision.

Great quality build is the best

The best material to look for would be stainless steel and porcelain coats. They are very long lasting materials and have the ability to withstand the test of time and rust from weather changes. You should also consider other features that come with the smoker. Ensure that it’s fire pit, grates, vents and flame deflector drip pan are built with stainless steel. These features tend to do most of the heavy duty stuff, so you want to ensure that they will last for a lifetime.

Consider food output

When looking for a high-end pellet smoker, consider how much food you will be preparing regularly. If you are just planning to cook for you and your family then you may not need a large pellet smoker. A small or portable pellet grill will suffice your needs. If you plan on cooking for large amounts of people or hosting large events and parties then you may want to consider buying a larger unit. There are several on the market available to you so make sure and know what your serving size needs will be.

Take note of temperature control

Always look out for a pellet smoker that has a temperature algorithm that is able to hold a constant temperature despite the condition of the weather at hand. Most pellet grills are designed with antiquated timing sequences to stabilize the cooking temperature within the smoker. No need to worry with controlling temperatures using the dampers or vents as this is already almost sorted.

Minimise the burning of fuel

First of all, burning fuel is not a very eco-friendly practice, so let’s try to avoid this as much as possible. Thanks to the less-fuel-burn technology equipped with pellet smokers, you will not need to use nearly as much fuel as you would think. With that being said, purchase a pellet grill that will be very fuel efficient when cooking. You can save that extra money on some more burgers!

The hopper size is key

Look for a sizeable hopper when making a purchase. This advice will come in handy especially for when you have to cook overnight. It is specifically designed to hold as much heat as possible within the smoker to prevent the use of extra fuel, and constant checks of temperature. This automatically yields good results and is what everybody wants. Gauge for a size of about 40 pounds to keep you in a good target zone.

Check for warranty

Make sure to always check to make sure the warranty will either outweigh the price or the decision you are making. Make sure to research this and make sure that the unit you purchase comes with a great warranty. It does not make sense to buy a product without a warranty.  And if a pellet smoker is not what you’re looking for, you might want to read this article to know about other types smokers to use.
_yoast_wpseo_title: 7 Best Pellet Smoker Grills For The Money In %%currentmonth%% %%currentyear%%

Title: 6 Best Smokers For Beginners To Consider Buying In 2018
Content:
Barbecuing may be a daunting task for anyone who is new to smoking, and if you are in a position where the use of a smoker or grill is totally new to you, you may find yourself making unnecessary mistake which will not give you the best of food results. As a result, we thought to share some of the best smokers for beginners on the market which are designed to help every new smoker have a smooth use of it for no havocs or bad results. These smokers are the most easiest and convenient to use giving you the flare to work at your best comfort with it. Their designs are also very simple so the new user will not have to stress about how to assemble or how to use a certain part of it. They are that straightforward to use. This review is based on their convenience, size, material build, price, warranty and added features. Hence, we encourage you to go through the list and make the choice that will work amazing for you . We look forward to you have a great time. [supsystic-tables id=34]   [su_expand more_text="View more" less_text="View less" height="420" hide_less="no" text_color="#3a3a3a" link_color="#cdcdcd" link_style="default" link_align="center" more_icon="chevron-down" less_icon="chevron-up" class="customz"]

What then qualifies a smoker to be great for a beginner?

They are easy and convenient

One thing is for sure, if they are meant to be for entry level use, then they should be by all means easy and convenient to use. Read as much as you can about them, if there are any contrary talks against this feature, you are free to ignore it.

They are less costive

These smokers are meant to help you learn how to smoke, so they definitely should be low in cost so that you can purchase them and practice with them. How are you sure that smoking is an activity that you will like except you try it? So, why not try it on a smoker with a very low cost and build your way up into more advanced, pricier versions as you master the art. Hence said, if an entry level smoker is going for a ton, please do not consider it.

Source of heat

This is a very important point. All BBQ smokers have different power up sources, so you should look for one that works well for the kind of power that works for you. It is usually better to use a propane or electric smoker as most entry level users already have some experience using gas or electric cookers, making this type of smokers’ use easier. Firing up, managing heat and temperatures with electric and propane smokers are much easier than a charcoal or pellet smoker. However, the charcoal and pellet smokers are quick to light up with one try or two, and you’re good. What is most important is the availability of fuel type in your location, so you can make a choice that fits it.

Enjoy versatile cooking

Simply because you are new to smoking does not mean you should be stuck to only grilling chicken breasts. Learning is a progressive act and so you should be able to explore the various options for this kind of cooking especially in your early days. Then, when you are a pro you can do the harder stuff. So with this said, go for a starter smoker grill that offers the opportunity to grill, smoke, braise, bbq, sear etc with it. The combination of choice is up to you. In all you do, don’t get stuck to a singular use.

Be sure it is of a great build

It is probably your first time going to buy a smoker, you don’t want to be shabby about your purchase because you are just trying it out? Look out for a great build, stainless steel, cast iron, porcelain coated qualities. These materials are known to last for a long time so you can expect to use the smoker for a great while. As a beginner, there will be a number of mistakes that may be committed, make sure the smoker you are considering getting is friendly enough to allow you explore your best self without getting ruined.

How big is it?

Do you have to break a wall to create space for your smoker? Of course not! Always go for an option that is small enough to fit in any space. Vertical smokers are usually the best with regards to space saving. They are able to fit well on a balcony and some are even designed to be for a table top. That cute! Do not be fancily driven by the beast like looking smokers already, take a breather and get something smaller in size for the meantime as you grow in grilling skills, the larger types will fit into your needs just well.

It should then be portable

As a build up from the previous point, if the smoker is of good size for you, you can now check for its portability. For its size, you should be able to move it around easily. Considering that a college student may be using this, you definitely know that your apartment’s space is small and there will be a need to move the smoker around a bit. Don’t go for something that you can’t move around by yourself. It will be a waste of time. Camping and tailgating parties may be common to you at this point in your life, as you will be highly blooded to show of your skills. Again, you will need to carry your smoker around for these gathering. Ensure that the weight is light enough for you to carry all by yourself.

Controlling temperature should be easy

Temperature control is key when using any smoker. More advanced smokers may be more complicating to control temperatures with, so you don’t want to indulge yourself in this stress. Buy a smoker that offers you easiness to control temperature with. Look out for what the temperature gauge offers and be sure it fits your needs. Another tip may be to find a friendly useful thermometer to add as a support for when things seem tough on the smoker. You will be in good place knowing that your food will turn out great at the end.

What is the rack offering?

Do you want to cook for just yourself or do you want to share with others? Factor your answer into purchasing a smoker of this calibre. We said earlier to go for small enough sizes but this does not mean that should be making 1 sausage at a time. That’s cruelty! Your beginner smoker should be able to feed at least 4 people at a go, so this can be a good standard to use when making your buy. [/su_expand]

Reviews of the best smokers for beginners

1. Classic Pit Barrel Cooker Package 18 ½ in

In our series of smokers, you will realise that this Pit Barrel smokers has been one of our all time favorite, and in this list, it makes itself as one of the best types of smokers for beginners out there. It is a simple barrel with 2 hanging rods and 8 stainless steel hooks that allows the user to hang meat or food, and leave it to cook. It is a typical “set it and leave it” kind of a smoker, so as a beginner you have no business worrying about continually adjusting anything to get the food to cook well. It is averagely priced and with a little saving here and there, you should be able to buy one at ease. This Pit Barrel cooker actually offers more than just for a beginner, but is designed to be very easily used by anyone making it one of our choicest. It is solidly built making it one of the most loved smokers on the market today. A simple 30 gallon porcelain coated steel drum that has been proven to stay in good shape for many years. This is one that you want to get for your college school days and still keep using for when you start a family, and it will serve you well with no problems. It has a standard grill grate which gives you a combined option with the hooks to make food for 12 and above people in one turn. This may be a challenging feature as the grill grates may not be enough for diverse cooking, but we believe the the food results yielded covers for this shortfall. It is a very easy to use charcoal smoker and portable to move around to just anywhere that you will like it to be. It is a vertical smoker, so from our introduction, this serves a great purpose on space.

Pros

  • Assembling is easy
  • Produces consistently impressive results
  • Versatile option for cooking
  • Large capacity for grilling

Cons

  • May be pricey for a beginner
Check Price on Amazon

2. Camp Chef Smoker 24" Smoke Vault Extra Large SMV24

Words are not enough to describe the unique design of this smoker, it looks just exactly like a vault. So, you know what, you have got treasure in store for you with this one. It may be complained to be heavy, but this is simply as a result of its build with heavy-gauge steel designed to be as solid as a vault. It sits two cooking grids, one jerky smoky rack, two adjustable smoking racks and a porcelain coated removable base. From this you are in a good place to make so much food for a medium sized party. Fire up this smoker with a matchless snap - ignition, and be good to make your cooking dreams come true. Then, the beauty of this vertical vault is its amazing space saving design that still offers 903 square inches in cooking area, meaning, the design of this baby was well thought of. Although, one disadvantage is the lack of its heat holding build which will have made it just perfect. It has 3 adjustable damper valves which gives you many options to control airflow into the smoker, and then the temperature can be monitored with the door thermometer attached to it. Life made easy! Now, on saving the best for the last, this is the only smoker in this series and many others out there that offers the user an excellent set of recipes, cooking tips and ideas making it an excellent meat smoker to purchase. Now, for a beginner, this added feature will come in handy to help glide your way through grilling to becoming a chef of your own standards.

Pros

  • Easy to read and control temperatures
  • Good heat output
  • Easy to clean
  • Very sturdy

Cons

  • Not insulated
Check Price on Amazon

3. Weber 741001 Original Kettle 22-Inch Charcoal Grill

Are you on a super tight budget? This smoker is the one for you priced under $100. This kettle style is a charcoal smoker built with plated steel and enameled with porcelain on the bowl and lid. The grates are plated steel made, so rust is likely not to be a problem with it. Its temperature vents are designed to be rust - resistant and the handles are made with glass reinforced nylon. We think the material build on this is a good one, however, for the fact that it is not completely done with stainless steel, we will advise that a cover be bought for it to give it a longer life span. It is a very good heat resistant smoker with the ability to lock in a good amount of heat within the smoker while you cook. Hence, you do not have to worry about constantly checking your fire to ensure that you have this aspect covered. Cleaning is made easy with its ash cleanout system that has an aluminum ash catcher. Ash is collected into an ashtray that can be easily removed and cleaned after smoking. If you hate the after clean ups, this will work for you.

Pros

  • Has heat resistant handles
  • Excellent air flow system
  • Easy to assemble
  • Temperature control is easy

Cons

  • No open lid hinge support
  • No side table for extra working
Check Price on Amazon

4. Masterbuilt 20070910 30-Inch Black Electric Digital Smoker, Top Controller

This is one of the best vertical electric smokers for beginners covering the needs of space and power availability which is great for a new user. A quick advice; while positioning the smoker ensure to not keep this in the way due to its sharper edges that could create body scratches. This should not scare you however. It has a feature for managing temperatures which is a very key part to smoking that you should take note of. It is made with digital temperature and timer controls with a digital panel and RF remote control which allows you control temperature easily from a distance. This makes its use as simple as possible. To top on temperature control is the top air damper attached to the smoker which is to aid with managing temperatures more easily. It is averagely priced as an under $200 which is a good amount for its digital features. Cooking space is massive with this one allowing the user to make food for not less than 14 people in one turn. It makes available 4 chrome-coated racks for this purpose that give out a beautiful design on your food for that attraction that you will love. Keeping your smoky flavors locked in is provided for, with its side loading wood chips compartment. As you grill food, you will come to the realisation that smoky flavors are the magic to winning the love of your friends over. Finally, beneath the racks is a removable dripping pan to aid with an easy clean up. Grease from the food drips into the pan, and after cooking, all you need to do is to remove the pan and do a few wipes here and there. Your smoker should be as good as sparkling afterwards.

Pros

  • Monitors internal temperatures
  • Even cooking is attained
  • Holds heat very well

Cons

  • Spill shield edges are sharp
Check Price on Amazon

5. Weber 721001 Smokey Mountain Cooker 18-Inch Charcoal Smoker, Black

This Weber device is the space saving smoker that you need when space is a main factor that drives your decision to purchase a smoker. It is a vertical capsule like charcoal smoker that offers the user a good cooking area to grill some chicken breast, sausages, burgers and veggies which should feed at least 10 people in one turn. So, this may go beyond a best smoker to buy for beginners, but it still offers friendly processes to allow a new user to use it just fine. It uses charcoal as a power source so you are guaranteed of that char grill taste in your food unlike an electric smoker, and this puts the new user on a higher ranking in cooking. People get to taste your food, and they are blown away by the traditional flavors oozing out of your food. Fueling might be more expensive for this smoker especially if you are very low on budget. However, the chargrill food results is worth breaking the safe for. It also comes with a water pan to aid the user create moisture while cooking which is a super essential aspect for when smoking food. Otherwise, you may end up having very dry food which will not be enjoyable. Take a look at our article on how to use a smoker grill for guidance. Now, let’s talk about its build. This Weber device has a rust resistant aluminum heat shield that locks heat in well and is cool to touch on the outside while grilling. It is also, completely coated with porcelain for a difficult wear and tear. It sits in 2 nickel-plated cooking grates for a long lasting use, and a heat resistant nylon handle to touch while still hot within. On temperature, it is constructed with an effective thermometer and vents on both the bowls and lid for maximum control of temperature for the best food results. You will not need to purchase an extra thermometer for a great cook.

Pros

  • Retains heat for superior grilling
  • Easy to add fuel while cooking
  • Easy to assemble, use and clean
  • Easy temperature monitoring

Cons

  • Not quite affordable
Check Price on Amazon

6. Dyna-Glo DGO1176BDC-D Charcoal Offset Smoker

Go beyond just cooking for yourself or two friends and make more food for your college friends with the wide cooking area this smoker offers. It is a vertical smoker with a side fire box which make this feature one of our favorite choices. It is an offset smoker, one of the space saving offset types on the market designed with thoughts of the beginner in mind. Read our article here on how offset smokers work which will help you appreciate the simplicity of this machine. It is a solidly built smoker made with heavy duty steel and coated with high temperature powder coat finish. Such a design will go for years and not have a single rust on it. However, to be wise about long life span, always get a cover for your smokers. It is charcoal fueled with a wood chip box offer to improve the char grill flavors on your food by loading in flavored wood chips of your choice. Still on charcoal, firing is made easy with its electronic pulse ignition system fired through a cast iron burner. This means, you can say goodbye to charcoal lighting techniques and rather have the electrical power ups do the job. Aside from the fact that we love the pretty design, that this smoker has, the grill grates are amazing for pretty grill marks on your meat, and afterwards you can clean up easily with its removable steel ash pan.

Pros

  •  Quick and reliable ignition system
  • Minimized heat loss while smoking
  • Improves smoky flavors

Cons

  • Leakages in the non-vent areas
Check Price on Amazon

What is the best smoker for a beginner?

Having said much, our basis for choosing the most ideal smoker will be based on convenience and design of the smoker. For this reason the Classic Pit Barrel Cooker Package will be our best pick. First of all, the barrel and straight forward set up is one of the simplest to assemble leaving you with more time to prep up your food. It has a strong stainless steel build with enough hooks to cook so much food in good temperature. One more love, this smoker is a typical “set it and go” device. Nobody wants to have to stand by a smoker all day to cook, so this feature makes the purchase worth it. Set it and get on with life. It has a solid build and goes beyond feeding you and your bestie only, but you can throw a party, and everyone will be satisfied from your food.
