Title: 6 Best Electric Smokers For The Quickest Sizzling BBQs
Content:
Come along as we take you into the world of electric smokers which are amazing blessings to the barbecue world. They are most loved for two things; their fastness to cooking foods and their cheap operational benefits. Electric smokers as the name goes are simply smokers that use electricity as a source of powering. For the fact that electricity is widely available everywhere, this makes this option of a smoker perfect to have. No fueling stress et al. These devices are amazing food makers and for this reason we chose to review 6 of the best electric smokers there is to find on the market based on their prices, their cooking areas, their durability, their flavoring components, and their warranty offerings. [supsystic-tables id=51]   [su_expand more_text="View more" less_text="View less" height="420" hide_less="no" text_color="#3a3a3a" link_color="#cdcdcd" link_style="default" link_align="center" more_icon="chevron-down" less_icon="chevron-up" class="customz"]

A great electric smoker should have these basic things.

You are probably excited and getting convinced with regards to getting an electric smoker already, but just quickly before you jump into getting just anyone of them, you may want to read further to find out what the top rated electric smokers consist of. Also, read our write-up on how to use an electric smoker to give you a better understanding of electric smokers work for your perfect buy.

Are they built strong and sturdy?

You may often waive off this feature when a buying device like this because of the excitement to get one and start using soon enough. However, the “soon enough” feeling may be a disastrous one in the next year or two if you do not stress on making a purchase that is built with strong materials to handle heavy duty cooking. Electric smokers are one of the great kinds to use in all weathers; be it cold or warm weathers which means that the wear and tear rate on these kinds are higher as some of them allow for both indoor and outdoor use. Make sure it is sturdily built with materials like steel and coated with porcelain for example. These materials stand the test of time.

Consider your average serving size

Dear reader, you will not be cooking for yourself and significant other only, you will need to make provision for other people. At the same time, you may not be up for cooking for very big numbers, so you should do a calculation of the target number of people you will want to serve at a party in your house. This way, your smoker gets to make food for both domestic offerings and for bigger celebrations. This does not mean buying a gigantic smoker to satisfy party needs, your sizable smoker should be able to do 3 to 6 rounds of foods to feed the numbers that you desire.

Money, money, money! Put this into consideration.

An electric smoker is a great asset to have but does not mean, the bank has to suffer for this. Prepare your budget way ahead of time and stick to it, however, making it flexible for a little add up or deduction. Do not go head on to just buying a smoker grill because we said electric smokers are the fastest producing kinds to have. They come in various prices based on brand names, sizes etc. Look out for the price that fits you best and still has all the amazing qualities that you need. Proceed to make you purchase from there!

It should definitely have a flavoring component.

No compromising on this! Flavors and BBQs go together without doubt, so every smoker must have a flavoring component so as an electric smoker. Every good electric smoker must have a wood chip box to allow you load flavored wood chips to boost up the smoky flavors in your food when cooking. These chip loaders are specially designed and structured for this purpose, so this goes to tell you that if you ever need those smoky flavors in your food, and your electric smoker does not have this feature, you cannot put your wood chips in a pan and place it in the smoker with hopes to get your smoky flavors. Come on, it will not work! Insist on this feature, it is better to have than not to.

What should your best value option have?

Now, go deeper into what your best choice should have. Like a girlfriend or boyfriend, you definitely have those unshakeable qualities that you definitely want to have. Well, so as an electric smoker. It is your choice so you must get the best that melts your heart.

It should be easy to use and maintain.

Nobody wants to battle with a smoker before you can make food, and we know you do not want this either. Do a good read on reviews to be sure that the pretty looking smoker is not problematic to use. This is where warranties come in, so you should insist on buying a device that has warranty coverage. Just so you can return the smoker to the manufacturers if it has some production issues that should not be your burden to bear. Using a smoker should be as simple as reciting ABC especially for domestic users. Most electric are hence designed to serve this need, so any kind that does not offer it should be strongly questioned.

Ensure temperature and heat control are instituted

Without further say, temperature and heat control are essential for smoking food, and we thought we should stress on it again. Simply because this is an electric smoker does not mean that once you power up the device and tuck your food in, everything is going to work out just fine. You will need to take charge of these controls. Most electric smokers have a thermometer and timer built in them to allow you set the temperature and time for how you will like the food to be cooked. They should also have caveats which are small ventilation systems which allows for releasing heat and smoke while cooking for a stable internal temperature.

Will the smoker fit well in your space?

Most electric smokers can be used both indoors and outdoors, and are usually not grand in size like other kinds of smokers. If using the smoker outdoor, you may have plenty of space to position it, but if you may need to use it indoors, this is where space becomes a crucial factor. As a result, use your indoor space as a yardstick for determining the size of your smoker so that you can have the best fit in both areas. You also, want to ensure that its size is portable enough to have you move it around with ease. Like we said, most electric smokers are great on the outlook size, but weight can only be determined when you try moving it around. Look out for its weight dimension; most manufacturers will list this for you, and be sure that you will be able to carry it, say with the help of another person before you buy it.

Your ideal smoker should be able to do at least two kinds of cook.

At least, it should be able to grill and smoke while other functions can be to roast, sear, bake etc. However, you want to consider killing two birds with a stone, so ensure that this feature is made available. The essence of devices, be it smokers or a phone, a washing machine etc., is to be able to perform a particular function in 2 or more forms, so versatility has to be key when making your choice of an electric smoker. Look out for the other function that you will so desire to have and base your buy on it.

The grill grates should aid with layer structuring.

You will not be grilling sausages, or burgers all the days of your smoking life. There will be a need to grill a full turkey or larger portions and this is where flexibility will serve you well. Aim for adjustable grill grates that allow you reposition your grates to fit the food in well for a great cook even if it is a small electric smoker. If the beautiful looking, affordable smoker has non-adjustable grill grates, we back you up to gladly tuck that choice to the side.Focus on this option of flexibility and you will make a variety of recipes for years. The trick to having adjustable grill grates also aids with creating extra cooking space within. So, like we said earlier about cooking spaces, this feature is an influencer to making your choice. [/su_expand]

Reviews of the best electric smoker

1. Char-Broil Deluxe Digital Electric Smoker, 725 Square Inch

A pretty design with a good cooking space, this device is strongly built. It is a double walled built kind making the insulation of heat one that is of great benefits to the food being cooked. It is a cheaper smoker than many out there, being an under $250 type, but comes with 4 adjustable cooking racks to give you great control of your space creation needs. Its special feature is its glass door that allows the user view foods while it cooks. This kills the urge to open the smoker while cooking which is bound to happen due to the eagerness to see the turnout of the food while it cooks. So, you can view the food at ease while it cooks. It offers a blue LED display screen to help you view the cooking temperature of the food for any forms of adjustments necessary. You can also remove its thermometer for other purposes which is beneficial for budget saving if there is the need to purchase a thermometer for other uses. Although, there have been complaints of the thermometer reading incorrectly sometimes. So, maybe a backup food thermometer may be necessary if you face this problem It comes with a grease tray for trapping grease and juices when cooking and a large stainless steel locking latch for keeping the door tightly locked when cooking. This is essential for ensuring a good sit of heat within the smoker during the cook. Finally mobility is made easy with its wheels and integrated handles, and like we said ensure that your choice if portable enough. This smoker offers this feature beautifully.

Pros

  • Ideal for outdoor cooking
  • It is durable
  • Easy assembling
  • Easy to move around

Cons

  • Oversized front sticker hard to remove
Check Price on Amazon

2. Masterbuilt 20078715 Electric Digital Smoker Front Controller, 30-Inch

As an under $300 device being one for the best price on Masterbuilt electric smoker, this device offers a wide cooking area to be able to make food for 5 and above people. It is built with 4 chrome coated racks, which are adjustable to create more space as you will desire. It is built with very good heating elements which allows it sit in the right amounts of heat for the perfect cook. Then, to aid with ensuring that the internal heating system is accurate for your food, you may use its top air damper to release smoke and heat from the food while it cooks. Remember we spoke about caveats a few lines above; the added damper makes it a good choice to consider. Then, it allows for the user to easily read the levels of temperature being used to cook with its Blue LED display that shows the details of temperatures while you cook. On smoky flavors, you have a side wood chip loading system in institution which will generate all the smoky flavors that you can get. On added features, this device also offers a front access drip pan for easily cleaning. This simply means that, while cooking, the drip pan collects all dripping grease and juices from the food just so you are assured of an easy clean afterwards. It is a front door loading smoker for easy access to the food, but we will have preferred to have a meat probe for checking the internal temperatures of the food for an amazing use. Nonetheless, you will still be guaranteed of a great cook with this smoker.

Pros

  • For both indoor and outdoor use.
  • Easy to clean
  • Durable
  • Easy to reach and maintain desired temperature.

Cons

  • Heavy to move around
  • Requires frequent cleaning
Check Price on Amazon

3. Smokin-It Model #1 Electric Smoker

This smoker is a very portable and lightweight smoker which is ideal for easy move arounds. It comes with a smoke flavor creation box, which takes care of the needs of smoky flavors in your food. However, for its high price above $300, this smoker offers all the basic features that we speak of and nothing extra for the added cents. It has 4 cooking grates in total with 3 being adjustable for space. This is actually not a bad feature as you will be able to create just enough space for your needs. It has a great steel build, which is very essential for weather changes, and has a 400 watt heating element to create good heat for an excellent cook. Position its drip pan well before cooking, and you can be sure that cleaning afterwards will not be a problem at all. Finally, is its fiberglass insulation system which is a more advanced form for locking the right levels of heat in the smoker while you cook. Since, the right heat is a determinant for great food turnouts; we especially like this smoker for this feature.

Pros

  • It is portable and lightweight
  • It has great build quality
  • It has a good insulation system

Cons

  • No digital temperature display
  • No built-in thermometer
Check Price on Amazon

4. Masterbuilt 20073716 Portable Electric Smoker

This smoker is specially chosen for the budget focused smoker, who has just $100 to spend on a smoker. It is below $100 making it our favorite electric smoker for the money. It has a 1, 400W heating element which makes it a power booster for great food. For its cost, we think this feature makes it a great asset to have with guarantees that you will have the best control of heat. It sits in 2 chrome coated racks ideal for small cooks, say for a family of 4. In 2 to 3 rounds, you can go on to making dinner for when the in-laws, and a few cousins come by your house. The results from the grills are also amazing leaving such pretty sear marks on your food after cooking. It comes with a wood chip tray, and graciously with a water pan to aid with moisture creation in the smoker while it cooks. Not many electric smokers have this water pan feature, so we especially like this affordable home electric smoker for it. Controlling temperatures here is superb as it offers three levels for its temperature gauge settings; high, medium and low which is great way to control temperatures for an entry level smoker. It is easily movable and comes with strong legs to help you stand it on any level surface. This makes it ideal for tailgating parties or for road trips. Just remember that you will need to have an electricity power source to use it if you move it around.

Pros

  • Temperature reading is easy
  • Very affordable
  • Very easy to operate

Cons

  • Poor heat insulation
Check Price on Amazon

5. Masterbuilt 20077515 Front Controller Electric Smoker with Window and RF Controller, 30-Inch

Well, talking of an advanced electric meat smoker, we thought of this amazing device. It is the only smoker on our list that offers an RF remote system that allows the user control temperatures from a short distance away from the smoker. There have been very few complaints about its remote not synchronizing well with the smoker’s controls, but we believe this can be solved on the back of the warranty offering in case you encounter this problem. This means its integrated thermostat temperature control system is accurately built ensuring that temperatures and time are easy to set and read accurately even when placed under direct sunlight, thanks to its blue LED display. Proceed to controlling heat within the smoker by using its side and/ or top air dampers for this. It is a very durable build with a full foam insulation system to keep heat within the smoker allowing for a cool touch on the outside while it cooks. It offers 4 adjustable chrome coated racks which will last you many years of use, the option to create extra space when cooking, and the beauty of grill marks it leaves on the food when done cooking. On flavors, a wood chip loading system is provided for to allow you load flavored wood chips into the smoker to give off all the amazing flavors that you can imagine. Then, this model also takes care for your cleaning needs with its added drip pan to trap all falling foods, juices and grease for a very easy clean after the cook. Move this smoker around with ease with its attached wheels, you basically may not need a helping hand to get it to your preferred destination.

Pros

  • Ensures even and consistent smoking
  • Easy to determine food temperature while cooking
  • It is durable
  • Easy to assemble

Cons

  • It does not smoke at lower temperatures
Check Price on Amazon

6. Jim Beam BTDS76JB Bradley Smoker 4-Rack Digital Outdoor Smoker

Why this model? We love it for its quick ignition system. It sits separate burners for oven heat and wood smoke which means an easier fire lighting feature, and a total control on the levels of heat that cooks your food. It comes with 4 grilling racks within and a fully heat insulated feature for a great and even cook. Use the racks for making as much food as your will desire, approximately for 4 people in one turn. Hence, more in 3 to 4 turns. It sits in an automatic wood feeder system which means all you need to do on creating smoke flavors will be to load your wood chips and leave it. This system will automatically feed the smoke generator wood chips as and when there is a need. Its digital controls are great for adjusting time, temperature and even smoke settings; this gives you all the control that you need to create the best atmosphere within your food for the best of foods. It is a decently priced smoker and for a brand that is not as commonly known, this is a typical example of a purchase that should not be driven by brand names. We will have loved it to come with a water pan for creating moisture which will have made it all the better, but guess what, you can always use an aluminum tray to serve this purpose.

Pros

  • Automatic feeding of wood bisquettes
  • Quality build up
  • Total smoke flavoring control

Cons

  • Unequal heat share internally
Check Price on Amazon

What is the best electric smoker by us?

After conducting a careful electric smoker review, it can be concluded that the best electric smoker from our search will be the Char-Broil Deluxe Digital Electric Smoker, 725 Square Inch. This smoker has great features that we love that contain and surpass the other features of all the other smokers on this list. It is a great build with double walled material construction, it is very affordable while offering a good cooking area to make food for at least 5 people . Its cooking grates are adjustable, hence still on the talk of space it allows the user create more space within the rack for more food. Then, its heat circulation is all rounded allowing for an even cook within the smoker. It is a front loading smoker with a glass door for easy food viewing while it cooks. So like we said, don’t itch to sickness just because you want to see how your food is doing when cooking. Just view! Finally, cleaning is made easy with its removable easy-to-clean drip pan Finally, we've created a comprehensive guide about best smokers, if you want to refer more to make your BBQ party more funny and diverse, let's check 5 popular types of smoker

Title: Grilled Chicken Marinade Recipes To Be Made At Home
Content:
Do you and your family enjoy grilled chicken? I am sure you have chicken on the table at least one day of the week as everyone is sure to enjoy it. It is good to be made for lunch or dinner time and the chicken can be coated with mouth-watering marinades, rubs or sauces. You can throw the chicken on the grill on a BBQ night on any of the days and you are on your way to adding a slightly tangy flavor to each bite of the juicy grilled chicken. The perfectly grilled chicken seasoned with the marinades makes the flavors incredible. These are perfect and awesome Grilled Chicken Marinade recipes to follow with easy ingredient list and guidelines.

1. Chef Paul’s Easy Marinade

This herb filled marinade comes together beautifully in this easy marinated grilled chicken. This recipe adds rich color and there will be no leftovers as everyone will want a second serving.

Recipe from From Valerie's Kitchen

2. Brown Sugar Balsamic Grilled Chicken Marinade

You are on your way to grilling a fantastic dinner with this marinade. It is so simple you can prepare the meal just in 20 minutes. Marinate for 24 hours for a juicy and moist chicken.

Recipe from Delightful E Made

3. Miracle Rub Chicken

Honey, cilantro, and lime make the perfect marinade for the chicken. The rub comes together quickly and the chicken is soaked up in the delicious flavors. The result is a sweet and tangy chicken. [su_row class="ingredients-directions"] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Ingredients" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  • 2 lbs skinless and boneless chicken breasts
  • 0.50 cup honey
  • 0.25 cup lime juice
  • 1 tbsps olive oil
  • 2 tbsps Soy Sauce
  • 2 minced garlic cloves
  • 0.50 cup chopped cilantro
  • 0.50 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Directions" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  1. Insert the skinless, boneless chicken breasts or thighs into a Ziploc bag.
  2. Place the lime juice, soy sauce, honey, garlic, olive oil, cilantro, salt and pepper in a bowl.
  3. Combine all the ingredients in the bowl.
  4. Fold in the marinade over the chicken and secure the bag.
  5. Allow marinading the chicken for 3 hours or 24 hours.
  6. Set the grill to medium-high heat.
  7. Place the chicken on the grill and grill for 4 minutes per side until done.
  8. Serve warm.
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [/su_row]

Recipe from The Recipe Critic

4. Singapore Style Chicken Marinade

This low carb marinade has so much flavor. The tender chicken is marinated in the thick yogurt marinade which is simple but delicious in flavours. The chicken is filled with natural juices.

Recipe from Joy Filled Eats

By the way, I asked recipe owners for permission to feature their work on this post. I also do a post about Grilled Chicken Wings Recipes, hope you like it.

Title: How To Use A Charcoal Grill In 14 Pictured Steps
Content:
Grilling food is one of the fastest ways to barbecue and by using a charcoal grill, you will be in for flavors that cannot be traded with anything else. Grilling with charcoal is the best traditional form of cooking meats, hamburgers, pork ribs etc as it takes you to deep smoky roots. Hence, in this article we share easy steps with pictures to teach you how to use a charcoal grill to achieve great flavored food that is scrumptious on all sides. Come along as we explore them!

1. First, you need a charcoal grill and some charcoal

Charcoal grills are very different from charcoal smokers with most of them coming in smaller sizes and designed for a quick cook. Do a good scan on the market if you do not have one to help you get the best that will fit your needs. In our article on the best charcoal grills, we share 10 different kinds that will serve as a good guide for you for making a good choice. You will also need a bag of charcoal which will be the sole source of fueling.

2. Next, clean the grates thoroughly

This is a critical part of the grilling process whether you are using a brand new smoker or an existing one. With the help of a grill brush, brush the grates thoroughly to remove any hardened grease, dust or ashes sitted on the grates. These components if not removed could find their way into the food while you cook in the form of germs and can be harmful to the health. Insist on not missing this step.

3. Fill the fire box with charcoal

Once the grill grates are well cleaned, remove them and fill the fire box with as much charcoal as you will need. Do ensure to use a decent amount of charcoal when you start cooking as you will not want to heat up your grill too much. It is often better to start with an average amount of charcoal for good heat, and in the middle of grilling your food, you may add up some more charcoal.

4. Light up the charcoal with a chimney

In this step, we teach you how to light your coals with a chimney. A chimney as seen below is widely sold and affordable aimed at helping you light your charcoal with ease. Pour some amount of charcoal, two thirds way up the chimney. With the help of lighter, light the coals through the holes situated at the bottom of the chimney. Once a few coals have lighted, leave the chimney in open air to allow all or most of the coals to light. Once lighted, pour the coals in the unlighted charcoal in the grill with the lid open for the charcoal to light up.

5. You can also use organic fire starter for lighting

This may be an easier option for lighting up your coals as they light up pretty fast. Purchase some organic fire starters as seen in the picture below and arrange 4 to 5 of them in the charcoal already poured in the grill. Ensure to spread them out. With the help of a lighter, light the fire starters and leave them in the open air to light the charcoal to the level of fire that you desire.

6. Or you can use an electric starter to light your coals

This is the most easiest form of lighting your coals. All you need is an electric starter and an electricity source. Place the device in the charcoal in the fire box, light it up and leave it to light the coals. Once you have a good number of coals lighted, turn of the starter and remove it. Leave the coals in the open air to have some more coals lighted.

7. Close the lid

Once the coals are lighting up fast, close the lid of the grill with the vents and dampers opened. This will preheat the grill, killing any existing germs in the grill and preparing it for the food to come in. Aim at heating the grill up to a range of 350 oF to 400 oF. You can determine the temperature level using the thermometer attached to the grill.

8. Open the lid to prepare for the food

Once the grill is well heated, carefully open the lid and take off the grill grates. You will ought to be extra careful in this process as the grill and grates will be very hot. Using a heat proof fire ladle, spread out the coal to have an even concentration of heat across the firebox. Afterwards, place the grates back.

9. Prepare the grates

Before the food is placed on the grates, they will need to be oiled to ensure that the food doesn't stick to the grates. Using a grill application brush coated with oil, evenly spread oil on all sides of the grates. Ensure to not use too much oil to avoid dripping into the fire as this will create a lot of unwanted smoke for the food.

10. Start cooking.

Next, place your food on the grill grates in a well arranged manner with enough space between the foods. Ensure that you food has been well marinated with the right spices as you prefer. Also, make sure to place a necessary amount of food on the grates without overcrowding. This may affect the doneness of the food if ignored.

11. Close the lid again

It is a must do practice to always close the lid of your grill for at least one and a half hours once the food has been introduced. This is to ensure the food is cooked in a stable temperature without heat interruptions that may affect the doneness of the foods. Also, keep the food in the desired temperature hot enough to cook the food fast but without burning.

12. Regulate temperatures using the dampers and vents

Every charcoal grill comes with dampers and vents to aid you in controlling heat or temperatures. As grilling aims at cooking food faster, you want to ensure that the level of heat in the grill is not too low which will cause it to cook for a longer period of time causing it to smoke. Opening the dampers or vents at different levels determine the amount of airflow that will go in and out of the grill. Determine the amount of heat against the amount of air that you want have, and control the these using the dampers and/ or vents. Use the thermometer attached to the grill to help you in determining the best temperatures for your food.

13. Remove the food

After the desired time of cook under the right temperatures, your food should be well done and ready to be served. Carefully open the lid and remove the food onto a platter. You can also use a food thermometer to check the inner doneness of the food to be sure that it is well cooked before it is served. If not, keep the food cooking over the fire, close the lid and keep cooking for a few more minutes. After, open it and get ready to serve.

14. Clean the grates immediately

The practice of cleaning your grates after eating is a very wrong thing to do. The best time to clean the grates is while it is still warm, hence, ensure to brush every stuck food on the grates away while it is still hot. You can do this even while the grill still has some fire in it. This is to ensure that a proper clean is done while the food residue is still soft. Once the coals are quenched and the grill has totally cooled, you can then wash the grill with some soapy water and metal sponge.

Source

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5HIBx4w8HpU

Tips and Tricks

1. Be adventurous with your charcoal kind

There are two main kinds of charcoal pieces to use for grilling with different ways of operation. These are lump charcoals and charcoal briquettes. Their essence are driven by their lighting style. Charcoal lumps are often bigger in size and quicker to light, but are the fastest to burn out. On the opposite, briquettes are harder in nature, slower to light and long lasting. Based on the your time essence and the level of heat that you are hoping to achieve per time, either of these types will serve your needs well based on their nature.

2. Marinate your food for an hour.

Due to the fact that grilling is a fast cooking way of barbecuing, an appropriate way of locking in as much flavor in your food is to marinate it for a long time, at least for an hour. Use fresh spices, veggies and some oil to marinate your foods and you will be blown away by the great taste and aromas that will be derived from your cook. The oil component in the marinade will aid in creating some crunchiness to the food. Try not to miss it.

3. Keep charcoal on standby

This is necessary especially if you are using lump charcoal. It is a practice of emergency to get your food in good heat even if your fire runs out unawares. You can quickly open the fire box and add some more coals and continue cooking without much damages.

4. Pre- remove the food before full doneness.

At least 5 minutes before the food is fully done. It is scientifically proven that foods still cook for at least 5 minutes after it has being removed from the fire. Hence, this is an important practice to have the food not to over cook and also allows the sizzling spices in the food to settle well before the food is enjoyed. Finally, this allows the food to cool to avoid burns in the excitement of eating a good food.

5. Always be safe when grilling

This is a super important tip as you will be dealing with a lot of heat. You want to ensure that you are using heat proof gloves and utensils when grilling so as to not create burns on your body while you cook. Even on grills, some makes come with cool to touch features on the outside to allow the user handle the grill at ease while cooking.

The Burn Blog features BBQ and Grilling Recipes, Stories, Reviews, latest news and details about Fiery Food Show and Scovie Awards. The navigation for recipes is separated into meal categories BBQ, Grilling, Smoking, beverages, holiday and seasonal and desserts. All you have to do is to click on the drop-down menu and select your preference and the blog will indicate the list of recipes to choose from. My favorite Post: It’s Done…When It’s Done.
Further reading
  • Follow Burn on Twitter
  • Follow Burn on Facebook
 

BBQ Pro

Founder: Gretchen and Jeff Blog Type: Multi-Author BBQ Pro Shop was founded out of love for BBQ grilling and smoking. Gretchen and Jeff got married in 2000 and began grilling together. They learnt to smoke ribs, barbeque and grill sausages and chicken. They share their passion of grilling and smoking through the website. The blog features recipes in detail, Great BBQ places, and technical guides about equipment. The online shop stocks tools, spices, sauces, smokers and details out recipes, clearance items on sale too are offer through the site. Whether you want to learn more about preparing for a barbeque and grilling you will find a variety of topics via the BBQ blog. You can even find a list of top BBQ blogs they recommend, BBP Pro Shop resource pages and BBQ Pro Shop Product Vendors. My favorite Post: How To Smoke A Brisket: Step By Step Infographic.
Further reading
  • Follow BBQ Pro on Twitter
  • Follow BBQ Pro on Facebook
 

Grilling Outdoor Recipes

Founder: Amy Aberle-Rogan Blog Type:Single-Author Founder Amy Aberle-Rogan has been a professional chef over the last seventeen years. Her passion for cooking started as a teenager where she enjoyed barbequing at Aberle Acres with her family. Amy lived in Italy and while there worked in various restaurants to gain culinary experience. She wrote a cookbook specializing in Italian cuisine. The Chef in Amy looks forward to creating delicious BBQ and grilling recipes on the website for all to enjoy. As the name suggests the site is dedicated to recipes and they are categorized under red meat, pork, poultry, seafood, burgers, sides and salads, pizzas, dessert and cocktails. The blog contains a selection of vegetarian recipes for those who love grilling but don’t consume meat. Sign up to their newsletter via the site and get latest updates and to be in constant touch with Amy for all your questions. My favorite Post: Charred Green Bean Crostini.
Further reading

  • Follow Grilling Outdoor Recipes on Facebook
 

Elsmere BBQ

Founder: Adam Powers and Jeremy Rush Blog Type: Multi-Author Adam Power’s cooking is heavily influenced by the years he spent in Southeast Asia. His long-time friend Jeremy Rush and Adam has over 40 years’ experience in the culinary field. Elsmere BBQ is a family restaurant serving out of two locations based in Maine and Willard Beach. What makes them unique is that their meat is guaranteed and no gas touches the meat. Food can be ordered through the site and food on offer are natural and highest quality meats and vegetables. BBQ bulk packages and bundles are available and on offer are slow savory smoked meats, grilled seafood, amazing appetizers and vegetarian/vegan options. Come on visit the site and grab a yummy BBQ bite and a drink. My favorite Post: Why you should go out to dinner more in 2018, even if you are on a budget..

  • Follow Elsmere BBQ on Facebook
 

Country Wood Smoke

Founder: Marcus Bawdon Blog Type: Single-Author Marcus Bawdon is a big noise in the UK BBQ scenario. He is the editor of the UK BBQ magazine and the author of Country Wood Smoke blog. He has a wealth of knowledge about BBQ which he shares with the community through the site. The site was launched in 2011 and the blog has grown during the last few years. The blog contains recipes categorized under BBQ, seafood, pizza, vegetables and bread. The best recipes with step by step photographs are shared and the fun does not stop there. The recipe corner includes dessert recipes too. If you like instructional videos, they even have a place for How to Videos on the site. You could connect with Markus through the site and what is more interesting is you can get a copy of the UK BBQ Magazine free if you log into the site. Wild Pepper

Founder: Jim Campbell and Kyle Leslie Blog Type: Single-Author Mild to Wild Pepper & Herb Company started off rather humbly as an idea by two Indianapolis firefighters. The idea of venturing into the business was thought out by Jim Campbell and Kyle Leslie while on vacation. The site offers a full range of products from chile sauces for retail sales and private labeling to bulk chile peppers to its customers. BBQ Sauces and Recipe ideas are organized in one corner of the site for readers to find what they are looking for. Gift packs of BBQ related items could be ordered through the site to giveaway at your loved one for their birthday, anniversary or any special day. You will find a listing of the stores across the country which carry Wild Pepper products. Please login to the site and frequent them. Home BBQ

Founder: Kevin Bevington Blog Type: Multi-Author Kevin has been cooking barbeque and grilling for over 30 years. He designed the Home BBQ site for BBQ enthusiasts and welcome contributions in the form of comments and recipes. He strives to assist the BBQ community through his site in producing a great BBQ. He has won many accolades from 2002 to 2018. They are on The Outdoor Cooking Channel every Sunday and Monday night. Past cooking shows can be watched via the site. Articles feature BBQ essentials, cooking tips and featured. The blog is home to Big Dan’s Place, Brian’s Place, Kevin’s Corner, Rempe’s Rants and Tim’s Corner. Reviews are categorized into equipment reviews and food reviews. The site also carries delicious recipes and the latest news on BBQ related activities. You could subscribe to Home BBQ site and get the most updated e-news and breaking news. My favorite Post: Cheap Grills, What Should You Buy? .

BBQ Addicts

Founder: Megan Day Blog Type: Multi-Author Megan is well known for winning the preliminary round beating all other pit masters to get a place in the Food Network’s Chopped Grill series finale. Title: Smoked Rib Recipes Which Will Melt In Your Mouth
Content:
Have you never tried Smoked Rib Recipes? It will be daunting if you have not tried it before. You are in for an amazing treat with these recipes. Smoking requires patience, love and lot of practice. Different meats cook differently. Prepare your smoker beforehand and getting the temperature right is equally important. You can use a variety of wood chunks for the smoker to get the right flavours. The layers of sauces and rubs does the trick and produces tasty, incredible tender and moist ribs. You are going to be the catalyst for change. And smoking time (and temperature) is very important cause you can overcook or undercook your food, then we think you might love this guide about smoking time and temperature

1. Mustard Smoked Ribs

Slow smoked for 3 hours, the Mustard and the Barbeque Sauce gives a refreshing change to this recipe. Makes a mouth-watering dish for the family. Everyone is sure to go for a second serving.

Recipe from Vindulge

2. Spirit Flavoured Baby Back Ribs

All the ingredients including the whiskey gives the smoked ribs an unusual flavor. These ribs are slow cooked until the meat comes off the bone. Get your ingredients together and set your smoker and just follow the easy recipe. [su_row class="ingredients-directions"] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Ingredients" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  • 1 rack baby back ribs
  • Marinade
  • 0.50 cup whiskey
  • 0.25 cup maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp minced onion
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Directions" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  1. Combine all the marinade ingredients in a bowl and leave aside.
  2. Take out the membrane from the backside of the ribs.
  3. Place the ribs in a Ziploc bag.
  4. Pour the marinade into the bag with ribs.
  5. Toss the bag well and leave in the refrigerator for 3 hours to marinate.
  6. After 3 hours discard the marinade.
  7. Take out the ribs from the refrigerator and allow them to come to room temperature.
  8. Set the smoker to a temperature of 250F.
  9. Place the ribs on the smoker and cover with lid.
  10. Flip once after a few hours.
  11. Leave in the smoker for 6 hours.
  12. Remove from the smoker when a thermometer reads about 195F.
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [/su_row]

Recipe from Smoked 'n Grilled

3. Asian Styled Creamy Smoked Ribs

The most juicy and tender smoked pork ribs made with apple juice, butter, honey and brown sugar. This will be your family’s pick for a weekend get-away. You can be certain that there will be no regrets. [su_row class="ingredients-directions"] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Ingredients" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  • 1 rack St Louis-style pork ribs
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 cup rib rub
  • 1/4 cup apple juice (in a spray bottle)
  • 1/2 cup butter, sliced
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 1 cup honey
  • 1-2 cups BBQ sauce
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Directions" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  1. Remove the membrane from the ribs.
  2. Rub olive oil on the ribs.
  3. Liberally apply the rub on all sides of the ribs.
  4. Preheat the smoker and set the temperature to 225F.
  5. Place the ribs on the smoker.
  6. At one hour and two hours intervals baste the ribs with apple juice.
  7. After completion of 3 hours remove the ribs.
  8. Apply brown sugar, butter and honey on the ribs.
  9. Wrap the ribs in foil and place on the smoker with meat side facing downwards.
  10. Leave once again on the smoker for 2 hours.
  11. Remove from the foil and leave on the smoker for one more hour.
  12. During the last 20 minutes of cooking apply the BBQ sauce.
  13. Remove from the smoker when the temperature reaches 195F.
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [/su_row]

Recipe from The Butter Half

4. Jack Daniels Baby Back Ribs

The recipe is slow cooked on the smoker and can’t be rushed, but the results are so worth it. Once cooked the ribs will fall off the bone tender with a smoky flavor. The ribs are spicy, sticky and sweet. [su_row class="ingredients-directions"] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Ingredients" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  • 1 large rack of baby back ribs membrane removed
  • 1 teaspoon each of kosher or sea salt,
  • 1 teaspoon of fresh ground black pepper
  • 1 teaspoon of ground cumin
  • 1 teaspoon of ground mustard seeds
  • 1 teaspoon paprika
  • 2 teaspoon onion powder
  • 2 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 0.50 teaspoon cayenne pepper
  • 2 teaspoon dark brown sugar
Mop Sauce
  • 2 tablespoon butter or vegetable oil
  • 0.50 cup chopped shallots
  • 0.25 teaspoon each of kosher or sea salt and fresh ground black pepper
  • 1 tablespoon each minced garlic and minced ginger
  • 2 tablespoon honey
  • 3 tablespoon dark brown sugar
  • 2 cups apple cider
  • 0.25 cup apple cider vinegar
  • 1 cup ketchup
  • 0.50 cup barbecue sauce
  • 2 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
  • 4 tablespoon Jack Daniels
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [su_column size="1/2" center="no" class=""][su_spoiler title="Directions" open="no" style="default" icon="chevron-circle"]
  1. Place all the rub ingredients in a bowl and combine.
  2. Brush the rub on all sides of the ribs.
  3. Place the ribs in a Ziploc bag and leave in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight.
  4. Preheat the smoker and add the wood chips or pellets.
  5. Place the marinated ribs directly on the smoker.
  6. Close the lid and cook for 2 ½ hours.
  7. Spritz with water and apple cider every 45 minutes.
  8. During the last ½ hour of cooking baste the ribs with the mop sauce.
  9. After completion of 2 ½ hours baste with the mop sauce once again.
  10. Wrap the ribs in aluminum foil and leave in the smoker for 1 ½ hours.
  11. After completion of 1 ½ hours take out the ribs from the foil.
  12. Slather mop sauce once again and leave for 1 hour.
  13. Slice and serve with the balance mop sauce.
  14. To prepare the Mop Sauce, place butter or oil in a saucepan and heat well.
  15. Toss in the shallots, salt and pepper and cook for 4 minutes until the shallots become soft.
  16. Stir in the ginger and garlic and combine well.
  17. Leave for another 3 minutes.
  18. Add the balance ingredients and bring to a boil.
  19. Lower the heat and cook for another 15 minutes.
  20. Allow the mixture to simmer and maintain the warmth.
  21. If you want to thicken the sauce combine cornstarch with a little water and add to the sauce.
[/su_spoiler] [/su_column] [/su_row]

Recipe from Just A Pinch

5. Simple BBQ Ribs

Once smoked the meat will fall off the bone. Tender, moist ad Smokey ribs are the best ever. They are so good that you don’t even need barbeque sauce for the ribs. Enjoy right away.

Recipe from Joy Filled Eats

6. Divine Smoked Ribs

It is all about the rub and the rub with pepper and spices gives a divine flavor to the ribs. The recipe does not require a BBQ sauce. Vinegar and apple juice is used for basting during the smoking process.

Recipe from Kevin Is Cooking

By the way, I asked recipe owners for permission to feature their work on this post. If you want your recipe to be featured, please contact me

Title: 5 Of The Best BBQ Rubs For The Tastiest Of Delicacies
Content:
You can never go wrong with a bbq rub, and most interestingly, you may rather keep your rub as a secret to get everyone praising you for great dishes. BBQ rubs are that good, but with a bad blend, you will be all the way up for a disaster. So, to keep you on good grounds, we thought to share 5 of the best bbq rubs that will suit every kind of need. These are the most preferred bbq rubs and sauces which give the best of tastes and leave your foods super crispy on the outside. Quick tip on using them for excellent results, always ensure to pat dry your meat and generously coat your meat with as much of the rub as you need to ensure that it sticks well on the meat. However, ensure to gauge your tastes as you drizzle, else you will be up for sharp tastes that are not ideal for a serve. [supsystic-tables id=52]  

Choosing your best rubs; what to look out for?

What is its purpose?

Every rub, be it store bought or homemade is put together to spice up different kinds of meats. Many others are all-rounders to spice up all kinds of meat. The difference here lies in the intensity of the taste to be derived, hence, you will need to consider the deep essence of taste when making a taste choice. For example; if you are solely up for strong lamb flavoring, we will recommend a specially made lamb rub, but if deep tastes aren’t a key factor, the best option to go for is an all-purpose rub.

Is it a healthy blend?

With the outrage of varying sicknesses all around, a major consideration to choosing your rubs will be their contents. This is very important and cannot be considered carelessly. Avoid strongly chemicalized rubs as these will harm your body in the long run. Look out for the ingredients list and ensure that 95% of its contents are natural spice blends. These will boost the taste of your foods better and will keep you healthy. Also, use this list to check for ingredients that you may be allergic to, and avoid the ones that may cause you problems. It is better to be preventive than sorry. Do not be driven by fancy names, always go for healthy stuff.

What are your favorite spices?

Definitely, a must check. We all have our favorite kinds of spices and will definitely love to have one or two in our rubs. If this is you too, feel free to be selective. Look out for those special ingredients and choose as you desire. However, note that you may be prone to similar aromas always. Hence, if this is not much of an issue for you, happy rubbing!! Otherwise, mix up your choices for different aromas. The good thing about rubs is the fact that one blend does not necessarily have to serve all, so the mix in taste is flexible. Feel free to alter your them with your special blends until you achieve your desire.

Are your taste buds that demanding?

How much of taste levels are you hoping to achieve? Different ingredients offer different things. Some are great on flavors while others are best on tastes. If you are drawn towards indulging tastes, you may want to choose salt or sugar based rubs to give you these. Otherwise, if you are for flavors and more blandness, you should look out for rubs that have flavor spices, e.g, paprika, garlic, ginger, celery, and the list is totally up to you. To be on a safer side as a tip, you can always go for flavor based rubs and create your own tastes with some coarse salt at home. Like we said earlier, the alteration of your blends is up to you, and the same thing applies here.

Review of the best BBQ rubs

1. Bad Bryon’s Butt Rub Barbecue Seasoning

This made it to our list as one of the best commercial BBQ rubs there is to find serving itself as an all rounder one for pork, chicken, lamb, eggs, steak, and even popcorn and bread. It is this good with a good balance in taste making it one that is loved by many barbecue professionals and grandmasters. Made of an ingredient blend of onion, garlic, salt, pepper, paprika and chipotle (smoked jalapeno), and gluten-free, a little bit of this rub turns everything into a worth of goodness. It is very healthy to use, almost perfect for all health needs. As the name goes, good things only happen when you use this rub on your delicacies. A little goes a long way!

Pros

  • Great taste on food
  • Well priced
  • No sugar

Cons

  • May be spicy
Check Price on Amazon

2. Bone Suckin’ Sauce Original Seasoning and Rub

A fast selling kind that makes it a high competition bbq rub. This should easily tell you of its goodness making it one that is off the shelves in a split of a moment. It is the perfect kind to use for absolutely everything that can be grilled or smoked. Great for pork, ribs, steaks, and vegetables, and will have been super perfect if it was that good for chicken, but this is totally a taste bud issue. So, based on your preferences, this is likely to be great on your poultry too. An all natural spice blend made with chili pepper, bell pepper, mustard flour, celery powder, citric acid, natural flavor, has no MSG and is gluten-free. This a good one when we preach health, and we applaud the makers for this. It may, however, be a strong blend, so moderation can be considered when using it. Aside from the odds, we advise you purchase more than 1 container, it runs fast in the kitchen and runs fast on shop shelves.

Pros

  • Best rub for veggies
  • Perfect sweet and spicy balance
  • All natural rub

Cons

  • Sells fast
  • Not the best for chicken
Check Price on Amazon

3. Spiceologist Greek Freak BBQ Dry Rub and Seasoning

If you are up for something stronger and eccentric, this is one of the top-ranked bbq rubs to buy. It is a perfect blend of dried rosemary, dried basil, sun-dried tomato bits, orange peel powder, dried onion, sunflower oil, yeast, and salt to give you that Mediterranean spark in your foods. It is that true all-rounder rub that goes well with absolutely everything. Greek food is one of the world’s top-ranked and for a seasoning that offers this flavor, this is all you need for the difference. Then, goodness us, the packaging of this blend is something we think its competitors should learn from. Very modern and catchy! Making you say a yes to the product before you even read about its content. This is a very subtle spice blend and if you need some more taste in it, just balance it out with some salt. Never disappointing Greek aromas!

Pros

  • Subtle taste
  • Diversely aromatic
  • 100% natural
  • An all-rounder

Cons

  • Salt may be too little
  • May not suit the American taste
Check Price on Amazon

4. Plowboy’s Yardbird Rub

The manufacturers seem to be good at their stuff and this rub is one to attest to it. Being a sweet and spicy based rub, this is a bbq rub for ribs; pork and also poultry. It is one of the best that is available online to buy and comes with vast availability, you almost never run out. With an ingredient list of salt, sugar, chili pepper, paprika, garlic, onion, and mustard flour, this one is never too much to have on your meats. Drizzle as you like, but be wise about it though. If too salty for you, the best treatment will be to balance it with brown sugar. However, you will never be tired of having it. This brand has a long interesting history and for this, we believe you will be telling more good about it as you use it.

Pros

  • Excellent flavor combo
  • Good pricing
  • Amazing tastes on chicken

Cons

  • Might be salty
Check Price on Amazon

5. McCormick Grill mates Smokehouse Maple

This sweet and smoky choice is one of the best BBQ rubs for sale at the moment. It has an intelligent and loaded blend of brown sugar, salt, chili pepper, black pepper, cinnamon, celery seed, garlic, onion, sugar, tomato, corn maltodextrin, silicon dioxide, apple cider vinegar solids, extractives of paprika, natural flavor with mesquite smoke, disodium inosinate and guanylate. This is not the perfect all natural blend of a rub but for the flavor it exudes, you couldn’t ask for more. It is great on chicken, fish or pork; and if you need to use it on anything else, it still has the tendencies of giving you excellent tastes and aromas. Use as much as you want, and you will be grateful for the great blend. On the other hand, be sure that all the ingredients are great for your health before you use it although widely, this may work for everybody.

Pros

  • Subtle taste and flavor
  • Good balance of spices
  • A good all-rounder rub

Cons

  • Many additives
  • Could spark allergic reactions
Check Price on Amazon

Which is our overall best BBQ rub?

With a short list of BBQ dry rubs, choosing from the list of almost equal goodness even seems tough. However, for the one that is a perfect balance of all five, we choose the Bad Bryon’s Butt Rub Barbecue Seasoning. This has gotten a very good name for itself and for the fact that it turns any bland food into something that you will keep drooling over, this is a mastery of an art. It is a miser’s choice, or better said a good budget rub. A little of it goes a long way and we are thankful for the perfect blend that serves this need. It is 100% natural and gluten-free, making it appreciated for its health factor. Use it on your pork ribs, steak, brisket, chicken, turkey, veggies, bread, popcorn and just everything. You will be amazed at the tasty changes. As you learn of this gift of a rub, make sure to share the goodness with everyone else.

Title: The Best Smoker Boxes For Gas Grill For Effective Use
Content:
Are you in this part of the world that knows that smoke flavored foods are an item not to ever miss? You are definitely in a good place. In this review, we talk about the best smoker boxes for gas grill to up your game of barbecuing. The challenge for you there that has a gas grill and not sure how to smoke up your foods just ended. Thanks to smart inventors, there are a good amount of these smoke generating devices that allow you burn wet wood chips while you cook to give you all the flavors from the wood that you need. Don’t tuck your gas grill away, choose from our 4 top rated selection, attach it to your gas grill and thank us later for the mind-blowing flavors. [supsystic-tables id=53]  

What will the best kind offer you?

It will be made with a good metal

Either with cast iron, steel or some durable metal. A smoker box made with cheap metal will definitely last you for a short while as it will burn off as you use it. If care is not taken, you may actually melt the metal from the heat coming from the grill, and this is definitely not what you want. Aim for the strongest of metals in make as it will be solely used for heavy duty smoking so you want to ensure that it is purposed for this. Don’t go cheap, and neither pretty that may cost you. Buy quality now, and have rest for many days.

It will be properly designed

Every good smoker box should have properly created holes on it to allow smoke escape from the box while you cook. It should also be able to prevent ashes from escaping into the food. This will be a troublesome buy if you go for a poorly designed box as you will have to deal with brushing ashes off your food after you cook. Make sure to check with great reviews on the product to ensure that you do not encounter such problems.

It will have a non-stick coating

Non-stick coating simply allows for an easy clean after cooking. While the wood burns, ashes are likely to get stuck in the box. Also, if your box is located beneath the food, juices, and grease from the food will drop into the box causing a stain. Cleaning afterward then becomes a simple chore due to its non-stick coating feature for wiping everything with ease.

It will have an easy open lid

While cooking, wood chips may burn off before the food reaches its doneness. This will call for a top up, hence a box with a lid that can be easily opened will save you a lot of stress. You will also want to ensure that its hinges are firmly secured to prevent the lid from falling off too easily. Ensure to use heatproof tongs when opening the lid, most especially, while it is hot to prevent skin burns.

Review of the best smoker box for gas grills

1. Cave Tools Smoker Box Maximum Wood Chip

A great value smoker that gives you extra room to create more smoke with an even spread for the cook. This is an amazing smoker box for gas grill Walmart. Unlike other Cave Tool small smoker boxes, this product is designed to fill in enough wood chips for a long period of cook without the need for a refill. It is a better smoke enhancer due to its design which allows wood chips to be spread over a flat surface with compactness, and this means, more wood chips get to burn at the same time giving you a perfect and even outburst of smokiness. For its large smoking area, this may be a challenge if your gas grill is small, but if its size can fit into your grill, then it is highly recommendable to get. Like many other Cave Tools products, this one comes with added tutorial videos and recipes to aid you in building your skills, especially for a beginner smoker.

Pros

  • Heavy duty build
  • High smoke output
  • Sturdy and strong
  • Flat bottom for evenness

Cons

  • Too thick in build
  • Specific size make
Check Price on Amazon

2. Charcoal Champion Stainless Steel V-Shape Smoker Box

Making a smoker box seems like a very thoughtful process and this V-shaped smoker box attests to it. It is designed in a well thought out plan to burn wood chips in a good way while keeping all residue from the burn within the box. It has numerous amounts of holes at the top of it which releases smoke well onto the food. This way also, ashes do not stand the chance of flying into the food as they settle at the bottom of the smoker box during the cook. It is a durable stainless steel make and purposely designed to handle heavy-duty tasks. It is not a large box as the Cave Tool’s but its hinged lid makes it very easy to add wood chips to the box without any interruption to the cook. After smoking, enjoy the ease of cleaning it by just emptying the box and giving it a simple wipe.

Pros

  • Sits well between flame deflectors bars
  • Very effective
  • Easy to clean

Cons

  • Could easily rust
Check Price on Amazon

3. Grill Pro 00150 Cast Iron Smoker Box

This wood chip smoker box is one of the most simple to use on the market making it one that is great for a beginner. It can be purchased in either cast iron or stainless steel form, totally up to your preference. On top of it sits 6 wide holes that allow for a good amount of smoke to spread onto the food as it cooks, securing the aromas of flavored smoke into your food. The shortfall may be with a higher amount of ashes that may blow onto the food which we spoke about earlier. It is easy to use and a very straightforward tool which will last you for many days as you use it. Always remember to clean properly after use to avoid clogged ashes that may alter the aroma of smoke when you use it the next time.

Pros

  • Small but effective
  • Simple to use
  • Easy to use

Cons

  • The lid does not close well
  • Easily cracked
Check Price on Amazon

4. Weber 7576 Universal Stainless Steel Smoker Box

Like the brand name goes, this is the best smoker box for Weber grills, so your needs are sorted if you get one of theirs. Place your choice wood chips in this and place it beneath the grill grates. The rise of smoke to your food is beautiful with a lot of infusions done just right. Its stainless steel makes it durable and long lasting for repeated use over many days. It is simple to use and adding wood chips in the process of smoking is made easier because of its hinged lid. On top of it a wide spread of holes that exudes smoke well, but leaves ashes within the box. Cleaning afterward is easy, empty the box and brush out any excess ash that is attached to it. There you are, a clean box for the next use.

Pros

  • Stainless steel built
  • Fits well beneath grill grates
  • Easy to use

Title: Best Grill Grates Selection For The Most Beautiful Barbecues
Content:
You probably didn’t think that grill grates had a big part to do with how well barbecues are done, right? They almost seem like a feature that you can skip, but no, they are not. Grill grates position foods well over the fire, suck in good heat which is transferred to the food and are responsible for all those pretty marks you see. However, using the right grill grates goes a long way to determine the perfection of your food, hence, we share details of the best grill grates out there for your excellent BBQs. [supsystic-tables id=54]  

What are the perfect features of good grill grates.

Strong and durable

Grill grates are solely made from metal because of their direct placement over fire or heat, hence for such excruciating pressure on the metal, it has to be made of very good material. Some tested materials that are proven to be durable are chrome steel, aluminum steel, cast iron steel etc. Read about the material make of the grill grate before making your purchase to ensure that they are strong and will last you for a very long time. Cheaply made grates are very likely to go bad shortly and if not careful may melt over the fire while you cook. Make sure to avoid this against pricing.

Good heat transfer

Different metals conduct heat higher than others. Some in other cases, like copper, are good for holding high levels of heat which may not be the best if used for your grill grates as this may burn your food fast. Meanwhile, other metals are good conductors of heat for grill grates which hold in a necessary amount of heat that is transferred to your food while it cooks. This means, your food doesn't just cook by direct fire only but has some cooking done by the heat contributed from the metal.

Non-stick surface

Nobody wants to have to grill and struggle with removing your food from the grates. Hence, do not compromise on purchasing non- stick grill grates, otherwise, we bet that you will hate your grilling life for a long time. A non-stick element to consider is porcelain and goodly, most grates come with this feature. Therefore, this should not be hard to find.

Well designed

Most standard kinds are lined horizontally, vertically or cross diagonally. These are all fine and should be able to do you a good job. However, the amount of spacing left between each mark is what you should be considering. The perfect grates should allow you grill small foods like small tomatoes over them without any falling into the fire. This is to ensure that all food kinds can easily be leveled on them. In the same way, they ought to be straight to allow you balance your food with ease. Crooked grates are a waste of time, so do yourself a favor and ignore them. Then, if you are up for pretty marks (we think you should) on your foods, they are specially designed grates that can be placed on the standard grates to create those appetizing marks on your food.

Review of best grill grates

1. Weber 7638 Porcelain-Enameled Cast Iron Cooking Grates for Spirit 300 Series Gas Grills

Cast iron is one of the best-preached metal material and for the grates to be made of them, we couldn’t ask for more. It has the tendencies of holding good amounts of heat for faster and even cook. It is gladdening that Weber has one of these made with this material. To top it up, it is coated with porcelain which offers a non-stick and durable feature. If you are on a budget and up to have a grill grate that will last you the longest, this make is the one to go for. Although, it is specifically designed for the Spirit 300 Series. Hence, if your grill is not this make, you may still use cast iron with porcelain coating as a basis for purchasing your kind. This seems like all you need for a good cook with an amazing grid design to keep your food leveled while you cook. No need for portions hanging off the grids and no fears of burning your food. You can also be sure to have some really good marks on your food when done because of the rich thickness of metal for the grids. Quite a pricey kind, but for its make, this is an investment worth the have.

Pros

  • Durable
  • Makes pretty food marks
  • Holds heat well
  • Non-stick

Cons

  • Only for the Spirit 300 series
  • Pricey
Check Price on Amazon

2. Weber 7436 Replacement Hinged Cooking Grate

Weber never ceases to amaze us with their good collection of grilling products and this hinged replacement grill grate is one of no exception. The struggle of having to remove hot grates from the firebox just to add charcoal is solved with this grate. It is hinged to allow you to add charcoal pieces while cooking. Just release the hinge, flip up the opened side and fill up your firebox. Obviously, with a brand like this, we expected that its material make will not be disappointing and of a truth, these grates are made of stainless steel that will last you for long. The grids are also well positioned to prevent food from falling into the fire while you cook and firm enough to give you some pretty marks on your food. Also, handle or adjust the grates with its attached handle, although not cool touch, they still help with easy adjustments. Use a heatproof glove when handling, however. Finally, remember to clean the grates with a grill brush while still warm to prevent rusts.

Cons

It is a stronger make of the above but comes with a standard design. Like most cooking grates for Weber grills out there, this one allows you to cook your food in all the right senses. It is highly resistant to rust and has grids that keep your food laid evenly while cooking. Coming in twos per pack, this quality of Weber grates may be expensive but for its durable make, we will say it is a good numbering. For a good quality stainless steel make, it is advisable to prepare the grates before placing your food on them as these are not non-stick. Make sure to apply some oil for grill grates on them before placing your food on them to prevent the foods from sticking to the metal. A better option to use will be grill mats to save you the battle of having to remove foods from the grates. Afterward, clean them while warm to prevent any openings for rust. Although they are specially made to block rusts, it is better to be preventive.

Another cast iron with porcelain coating from the Weber guys. The first thing we love about this one is its design made well to fit into the Q300 or 3000 Weber series. This again is a shortfall to those who do not have this make of a grill, so, we encourage you to purchase similar qualities of this grate if you are bent on having the same things. Looking at what it offers, this set of tools are like twins to the other cast iron make in this selection except for the fact this version has proven to rust after a while of use. It is therefore not as long lasting as the other but will serve you the needs of cooking with perfect doneness, making them pretty and preventing sticking. It is easy to clean but the same rules apply; clean while warm using a brush for porcelain grates. Afterward, do a water cleaning and dry.

They are strongly made to last for a long time and stand the test of heavy duty cooking. You are sure to have a good use without rusting which makes it safe for cooking. The grids are evenly layered for good food balancing which aids with excellent doneness. Cast iron holds heat well and aids with faster cooking and this product offers just that. Finally, prettiness is an attribute for it that we can’t leave without saying. Be prepared to have all the beautiful marks on your food in store while the porcelain coating prevents the food from sticking to the grates.

Title: 5 Of The Best Meat Injectors For The Juiciest Of Meat
Content:
It is always a great idea when there is some kind of a new invention up to change the game, and of no doubt are meat injectors. Marination! Heck Yes, is the game changer when you soak your meats in those amazing blends of spices. The results can't be explained. But hold on before you settle, a whole new grind to this business of marination is rather injecting meats with the blended spices and be ready to grill in a matter of no time, hence the best meat injectors in this review. Your meats just got tastier, juicier and healthier with this introduction of a machine that allows you to not just soak your meats in spice blends, but allows the adverse to be true. Explore these 5 options that we love best and get all your food fully packed with tastes. [supsystic-tables id=55]  

How do you know which injector choose?

Check for its capacity

This is a very preferential feature as you may either prefer to use the injector either domestically or commercially. It is better to use one with a smaller tank for domestic use which will be fine enough to suit your needs. On the other hand, do purchase one with a bigger tank for commercial uses as you will not want to have to refill your tank a number of times while prepping your foods up. The wise choice will obviously save you a lot of time and energy.

Check the needle type

Each type may offer different needle size, so as simple as it is, look out for the needle type that you need for what and make your purchase to match it. You cannot be careless here as the wrong needle type chosen may cost you unnecessarily. The good thing is that most types come with at least 2 needles for different sizes of meat. So, no need to rush your buy, be sure that it will work for you in numerous meat cases and we believe you will be comfortable.

How easy is it to clean?

Remember that the injector will be sitting in liquids that will be injected into meats, so you want to ensure that it is in a clean bacteria free state as much as possible. Make sure the kind you choose can either be easily separated to be cleaned and sterilized or can be cleaned by a dishwasher. If it will be tough to do at least any of these two, you know what the answer is. Ignore it!!

Is the material make good?

These devices are either made of plastic or stainless steel, which are friendly to interact with the liquids you use. Whatever your choice is, make sure that the material make is safe, so as to not have your marinade interacting with wrong acids or bacteria. If you do not want to scan through to hard, then simply go with plastic or stainless steel injectors.

Reviews of the best meat injectors

Such a powerful tool that gives you total control while marinating. It has a gun like design which makes it very different from the rest allowing for total control when handling. In its zipper bag of a pack, the gun comes with 4 commercial grade needles for heavy duty stuff and 3 brushes to aid with a good clean afterward. We prefer to describe this as a commercial injector because of its ease of use and extra needles. On price, it may be pricey but we think that the offer can be matched to its price. Get a 12-month warranty when you purchase it, and truth be told, you may actually not need the warranty as the gun is well built to last for a long time of use.

  • Meddles not sealing well

It also sits in its pack extra silicon rings for replacements when needed. It is stainless steel from head to bottom and attests to be long lasting without issues of rust. Can you mount it up easily?

Exactly! Or will you prefer having your light falling into the food every now and then? Of course not! Check its heat emission

The heat from your grill is enough to last you for the night and you do not want to add on more heat coming from your light. Title: Best Grill Pans For Mind Blowing Indoor Barbecues
Content:
Grill pans are part of a cook's essential as they allow for a good cook with pretty designs indoor. You can make anything with it and we especially love them for improvisation too. For example, you can make some crunchy paninis with them and you will be blessed by the results. Tag along as we share the best grill pans that will take your cooking to a whole new level. They are often great in space, you literally can make food for 3 or more people in one turn. [supsystic-tables id=57]  

Choosing the most appropriate grill pan

Grill pans are simply designed inventions but need a few checks here and there to be sure that they are the best kind for an amazing job.

What's is the material build.

The best material choice for them is often cast iron for the kind of heavy duty cooking that the pan will be involved. To prevent your pan from melting over the fire, ensure to get a make that is strong and durable to stand the pressure of direct for heating it. The good make will also ensure that it holds a good amount of heat to cook the food well

They should have a non- stick coating.

Yes and yes!! They ought to. Grilling is often done with little oil leaving the pan with very little grease to get the work done. The non-stick element then comes in to ensure that the food does not stick to the bottom of the pan while it cooks. This prevents hardships when cooking. The non-stick element also comes in handy for ease when cooking, however, ensure that this coating is not a hindrance to the good amount of heat that will be needed to cook the food well.

They should be properly lined within

Most grill pans are often lined 1 to 2 centimeters apart with 0.5 centimeters of depth to allow the juices of the food drop A good set up like this will allow your food to cook out nicely giving you a good press in marks for the appetizing look that you will love to see. Make sure the lines within are not jam-packed as this will defeat the purpose of having a beautiful grill.

They should have cool to touch handles

This is very important as the heated metal will give you a bad burn if the heat reaches its handles. It is better to choose ones that have cool to touch handles to aid you with comfortable handling. Using napkins or cooking gloves are ok, but if there is the option to avoid the extra task, you might as well go for it even if it costs you a little more dollars
